text: A warm greeting followed by a delicious dinner served by friendly happy servers .... What more can you want ?? I had read about their duck parfait app which to my dismay was not on the menu that night !!! A quiet inquiry and lo &behold , the duck parfait app was delicious !!! Squad leader had a tenderloin and i had rack o lamb in a delicious veg succotash. A delicious meal w/ exemplary service mere steps from Fable Christchurch Hotel. . Highly recommend

Twenty Seven Steps - what a spot! Intimate space in a lovely location with great service, expansive wine selection and they are happy to make you a tasty mocktail that suits your palate. 

Now... the food. Epic. Seasonal. Simple. Divine. I started with their marinated tomato salad which was fresh and flavorful. Entree was the steak with potato, onion rings and veggies - absolutely incredible. Naturally I had to save room for dessert and landed on the vanilla crème brûlée (though all the options sounded amazing). It came with fresh fruit and pistachio biscotti and was a great way to round out the meal. 

I would come back here again and again and again. Bravo!!

Visited here while on my stop in Christchurch. Easily the best meal I had in town. They're on the second floor, above their sister restaurant, Downstairs. Upon being seated, the server was extremely thorough going over the menu and offered excellent recommendations. I got the duck liver pate and their lamb. Both were incredible, especially the duck liver pate. Will definitely be back if I'm in town again

Everything in here was amazing! One of my favorite places!

The service is top-notch. They are so attentive and flexible depending on the needs of the table. 
The food is always on point and priced reasonably.
Cute 2nd story location, in a bit of a smaller space but the tables are spaced appropriately and comfortably away from other guests.

Make sure to make reservations as they do get quite busy.
Cool atmosphere, great service, and the good food. The soup and monkfish was delicious!

Everything really.  Staff very friendly but that venison meal was just superb 
I am booking real early next time to make I can get a table 
:)

really wonderful restaurant and wine bar. they have a changing menu that has very unique creations. staff is super friendly and welcoming. sadly i don't live near here, otherwise i would've been here all the time!

It's a pretty fully booked place and it's almost impossible to get in without a booking. Luckily enough, the sister restaurant downstairs allowed us to sit down but still order from upstairs. 
The food is okay I guess. I was way too hyped about it so it was a bit let down that the food didn't live up to my hype. It wasn't the restaurants fault. The service is really good. Food wise, it's not bad at all but I wouldn't necessarily come back again cos it's just fine. But not like Wow kinda food.

Grilled peach salad was exceptional only to be topped by the Monkfish. Excellent sauces, exquisite mix of veggies & greens. The dark chocolate hazelnut tort -  delicious. Lovely setting & excellent service. Highly recommend.

Don't get this place confused with the sister restaurant downstairs. Twenty Seven Steps is upstairs (and ONLY upstairs). Tiny place so reservations are highly recommended. I wasn't able to make one but they were able to squeeze me in (party of one) if I finished in less than an hour which I did. Seating is a little cramped in some areas but I appreciate them for trying to accommodate as may guests as they can. Food is fantastic and high quality and pricing is fair. Portions are adequate and I was stuffed. Service is standard.

Very tasty. Great service. Nice environment.   
 
Strong recommended!

Too many characters need to do.
This darling little restaurant serves fantastic food and very good wine. Reservations are a must! The vegetarian offerings are always excellent, which I appreciate.
Have to thank ChatGTP for the recommendation. What a cute little restaurant with fantastic food. Definitely make a reservation as this place gets busy.

Excellent dinner. You go upstairs to the restaurant which was a wee bit of a surprise as downstairs is merely a waiting area. Stater we had a superb "special" duck pate and fir main I had a wonderful fresh pea risotto, my partner loved the lamb rack. Sticky dare pudding was easily big enough to share and yummy too. Will be back for sure.
Great place hidden upstairs from Main Street of New Regent St. wonderful food and great ambience. Well worth the visit.
This restaurant and the food was amazing. I highly recommend it. Our waiter was Dean and he was extremely attentive and made great food recommendations. This was our best dinner in New Zealand.

This restaurant will not disappoint you. Before going I searched Yelp and found Twenty Seven Steps with super ratings/reviews. The appearance of the restaurant is a bit underwhelming but that just added to its appeal. We had the mushroom risotto and grouper, their fish of the day. Both dishes were excellent and cooked to perfection. The staff was friendly and very efficient. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Alright so I hate to be the dissenter but this place was just ok for me. The food tasted great but the portions were exceeding small. I got the lamb rack which was four pieces, each with meat about the size of a cherry tomatoe (see picture). There was a small serving of potatoes and a meatball as well with veggies. At $42, it was definitely overpriced. I have had bigger portions at about half the price for the same taste elsewhere in NZ. The service was hectic and spotty. I think they may have taken the modern European thing a bit too far.

Lamb kidney surprised us the most. Rich flavor, well combined, please order one if you feel like trying something new today. Beef fillet is above average. Overall the food was good, but seatings are all very close to each other. You can easily get bumped by people walking by.

My wife and I recently had a nice dinner at Twenty Seven Steps. During our visit I ordered the White Onion, Cider & Apple Soup, the Roast Canterbury Lamb Rack, and the Black Forest & Dark Chocolate Delice. The soup was rich, flavorful, and lightly sweet. The lamb was juicy and tender and paired with a seasoned meatball, savory mashed potatoes, and tender veggies. The chocolate delice featured rich chocolate, fresh juicy strawberries and cherries, and creamy ice cream. Overall, Twenty Seven Steps is a quality spot for a nice dinner.
This was a real treat during my visit to New Zealand and Christchurch in particular.  Delicious and unique flavors.  Wait staff very helpful and friendly.

Our daughter made this reservation for us while visiting New Zealand and we are so happy she did!  It's not easy to find, but oh so worth it.  My husband had the Venison and I had the Lamb.  Both were cooked to perfection.  Our wine from the region was perfect, too.  Service was amazing too.  If you visit Christchurch, New Zealand, you must eat here, however, make sure you make reservations, since it's always full.

Sometimes I am completely surprised by how good restaurant is when it looks more like a bistro - this was one of those times. During our visit to Christchurch we found several interesting places to eat and wanted to make our last night special by choosing this locally well rated restaurant. 

As the name suggests, you enter by climbing 27 steps to find a very small space with minimalist furnishings of very simple tables and chairs. A small complete bar is to your right as you enter - we were quickly seated at a postage stamp sized table. The menu is basically what the chef fancies to prepare for dinner - so on-line menus just list items that are basic rather than recommended for each evening. I enjoy one of the best prepared filet Mignons I have eaten in a long time and shared some of my wife's risotto and a house made bread to make a wonderful tasting meal! Although they were very busy, our server took her time with us to ensure we got the best of what they had to offer - including a very tasty Pinot Noir fro the region. 

Highly recommend and will be back!

Very popular and thus crowded Christchurch bistro, upstairs (27 steps--get it?) from the pedestrian restaurant street. Good but not memorable food. The usual friendly and sincere New Zealand service. It was an enjoyable dinner.

Delicious food and lovely atmosphere upstairs on New Regent St. However, the waitress we had tonight was very abrupt and did not seem very genuine at all. I know it can be tiring working in hospitality but we did not feel like valued customers even though we were paying the $$$ prices. We were hurried through our entree and main, and the request of dessert was hurried. We said no to dessert as we weren't ready, and the bill immediately came to the table. We hadn't finished our drinks and felt like we were just being pushed out the door. We had a reservation by the way, 6pm, Sunday night. Hardly a peak busy night where they are trying to turn people through quickly. Otherwise service was prompt and "polite" enough. But not warm or inviting. 
Anyway - if you've made it this far - the food was so lovely! I had pan seared scollops with pork belly and a perfectly cooked beef fillet with potato gratin. 
4 stars because of the waitress's attitude.

I enjoyed a fabulous dinner with family and friends here. We booked the second sitting (7.30pm) and were seated at a very nice table. There is a blackboard menu and menus on the table, then staff make sure they explain the dishes also - this is very helpful as people receive information in different ways, a good idea. We enjoyed marvellous food - entrees were Scallops, Soup and Pork, then main courses were Angus steak, Venison and Risotto - all were served beautifully and totally divine. We were treated with friendly but professional and respectful service throughout the evening. The serving staff, particularly Natalie, were thoroughly delightful. Natalie paid particular attention to my brother, whose birthday we were there to celebrate. Thank you - I look forward to coming again.

Call. If you can't get through, email. But if you are a foodie and you're in Christchurch, EAT HERE. The food is spectacular. The chef prepares interesting, locally sourced masterpieces paired with an excellent wine list.  The two appetizers (entrees for our friends from everywhere else) we chose were a scallop special and the calamari. Both were creative, smart and delicious.  The mains were a special risotto of pears and spring onions and ricotta that tasted so much like freshness on a plate, and the venison special, which melted in our mouths.  Dessert (embarrassing, I know, that we kept eating) was a blood orange crème brûlée that we just couldn't resist. Service was attentive and fun. Decor is minimal and chic. Get here. Don't miss it.

We just happened upon this place during our visit, and last stop, in Christchurch. it seemed slow in dead on the first floor but we were led up to the second floor and saw how packed and lively it was! We decided to split three courses, all were exceptional. The first course we ordered were are the sautéed lamb kidneys, something neither of us have had before and it was so flavorful very tender. We have been so impressed with the meat in New Zealand so we ordered the aged Canterbury 200g beef cooked medium rare. Wow. You will taste nothing like this in the United States. Highly recommend!!!! For dessert, we ordered one of their seasonal selections which had a confit pear, ice cream, caramel popcorn, and praline. All plated so beautifully.

If you don't have a reservation, come early because they are packed (and with good reason). The food was HEAVENLY - I had the risotto of the day and will dream about it for years to come. The scallops were phenomenal and juicy, I would highly recommend them. The salmon pâté was also delicious. Overall, one of the best meals I've ever had.

Recommend reservations if you want to attend here. I would give it 6 out of five. The food is sublime and both meals we ordered was as fresh as could be and melted in the mouth. The before dinner bread was so perfectly soft it was like cake. Very nice asthetic to this place and yes its romantic. Meals are higher priced around $40 dollars but you see where the money goes in the quality. Very popular.

The meals were superb and they were extremely flexible and accommodating with our dietary needs.The staff was very freindly and professional and service was excellent. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

This restaurant is great for vegetarians too!  We started with a salad.  Had the risotto and a plate with a whole slow roasted beet, smoked shredded potato, cashew cream and greens.  It was magnificent and tasted so much better than it reads.  Menu changes based on freshest available.  I would trust them to always create something fantastic.  Great selection of wines by the glass with knowledgeable servers.  Service and atmosphere are relaxed, comfortable and professional.  I would go back right now for the same dishes.
Our whole party of 4. Thoroughly enjoyed our meal. Risotto, lamb x2, fish. Topped it off with a bottle of wine from Hawkes Hill.

We had one meal in Christchurch before leaving the next morning for home and I'm so glad we chose 27 Steps. We walked in at the opening time of 5pm as we didn't have reservations and for the entire hour we were there a handful of tables were seated during that time; Pro Tip: have an early dinner! We had the scallop and chorizo app, 300g rib eye special, and a couple cocktails. The star of the show was the Rib Eye with duck fat and horseradish cream; I have lived in the Midwest US for the past 5 years and I thought it was in definite competition with steak I have had in the meat Mecca, which is saying a lot. Sadly we didn't stay for dessert but they had several that I considered, get one so I can live vicariously thru you.

We made reservation for Friday night for 3. Depsite the place being pretty busy, service was great.  They start you off with wonderfully fresh sourdough pumpkin hummus bread.  They also had a pretty extensive wine list with delicious selections!

The most delicious part of our meal was the chargrilled chicory, cauliflower, dates with a coconut yogurt (tasted like lemon ricotta cheese) and organic greens.  

We also had the soup or the day - which was yam with spinach and buttermilk topped with amazing pesto. Delicious and warm - perfect for a cold night. We alsohad the special appetizer of the day - scallops with chorizo. The scallops were a tad small - but I always feel like restaurants overcharge for scallops - so this was somewhat to be expected. We finished off with the beef fillet with vegetables, potato and Yorkshire pudding.  The beef fillet was cooked perfectly and since we got the leaner cut of meat, they added camembert cheese - yum!

Nice atmosphere and recommendation for the Pinot Noir. Servers were very friendly and the lamb was delicious.
Came on a Tuesday night at 6pm and it was nearly empty. Highly recommend if you want to have a nice, quiet weekday dinner at a good local restaurant.

Had a fantastic meal here. I got the lamb and hubby got the steak--all were delicious and paired wonderfully with wine by our server. Service was also fantastic, friendly, and very knowledgeable about the food, wine, and the general area. Would definitely go back if in the area again!

We dined here on our first evening in Christchurch. Reservations are recommended. The restaurant is located upstairs. There is a bar on the lower level as well as a small one upstairs. They serve fresh homemade bread! Your first serving is complementary with your meal order. Otherwise you are charged for second helpings. The food was fresh and delicious. The specials are wonderful. Everything from the starters all the way to the dessert was superb! If we come to NZ again we will definitely come back!

Great Date place!

I was lucky to get a table when I walked in around 5:45pm. The restaurant wasn't too busy then but within 15 minutes it was packed! You definitely need a reservation, especially if you're coming in after 6pm.

They start you off with a thick piece of herby bread and butter and a jug of lemon water. To drink I tried a glass of the "skin ferment" wine, which I'd never heard of, but the servers insisted it was worth a try. It has a reddish orangey color, kind of like rum punch. And it tastes a bit like fruit juice or cider. It wasn't bad! I don't know that I would order it again with dinner, but it could be a fun drink-outside-with-your-friends wine, like rosé's cousin.

For dinner I went with the herb crusted salmon over a bed of roasted potatoes, tomatoes, and capers. It was pretty good, but I wasn't able to finish it. The salmon portion was huge and it was just drenched in herbs; too much for my taste. The potatoes and tomatoes were on point though!

Service is friendly, but slow. It took awhile for my order to be taken, and my wine came after my food. 

Overall a decent dinner. I'd be curious to try some of their other dishes.

The place is always packed so book ahead. But certainly worth the wait if you don't mind. The food was top notch - we had the beetroot soup which was beyond belief. Everything we ordered - including bread - was Michelin worthy. Highly recommended. Not the perfect place for dates though as it gets quite busy and a bit loud for romantic conversations.

This place is delish. We have been here a few times and I've liked everything we have ordered! The wine is good and I didn't feel it was super overpriced.

I'm not a big lamb fan but when my fiancé got it, I had to try. It was cooked well, melt in your mouth, and not overly lamby. I know that sounds weird but I find lamb has a very strong, pungent taste.

Definitely a must when on new regent street and Christchurch CBD in general. Just don't count the steps and you won't be disappointed.
Incredible rack of lamb. Probably the best I've had! Great service, ambience and presentation. Highly recommended, even if you find yourself in Christchurch for a day or so.

Wow! So many good things to say about this place. Definitely make a reservation as it is a cozy place with limited seating. 

To begin, the decor is adorable and welcoming; the staff is super friendly and attentive; and the seating is comfortable and cozy. 

I sat alone, but had great conversation with the different staff. One of my servers discussed my wine tastes before letting me try two before settling on a glass. Both of her picks were spot on AND she let me know that a bottle was open that was not normally open so I could try a glass of that, as well. Really great service there. 

Let's start with the bread- homemade heaven with butter. Crumbles in your mouth. I don't normally eat bread- this bread is bomb.

I was having trouble deciding on the menu since everything that was delivered near me looked and smelled amazing. 

I settled on the roasted red capsicum tomato and red onion soup with got cheese, terragon and lemon creme fraiche. While not a fan of goat cheese (AT ALL) this was a delight hunt of flavor in a wonderful soup. It's light and creamy but still satisfying and bursting with flavor. They also let me get a *teacup* size since I didn't want to ruin my appetite on the starter. 

For the main, I chose the Pan fried salmon with capers, garlic crush potatoes, summer veg, and a banana prawns + lobster Marie Rose sauce topped with a cucumber salsa. The salmon fell apart on my plate. Even the roasted tomatoes on the side were amazing. 

I've had salmon 4 times while traveling NZ- this one takes the cake by far. This meal was fabulous and a great way to close out my New Zealand adventure.

Came here for dinner on a Thursday night. The interior had a good ambience and felt cozy. Had to wait until 7:30 for the theatre crowd to finish dinner but the dinner itself was amazing.
We ordered the seared ox tongue special, rack of lamb, risotto, and an affogato with ameratto.
Each dish was splendid, especially the ox tongue. Perfectly cooked inside, lightly seared outside. Would recommend to anyone visiting Christchurch.
Wonderful service and the food was awesome. Loved supporting this business in central Christchurch while we were on holiday.
Food was incredible, service was great and we never felt rushed even though they began to get busy during our time there.  Was a bit pricey but we think worth every penny!
Old Government Building (OGB). Service. Food. Staff all top notch for the higher end foodie.
Charming and cozy decor, reliable service, good music. It's a great place for cocktails.

Funky hip bar. Inside area very small but great atmosphere. Outside nice seating with blankets but cold in winter. 

Great bartender who mixed s mean martini. 

Food options good but a lot of fried food. Broccoli I delicious as were prawns. 

Only let down by slowish inattentive service - although friendly when there.

Had lunch here with my family and was surprised by the vegan options! I ordered a charcuterie board made of plant based foods and also tofu fried chicken. Both were great and there were still many great options for those who are not vegan (the rest of my family enjoyed their non-vegan food).
Awesome food and i love the hospitality and food of this place. This is my hang out spot when i am in Christchurch. And they have amazing Bloody Mary's for breakfast!

We were looking for a nice place for lunch on a sunny yet cool and blustery Saturday yesterday. While cool, we opted to eat outside and it was perfect.  We both chose the fried chicken burger. It came with fries.  Sounds simple and boring, but no, it was amazing.  The burger was not, I believe, a single piece of chicken breast. It seemed to be various nice pieces of well trimmed chicken that had been, with the help of cheese, formed into a patty and then breaded and fried. It was topped with thinly sliced pickled onions, like the pink ones you get in Mexico, mild dill pickle and thinly sliced red chilies.  It was not super spicy hot, but perfectly spiced up the sandwich. Wonderful!  The fries were simply amazing.  Thick cut and freshly prepared, they were served with a bowl of large grain sea salt on the side along with a small container of ketchup.  I'm not sure what had been added to the ketchup, but it had a very unique and very tasty combination that complimented the fries as well.   The burgers were NZ $22 each (US 15) and worth every penny.  We had an amazing New Zealand Riesling from Pegasus Bay winery near Christchurch.  It's famous winery & top rated Riesling.  So depending on what you want for a beverage will determine your bill, but for us, this place was great value for money and a very memorable tasty lunch
Stopped for lunch while taking in Christchurch.  Nice place with outdoor seating.   The lamp was nicely done.  The service excellent.   I liked it.

Wow! how can I be first to be review? OGB is great.  They are in a great spot in the reviving Central Christchurch. On a nice day you can sit outside and if the weather is poor they have cozy indoor seating.  Our guide recommended the place for cocktails and he was right.  We enjoyed a platter and cocktails one afternoon and came back for breakfast on another day. The food was tasty and they were able to accommodate our vegan-gluten free daughter.

Tonight my wife and I had a wonderful dining experience at O.G.B.

Waiter was unbelievably friendly and helpful.  We split a salad and she had swordfish with squid and I had a lamb dish.  Both were wonderful as was our bottle of Two Hands Angels Share Shiraz.  We also had an unusual desert which was a sweet potato muse with caramel that came highly recommended by our waiter and is considered a local treat.  I don't especially like sweet potatoes but I have to admit that this was a fabulous desert that we would like to try to replicate at home.  We feel very fortunate to have found this place and highly recommend it.

The first Chinese meal in NZ. Taste quite good and the service is excellent. 

Price is fairly okay. There are plenty of choices of different fried rices. Recommend if you want a quick Chinese meal.

This is my favourite authentic Chinese restaurant in Christchurch.  Delicious flavourful food. Accommodating if you want to make changes, within reason. Fairly priced given the quality. Nice little out of the way diner experience.

I'm glad we found this hidden gem. You walk up the stairs and this spacious and stylish restaurant awaits. We had the pork belly, seafood paella and lamb rack. Very impressed with all three. Especially the lamb rack which was perfectly cooked. For a dessert we shared the white chocolate mousse and this velvety goodness just melted in your mouth. This place is a must visit. We will definitely be back.

One of the finest farm to table restaurants I've ever been to in the world. The head chef is passionate about his craft, great staff, service and ambience. Don't miss this gem!
Update. So good I came back 2 days later !

What a treat in Christchurch. Off the beaten path. In an  industrial area. But inside you feel like you're in a tropical garden.
The food was excellent from start to finish. The lamb shank was other worldly. We tried a straticalla appetizer that was super. Fish croquettes were very good. 
Nice bar with good wine list.
We shared the chef table and our chef/owner/server Samson was sooo entertaining!
My wife and I both loved this restaurant. 
At the top of our favorite restaurants on our month long vacation to New Zealand and Australia.
Get a res if your anywhere nearby.

Very elegant and nice warm wooden interior, love all the plants and natural light! 

Service was also great, waiter explained the menu and was very attentive in answering questions and refilling water

Plating of food was beautiful! Great flavor profiles and ingredients felt high quality. The saffron cauliflower was perfectly warm and hearty. The cucumber salad was creamy and refreshing. And the lamb shoulder was sooo super tender, no knife even needed! The whipped labneh cream and zaatar flavoring paired so well w the lamb. Great meal, felt full and very satisfied after :)

Best meal in NZ so far!    Everything we had was amazing and the service was fantastic.  The small plates were wagyu and stracciatella with bread, then moved on to the medium plates of asparagus with ham and then the tomato salad, and for the finale we had the lamb shoulder. All were top notch.  This is a must for anyone, but particularly for visitors looking for a great meal.

Holy Sh*t this place rocked our world. We were only in Christchurch for a few hours before our flight back to Auckland and stopped here based on reviews. It. Was. Amazing. Best meal of the two week trip through Auckland, Queenstown, Rotorua, and Wellington. We've been to several of the "Best Of..." restaurants on this trip and there was only one other place (Charley Noble in Wellington) that was even close to as good as 5th street. We sat at the Chefs Table which made everything even better because Samson served us and he's one of the co-owners and lead chefs crafting the menu. Such a great dude, and his team is really doin the Lord's work over here. We had four cocktails (Mezcal Milkpunch, Spritz 2x, and the Stirred). The lead bartender is a blast as well and is coming up with some truly delicious, refreshing drinks on this ever-changing menu (so I hear). We got the broccolini, the beef with pickled ginger, potatoes, and the true gem of the meal = the lamb shoulder. The lamb melts in your mouth. Do not hesitate for a second to order it even if you're not a big red meat eater! I'm sitting here at the airport not an hour removed from dinner and I had to write this review because of the lamb AND the quality of service. Props to Samson, Chris, and the third mustached musketeer / co-owner for creating such a memorable dining experience. And if you're wondering, "is this guy still buzzed from the drinks he ordered at dinner?" The answer is "Hell yes. I couldn't NOT order a 4th cocktail." Anyway, cheers to the 5th street team for the beautiful work you're doing. We'll think of you every time we talk about our trip to NZ and/or use the chili oil we bought on our way out.

Location 

Near city centre with hotels and other restaurants near by.

Food  

International and inspired.  There is Asian, American and more represented on the menu. There are small, medium, and large plates to choose from.  We ordered pan fried shrimp, broccolini and kale, crispy potatoes, the tomahawk steak, and the risotto. We enjoyed all of it. We also had some sort of deconstructed lemon pie with a divine lemon ice cream.

Atmosphere/decor  

The space is very green in more ways than one.  It's literally filled with plants and green decorations.  Beautiful lighting.  Hipster vibe.

Service  

No issues here.  We sat at the 'chef's table' which is really 4 bar seats in front of the kitchen. This made the experience for us! The sous chef spoke with us and  answered questions all while doing his job of cooking.  He also let us try the zucchini fritters on the house. Outstanding gesture! He takes all your orders personally and you can see the chefs cooking your meal and then it is present directly to you.

Recommendation 

Yup, eat here.
We are visiting from the US and loved this breakfast spot! Great service vibes and prices. Definitely recommend stopping by
When we first arrived in Christchurch, we found this wonderful place. Had to come back again. It's delicious.

Beautiful place.  Lots of sunlight streaming in .  
Food was delicious. Got the avocado toast.  Lots of avocado. Tomatoes fresh.   
Husband got the classic.  Which he thought was okay.  But I think he ended craving the other pastries in their display.   Everything was very good.

Warning: this is not a low calorie review. Seriously, this place is awesome (said with new Zealand accent)! There are so many flavors bursting out of these dishes, it's difficult to process them all. The avocado toast had perfectly poached eggs with sautéed spinach (bonus ingredient) and wonderful hearty bread underneath with just the right crunch. The "classic" breakfast included rich, savory mushrooms and exemplified fine cookery. The orange juice was fresh and my dry cappuccino was made to order. In fact, the cashier remembered that ordered it the previous day, and even finished my sentence. It gets busy around 9:15 am so come early if you want to be seated right away. Highly recommended if you're in Christchurch.

My husband and I are here for vacation. Our hotel is just a few minutes walk from this place.

Staff were friendly and service was great! When it gets crowded, it can be a bit noisy. 

Their pastry display had so many tasty looking treats.

We both ordered the quesadilla for breakfast. It was huge, delicious and filling!

If you are in the area, give this place a try!

Absolutely beautiful inside with lots of natural lighting and pleasing decorations. The menu had a lot of great options and all seemed appetizing. I got a benedict with mushrooms and it was quite filling even though it might not appear that way. Both my food and coffee were delicious and nicely presented. Too bad I was in a rush otherwise I would've stayed longer. This is a great place for both small and larger groups.

I am very picky when it comes to breakfast food, so when I find a place that ticks all the boxes, I want to let the world know! Their avocado toast is so much more than that - the quality, quantity, and details matter! 
I dream about Unknown Chapter when I am not in Christchurch, and it is the one thing I make plans around when I return. Thank you for being so excellent and reliable!

Visiting here from the U.S. over our winter break in December/January) and saw the delicious photo of their pastries.

There's a good amount of paid street parking right in front of the restaurant, and there is also outdoor seating for anyone who wants fresh air or has a dog in tow.

The breakfast is pretty hearty.  I had the 2 eggs with toast.  I asked for the eggs over medium; however, they came out over easy.  I figured it was just lost in translation.  Overall, the eggs were a little too underdone for me, but the toast was very good.  I also had the mango/coconut smoothie which was very coconut forward, which I enjoyed.  It looked like a lot of the other patrons were enjoying their berry smoothies!

My husband had the breakfast burrito which pretty much had to be eaten as a open-faced burrito since there was so much filling!  I loved that it came with a good amount of avocado as well.  His long black coffee was more bitter than the other ones we had tried in other parts of New Zealand, but it was still pretty good.

Bonus - water station where you serve yourself.  Plus, you place your order at the counter, making the whole experience more efficient.
This may be the best breakfast we've ever had. The food was incredible and the atmosphere was really wholesome and cozy. Strongly recommend!! Also, the chocolate chip blueberry muffin is 11/10

We travelled all the way from Utah and this was worth the time to include in our plans. This place is divine, taking your everyday breakfast foods and making it a much more magical experience with each bite.

Stopped in for a quick breakfast and it was delicious! The flat white was smooth and perfect. The roasted chicken tortilla stack from the case has a lot of chicken in it and delicious creamy veggies in the layers. Came with a simple salad as well. Plenty of space and loved the hanging plants and light.
Awesome place for coffee and food. The roasted veggie frittata was out of this world and the coffee was delicious. And Love the plants hanging from the ceiling!
Came for a coffee and muffin. Both were great. They roast their own coffee on site. Great staff and environment. Will be back.

We ate here our first night in Christchurch, and it still remains one of my favorite meals in New Zealand following our one-month visit. The ambience was superb, in the hub of Christchurch's trendy shopping area, but set off on an upper level and extremely attractive decor. The food was interesting and varied - a perfect way to celebrate our first night in the country.
Great environment and great food. The wait staff was super helpful. Beautiful view of downtown.

Nicest Restaurant we've been to in a long while: upscale atmosphere, exceptionally nice ambiance w:super helpful staff.  We shared delicious plates and wine. would recommend the prawn dumplings, blue cod, tenderloin steak bites and curry pumpkin. We thought the curry pumpkin was the best!
Delicious Asian Fusion, beautiful decor and great service. A bit hard to find, back off Main Street up a flight of stairs.A bit pricey but I'd recommend.

Would have given 4 stars but the service was chaotic and made the dining experience stressful and rushed. All we wanted was a relaxing evening with good food. 

The ambiance is beautiful. Romantic and very dimly lit. Lots of cozy seating. And the area of town has so many incredible food options. It's located on the second floor that you reach by stairs or lift. 

The cocktail list was good. The food menu had many different choices and you're encouraged to share. Unfortunately our waitress didn't keep track of who ordered what and dishes come out at separate times. A server would just stand at the end of the table with a plate and yell "who ordered this?" And many wrong dishes were brought to our table.

My favorite dishes were the Akaroa Salmon (so good) and the shrimp dumplings (the broth was insanely delicious). I would order this dish every time. My friends liked the crawfish slider. The duck was extremely fatty and we didn't even finish it. We had even asked the waitress if it was fatty, and said it wasn't, which is what encouraged us to order it. I didn't like the scallops at all.

Service was okay.  
The food was okay. Small portion sizes for the cost. 
Shrimp dumpling in broth was good, but the size of the shrimp dumpling was too big.  A whole shrimp in a dumpling doesn't work for a shared plate.  Salmon was perfectly cooked.
We were initially skeptical due to the location in a tourist area.  We saw good reviews so tried it and very glad we did.  Every dish was fantastic!

Stylish restaurant with great service and food. 
Four of us had a series of tasty beautiful small plates. The spinach leaf wrap was a mouthful of deliciousness and the crayfish slider was a real hit.

Our last night in New Zealand and we decided to try this place which was a short walk from our hotel.  We were not disappointed.  We did arrive early around 5:30pm so the place was quiet and we received attention promptly.  Try a glass of Cloudy Bay Brut! Excellent and better than some much higher priced bubbly I've had. Or the Daquiri which has a nice hint of cinnamon.  We had pork wontons which were served golden brown and hot with a sweet and savoury dipping sauce.  Then we had the Kung Pao Chicken (perfectly spiced and made with a rich dark soy base) and a Vegetarian Pad Thai...beware the chilies on the side are potent.  A side of rice and a few beers and all was great.  Friendly and attentive service also.  One of our favourite meals in New Zealand.

OK, we've had enough seafood for a little while, how about something different. Asian? Sure.

My family of four descended on this place, and did, I think, a great job of ordering (with a little advice from a very helpful waiter). We had crispy skin chicken: delicious, moist and tender with delicate crisp skin, great spices, and an insane vinegar broth to dip in. There was duck breast in red curry: nice thick, spicy sweet coconut curry, tender duck breast with good flavor, and not too much fat, plus nice peppers and veggies besides. And we did Szechuan lamb, which, honestly, was not very Szechuan, if you ask me? But was pretty delicious. Tender, good flavor and not gamey, good sauce. Just missing some Szechuan heat, or that tingly Szechuan peppercorn flavor I love so much. And we finished that all off with some of their sauteed greens. The American in me reads that to be "wilted spinach" - no thanks - but it's more Asian greens, more substantial than just wilted leaf lettuce, and they're quite nice. Fresh 
tasting, crisp and not overcooked, nice stir fry sauce. An easy choice to accompany any dish if you're hungry for some greens, these kind of hit the spot.

Broken record - price very reasonable for what we got. Service was very friendly too. If you're looking for Asian in Christchurch, this is definitely worth checking out.

Went there as a group on Friday 15 June 2018. Wow!! the food was fabulous, I am pescatarian and there was plenty of choice. Others in the group were also very impressed. I do not eat out unless the food is comparable or better than I can cook. Big heads up to the Server, male with brown stylish hair and glasses. Very lucky to have such great staff. Thanks heaps.

And with a surname of Wong we are happy diners.  So it's not authentic Cantonese, Vietnamese, Malaysian, Singaporean, Korean or Thai.  What it is... a fusion of Asian flavors with local proteins and ingredients.  And in that sense of flavor spirit they do just fine thank you, dojei, kham Sam me da, khap Khun ma khap.  Strong bold and spicy flavors with generous NZ portions (in Asia they would be half the size).  No disrespect intended, but you can only eat so much Fish and Chips and lamb roast.    So a night or meal of a different flavor from another mother is a nice accent to the forever weekly manja monotone.  It ain't any one Asian food profiles but a melange of flavors.   And 9,000 or 12,000 km from the home country it's all good!

Deep fried Pork hock was outstanding!  With lettuce wraps and mayo/rice and Kim Chee purée?  Different take and One hock portion, needs one tummy plus to make this go away.  Clams with homemade XO?  Your got to be gutsy to pull this off.  And it works in a kiwi kind of way.  Even straight up chicken wings are as finger licking good as creamy spiced mayo dip can make it. Decent wine list with a thoughtful stab at a cocktail list.  We do agree service was a bit spotty, but in contrast to two other Sunday dining rooms that were empty this place was busy.   And we all know Sunday restaurant labor is a bit pricey to find.  So just order quick and think ahead for your next drink.  Be proactive with your ordering and enjoy a busy restaurant.  The kitchen rocks with a well timed wok and food comes quick and you just need to add your own lick!   Chefs here definitely have their groove on.  

King of Sunday dining for us!  Long live the Snake!
We loved this place.  We happened to find it and were so happy.  We ate in the bar and had the most delicious food.  All the wait staff and bartender were exceptionally friendly and helpful!

My Thanksgiving (from the States) was a meal from here  and I had second and thirds just like Thanksgiving. stuffing my face with some Asian fusion deliciousness. No turkey here but I ate that chicken like it was my own turkey. I was starving so also ordered the stir fry Vegs that complemented the spicy chicken.  If this were Home, I would have licked my plates, but lady manners it was. 

The bar area is great place to eat solo without the feeling of being uncomfortable in the main dining room. They have some outdoor seating as well and placed just right off the Main Street, thus a little quieter than one would expect.
Unfortunately we were there during the happy hour so the only vegetarian option that looked good was spring rolls. And we were super hungry. They were good. We didn't try anything else.
It is a ok restaurant. The Asian food is average. We ordered script chicken , it is dry and salty.

You can't research food in Christchurch without seeing King of Snake at the top of every list. And after traveling to Auckland first, I was a bit satiated on Asian food, but alas, we came to King of Snake. Wow...so glad we did! We enjoyed a reasonable lunch, sitting outside in the beautiful weather. We had the kung pao chicken and the kimchee dumplings. The food was SO GOOD. The chicken was a blend of breast and thigh, which I typically don't prefer, but King of Snake must have chargrilled or roasted it for the most delectable flavor  

Overall, we were very pleased with the food scene in NZ, and King of Snake is an absolute must try. If it's a nice day and you want to skip the rigamarole of a fancy dinner, the lunch menu offers a great variety, and the outdoor seating is limited and lovely.
This is a must visit restaurant while in ChCh, a really cool bar area, and just delicious food.  Really really good, love this place and we go for dinner here whenever we are in New Zealand.

Went for my wedding anniversary. Food was great but for the price I would expect a better sitting experience. We were at a small table right up against a bigger one so that the persons chair was almost hitting ours- to get to his seat my husband had to navigate around other tables first. And the chairs were less than comfortable. Would recommend the food but was not a romantic dinner for me!! Luckily The Last Word was too far to walk to for a more cosy talk and drink.

Do you like Asian? Do you enjoy trying new flavors? If yes, then this is a must visit restaurant in Christchurch.

We both had a spinach leaf salad (it's one leaf with 16 ingredients you roll and eat). It was small but amazing. We savored every bite. Kung Pao Chicken we decided to share. It was yummy and of medium heat (unless you eat one of the peppers in the stir fry). Our "happy ending" was the lime pudding dessert. This was another choice that did not disappoint. It was tangy, but not too much, and delicious. The chef in this restaurant is fantastic. 

We were full with these items but if you are extra hungry you'll probably want to add in another appetizer or another meal to share. We were not too hungry as our eating schedule was off kilter due to traveling and time zones. 

If I were to visit again, I would be happy ordering these same items again.

Cool, hip place with a delicious menu. I wish I could have tried more plates. I was searching for spice and the King delivered.

I tried the Thai spicy chile prawns and was not disappointed. These come with a side of white rice and level 10 flavor. 

Paired with a dragon martini- delicious. Make sure you have a side of water ready for the prawn!
Loved that food   there's a special atmosphere inside ..it's nice for a random dinner or even romantic date. I'm happy to recommend and for sure will come back :) Thank you
Food was good, great atmosphere. Sweet and sour pork and fried rice balls really good. Not a big fan of the yellow fin tuna salad.
Very trendy place (we were the ones most under dressed) with excellent cocktails, great food, and a nice atmosphere.  This was our most expensive meal in New Zealand, but worth it!
I found this to be very average at best. A poor attempt at fusion & I was disappointed

Amazing meal! An absolute must for your dining in Christchurch. Great service, atmosphere and food. We went with the recommendations of the staff and had an amazing selection of food. The Bo Ssam pork hock is just the best!
I like some of the dishes here like the panang beef cheek, but the restaurant is loud and crowded, and the service is hit and miss.

Nice modern Asian fusion restaurant. Original and modern Asian bites with a lively atmosphere. To recommend oysters, duck and pork belly. Very tasteful dishes with very very fresh products  (same day butchered). Friendly and fast service.

The worst service I have ever had in any restaurant....ever. We were the second table of the night to be seated and watched as every other table filled up, had orders taken, and food delivered...all the while our menus remained in front of us. After 40 minutes we engaged a passing waiter to be told "this isn't my section", a second waiter was stopped and we were told "sorry mate I'm busy". A trip up to the front desk to the greeter/seater lady was ever less fruitful, begging to have our order taken I was dismissed with a rude, snide attitude...it was another 10 minutes before our table received any attention. The food is good, but not worth the price or putting up with rude treatment.

Really nice place with good design, warm atmosphere. Asian cousine, rather spicy. 

Good choice of cocktails, tapas, wine etc.
It's o.k .Asian inspired restaurant.service was good ,the place is nice,it also has a little Lounge were you can have some some platters.

A group of three of us had a meal here on a Monday night and it was packed.  A very nice meal and great service combined to make this a memorable evening.  Three small and three large plates and we struggled to finish and none of us are "Bird Like" eaters.  Very nice.

Not a bad restaurant, food is pretty good (Asian inspired), but the wait staff (or at least the one I had) don't really compliment the restaurant. Very slow at bringing water (or topping up an empty glass of water) and bringing drinks or asking if I would like another. Also no new glass with a new drink? It's the little things...

Book ahead if you want to be guaranteed a table. Even on a tuesday night it is busy and we were given a two hour dining window. I hate dining windows but understand why a busy restaurant insists on them. I do give KoS credit for letting us know about it when making the reservation though - at two recent restaurants I have been to we were evicted from out seats with no warning before even getting to desserts! 

I have to comment on the decor, which is amazing. The wallpapers are bright and vivd and really add to the ambience of the place. Food is asian fusion style. Definitely order the spinach leaf wrap things, they are one of my favourite things on the menu. Its an incredible mouthful of fresh bursting flavour. The dumplings in broth are disappointing and bland. Other dishes I enjoyed are the moong dal salad and the penang curry. I normally avoid ordering dessert at asian style restaurants but took a gamble on the mango tart tartin. It was pretty good if not mind-blowing. There is an extensive cocktail menu and you are sure to find something you like. I do agree with a previous reviewer who said the signature King of Snake cocktail is not that good - I like ginger a lot but this was just completely overwhelming and almost undrinkable. The service is great and attentive, no issues here.

This is a decent restaurant with good but uninspired food. I had two appetizers and two cocktails, all of which were very one note. Their signature cocktail, the King of Snakes, has the overwhelming taste of ginger. Their coffee cocktail, recommended by the bartender, tasted like an overly sweet starbucks frappe. The two dishes I had, fried squid and pork belly, were uninteresting, but not necessarily poorly cooked. Overall, the experience at the restaurant was underwhelming but not bad. I would not look to go back, but I would also not complain if my friends wanted to go.

This really is a cool place. From the moment you enter you realise this is high range Asian food. Would recommend the sticky need wontons and the spinach leaf. Both are a fab way to start the night. Matched with a glass of Moët (yes they do it by the glass). Great service felt like a celebrity.

I would definitely classify this as more a restaurant than a bar. The food is really good, a tapas theme with Asian infusion but overall healthy food. The bar is very trendy and the bartenders are pro but the bar is relatively small so it's more of a pre-dinner drink bar or after work drinks maybe even pre-drinks before hitting the town. Not a bar scene per-se and they probably close around 11.
Food was really good, can recommend the lamb, duck strifry and the steak. What was really poor was the service. Booking was for 8.15pm but never managed to even get desert or coffee before 10pm.

King of Snake is an interesting environment and a welcome change from your run of the mill Thai restaurants. While the food was good, my experience was marred by the most unfriendly, rude hostess I have ever encountered. 

Ionara (Brazilian by her accent) excelled in ensuring that my evening was unpleasant. I made the unfortunate error of enthusiastically ordering two entrees so that I could experience as much as possible. Unfortunately I was not informed that all meals are designed to be shared. As I was dining alone (on a business trip) it became apparent I would not be able to handle the two large entrees and a main. I politely requested that one of my untouched entrees be returned.

Ionara proceeded to inform me in no uncertain terms that as I had ordered the meal, my options were to pay for it and take it away or leave it and still pay for it. Her demeanour was rude and unapologetic.

I don't think hospitality was a particularly prudent choice of career for this hostess and King of Snake would be well advised to take heed. I doubt whether I was the first customer to experience this treatment and I probably won't be the last.
Service is excellent by any standard. Asian fusion food is excellent by Kiwi standard.  Atmosphere is light and fun. Go for it.

We enjoyed both of our meals at King of Snake as we dined there on Friday and were back again on Thursday. I will start out by saying that the service was very good and the staff was more than accommodating. The seating arrangements are a little odd so make sure that you specify the table you want when making reservations. If you are going on a date you would need to specify that you would like a table for two inside the main dining area, otherwise you could wind up in the enclosed terrace area or at a shared table which always irks me. The food was good although my girlfriend was much more impressed than I was (thus the two nights in one week). The servers are fully knowledgable and are more than willing to assist you in deciding which main me be best suited to your tastes. It was east to see why this is the most talked about restaurant in Christchurch.

I like this place.  I wouldn't call it special, because I've been to some very special places... But it's really good.  Service was friendly and good, food was prepared very well.  I'm only giving it 3 stars because, as I said... I didn't feel like it was special...

Perhaps, I am being unfair, as I am comparing the restaurant to some of my more expensive experiences - That isn't to detract from the quality of the restaurant,  just comparing it to my expectations.

I did really like the ambience.  And the wall paper was something quite unique.

I'd go back.  Probably with more reasonable expectations.

We went to KOS on the recommendation of our hotel receptionist. Definitely come early and make reservations as they were fully booked at 6 pm. Service was very nice. They have a fairly short menu divided into meats (seafood, chicken, beef, pork) and vegetables. This place is definitely a bit pricey for the portion size. They tout that you can share the dishes which is true but you won't have any left overs. Now having eaten all types of Asian food from various countries it takes a lot to impress me. The curry vegetable dish ( $30) was really good, with a sweet savory flavor. The vegetables they chose for the curry ( pumpkin, baby corn, green beans, asparagus) are fresh and blend well with the curry. The other dish we ordered was the sirloin which was very tender but I felt did not stand out compared to other Asian dishes I've had for the price you pay. ($26) Overall, a good choice for dinner although you will pay for it.

Asian fusion...your name is King of Snake! this place has officially taken over as the best asian fusion in my book from some very highly vaunted places.  Modern, casual yet elegant is the definition of the interior.  The oyster starters were just perfectly briny morsels that were contrasted well with the black pepper vinaigrette.  This begged us to move on to the mandarin marinated tuna which in the hands of lesser cooks could be a textural disaster, but here it is firm yet infused well with the marinade, the pumpkin yellow curry was a wonderful amalgamation of thai flavors and a touch of Indianness with the cashews and the stir fried cumin lamb a fantastic meaty meal with bits of char on the lamb from the high heat stir fry working well with the toasty almost mild pungency of the cumin. This dish reminded me of a similar dish I had in Beijing and invoked a flood of memories of that trip, yet took me in a new direction.  A nice wine list rounds off this place.  I thought the Marlborough Gruner Vertliner to be a particularly good accompaniment to my food and quite well priced.  Go go go to this place!!
Great food. Great service. Great atmosphere. Prices seem to be going up but they're competitive for value through quality!

King of Snake is amazing. Great staff, great food, great drinks, great atmosphere. There is only one catch... Everyone knows how great it is! 
You MUST visit if you are in Christchurch. My tip is book ahead, or be relaxed and happy to have a few drinks in the bar area until a table comes up (this is not a bad option at all - they have some great local wines and craft beers, as we'll as killer cocktails!). Even mid-week, this place is PACKED. 

Highlights are pippies in XO sauce, the tuna salad with coconut, the duck and lycée salad... Oh man it's all good!

Um, yeah, insanely good. Usually a description of "Asian fusion" send me running in the other direction, but on a cold night in Christchurch I needed to get warm so in we went. Staff were fantastic, cocktails were amazing, food was delicious. We went two nights in a row because it was so great - everything we tried was excellent. Probably best to either book, or be patient because this place is SUPER busy!

Great and friendly service. The waitress gave us great recommendations. Better than any Asian fusion restaurant I have been to before. Try the sweet and sour pork, nothing like you have ever experienced!

Super excited to see that this place is amazing. 
The staff is really fantastic and the food was exceptional. 
Will definitely try it again. 
We were lucky to get a reservation.

Dined solo here and got the "Lamb shoulder, creamy polenta, almond brown butter carrots, plum chutney, jus" and it was SO good. Lamb was super tender and all the other ingredients tasted great with the lamb. The piece of lamb was generous so come hungry! Service was standard. Inside is cozy and the chairs are comfortable. Totally recommend coming here if you're looking for some great food.

I enjoyed a great dinner here. I had booked a table the day before and my companions and I arrived to find the place already busy with a queue. But we got our table immediately. Service is really nice, with friendly staff and informal but respectful practices. We enjoyed lovely Scallops, Lamb rolls and Soup for entrees, then Eye Fillet steak, Salmon Fillet and Fish of the Day (Terakihi) for mains. Our sides were Mesclun Salad and Duck Fat Potatoes. Everything was really good, nicely presented, with good quality produce and good size portions. The wine list is very nice. Dessert was Chocolate Brownie and Ginger Pudding. There is no surprise about its popularity, everything was great. We were probably last to leave but didn't feel rushed at all, which was appreciated. The location is great, right across the road from the Arts Centre and on the tram route, within short walking distance of the river and city CBD. Parking on the nearby streets was available too. It's very good, I would recommend it.

Wonderful dinner at this inviting restaurant. We were able to snag a table without a reservation during a busy evening; so accommodating! My husband and I shared a terrific bottle of New Zealand wine and shared two appetizers a main course and a side. Plenty of food and all of it was delicious. Our server was warm and professional. Centrally located. Can't wait to return!

Stopped by for lunch between museums tours.  We ordered the bread plate to share with friends and then got baked falafels and a lamb pie for ourselves.  Bread plate was very good.  It was fresh and the butter served with the plate was light and fluffy.  The lamb pie was very tasty.  The only letdown was the baked falafels.  I understand they are trying to be more health conscience but somethings just need to be fried. The texture and flavor was a significant departure from tradition.  Outside seating was pleasant and service level was outstanding as we had a very mindful server.

An excellent restaurant for lunch !  Directly across the street from the fine arts museum and has a trolly stop directly in front. On nice days there is outdoor dining 

Excellent food pleasant wait staff and the place appeared sparkling clean too!

Recommended!

We explored the amazing Christchurch Art Gallery and wanted a nice lunch afterwards.  Right across the street was an interesting looking cafe/pub place. It was cool and blustery, and we wanted something warming.  Wow! Did this place deliver!  Super friendly staff welcomed us.  As it was Sunday, many were there for brunch.  I saw many plates with eggs and other goodies that looked great.  But we were here for lunch.  My husband had a pie stuffed with smoked pork that he said was delicious.  It came with a pea purée and lovely salad. I chose the pappardelle with lamb ragout and white bean purée.  The shredded lamb was a delight and the sauce was light and flavorful with a hint of Moroccan spice, but light. The top of the food had some shavings of cheese and what appeared to be radish sprouts.  It was lush and unctuous with a marvelous taste and texture.  Perfect comfort food for such cool, damp late summer day.  The bean purée was a simple foil with hint of the spice I mentioned, or was that the only place where it was?  I'm not sure, but it was yummy.  We had a nice bottle of central Otago Pinot noir which was nicely acidic that was nice food wine and matched our meals perfectly.  The meal with the wine, which was over 50% of the bill, came to US $75.  Very fine meal and worth every penny.

Intrigued by the chef special of whitebait on the chalkboard ($24), I decided to try. The chalkboard said it was served with toasted brioche, pickled vegetables, and citrus mayo. So, imagine my surprise when it came in an egg patty!

I have to admit I was a bit disappointed. It was okay, but you really couldn't taste the fish - mostly egg. I pried a fish to taste by itself, but the egg was too overpowering. I think since this is a seasonal fish, the fish should be showcased. Without the citrus mayo, this would've been a bland dish 

I learned from the waitress that this fish is always served in the form of a patty with something else. Too bad New Zealanders don't make a snack like Malaysians do, with dried small fish, peanuts, and sambal. That would be great!

The coconut bread and sangria were great! We ordered a lemonade for our daughter and they brought Sprite - turns out this is normal in NZ - we are the odd ones! Just beware when ordering lemonade in NZ! 

We also ordered a strawberry milkshake and it was literally strawberry milk...shaken. (Photo)

I convinced my aunt to walk over here with me from our hotel, which was a bit of a struggle since she was less than thrilled about the ten minutes over. However, she raved about her fish dish so the walk was totally worth it. She got the market fish and I had the soup of the day and a spinach and walnut salad. The food was good and the service was friendly. She especially enjoyed her fish, which was a white flushed fish, served in a tomato broth with an olive tapenade on top.We didn't have reservations but we're seated promptly. I had to run past this restaurant earlier in the afternoon and noticed many outside enjoying a beer or wine and the local sunshine.

Having just one evening to enjoy a sit down private dinner, I decided on Fiddlesticks, as recommended by a few locals. Dining solo presented a challenge as I could only sample one meal. Judging off of previous Yelp comments and my desire to try local, I went with the Canterbury Lamb Shoulder. 
Having nothing else on the menu to compare it to, I certainly vouch for this dish. You won't be disappointed. Served on a bit of greens and topped with a fruit sauce, the lamb, which had obviously been stewing for awhile, was super tender and extremely flavorful. In addition to its succulence, the portion was quite substantial! Adding a side of baby spinach salad and a Black Dog draft beer ensured I had no room for dessert. 
Peeking at the table next to me, another customer had ordered the salmon. Based on appearance and the clean plate after 15 minutes, I'd guess that dish also comes recommended. 
One last thing, the service was excellent - welcoming, warm, and prompt!

We may have visited on a bad night, but the service was a disaster. We sat for 2 hours and were largely ignored by our waiter.  Even getting the bill took multiple attempts.  And getting a take out container required asking our waiter, the manager and another server before someone managed to get us something.  The food was fine, but this is not a repeater.

One of the worst meals I've ever eaten. We started with the fried chicken appetizer and it was so dry that the only thing that made it edible was the sauce it came with. Next we ordered the feast, and it included a salad, lamb, roasted onions, peas, stuffed mushrooms, and two sides that included duck fat potatoes, and another salad. The lamb was cold and flavorless. It seemed like the chef had no idea how to cook lamb. Both salads were boring and also flavorless, but the most memorable dish was the potatoes. The duck fat potatoes were the hardest, most dry dish of potatoes I have ever seen in my life. The were impossible to chew because they were rock solid. How on earth do you mess up potatoes?? They're the world's easiest food to cook. Additionally, the portions were tiny for the supposed "feast" title. We both left so hungry, and had to order pizza later that evening to make up for it. I want to point out that before we got our food, the couple sitting next to us complained about their meal, so it wasn't just a matter of our taste buds. I will say that the waiter was very nice and the service was good, but I went for the food and the high ratings I saw on Google. It was also $95, including a drink each, and did not include dessert. So disappointed.

We went here on our last evening in Christchurch NZ. It was a very nice dining experience. The food was delicious and the service fantastic. This place was recommended to us by another local Chef. If a Chef is going to recommend a good place for a nice steak then you have to try it! Everything was fresh and delightful. It can get crowded for dinner so reservations are recommended!

Not sure what all of the hype is about. We had an early pick up for a tour the next morning so went to the first available dinner service. Our waiter seemed fairly uninterested & not too helpful with the menu items. The food was beautifully presented but execution was lacking. I had the Free range pork belly. It was under seasoned and mushy while the Chicharrón garnish was so hard that it was a dental hazard. My wife had a red gurnard that was skillfully cooked but again under seasoned.
The starter is very good, recommended. The waitress gave me good recommendation. Main course is not bad. I

What a great experience! Amazing food, wonderful staff, and such a great atmosphere! We had so much fun at dinner here. We will recommend it to all friends coming through the area. We both had the lamb shoulder for our main and it was so perfectly cooked. Our waitress was incredibly nice and easy to talk to. She was friendly without being the annoying fake friendly you often run into in the service industry. Prices reflect the great quality you receive in your dishes. Was an amazing night out and well worth our 30 minute walk to find!!
Amazing as always. Faultless service and food. Must be the best salmon in the world - rank it even higher than that in Vancouver or Scotland.

We went here on our first night in Christchurch and I'm glad we did.  The review were right on the spot and we enjoyed the restaurant very much.  The food is excellent, but as with much of NZ a bit on the pricey side.  The service was particularly good, which really made the meal.
Best vegetarian risotto ever!! Usually don't drink reds but their red wine is amazing!  love the ambience with twinkling lights, fireplace, comfortable seating, large windows, great service too!
Great service, delicious fresh food. Quiet afternoon lunch spot on a rainy day. Our server was very friendly informative about Christchurch hot spots. Nice menu $$$ is accurate but worth it.

We adored this place and came 3 times! Once for happy hour and twice for dinner. You can make reservations to sit in the main dining area or first come first serve in the bar area which also had a sun room. The vibe is very positive and a great place to hang for some wine or beer. Every dish we ordered was super tasty and we tried plenty!

Just finished dining here (dinner) and had the Hereford rib eye. Also had to order extra vegetables and at $44 for Main and $9 for vegetables it was just enough. Quality of food was ok only because of the price as you can get much better for less elsewhere. Service was however very good and all staff were very helpful and friendly.  Beers are about average at around $11 a pint for Heineken.
Great stop! Enjoyed sitting outside and watching the trams go by.  Great food and service. Soup was great.  Would recommend.

We came here after a full day of touring around Christchurch; we saw Fiddlesticks while walking around and so chose it, in part, because we knew it was walking distance from our hotel!   We arrived fairly early, around 5:30PM on a Sunday, and the dining room was nearly empty, but did  start to fill within an hour or so.  

The wine list featured a lot of reasonably priced New Zealand selections; we were very happy with our Rockface Pinot Noir.   We shared an order of pumpkin hummus as a starter, which was good, and the perfect amount for the three of us to have just a little nibble before entrees.   I had the lamb shoulder which was excellent!   It was very tender and flavorful, and the potatoes, kale, and sauces all went with it perfectly.  A family member also had the lamb, and, unfortunately, one of his two pieces of lamb had a large chunk of fat, but he did enjoy it despite that!  Another family member had the fish special, and she said it was delicious!  It came with fried whitebait as a topping.  Given that this was our first night in New Zealand, we really didn't know what whitebait was....for others who are equally ignorant, it is exactly what it sounds like...tiny bait fish!  These were fried up nice and crispy, and we all tried some...just don't think about it too much, or look too closely at them, and they are quite tasty!   

Dessert was good, but not quite what we expected; all the desserts are served in a deconstructed style which, honestly, isn't a favorite of mine.   

Service was excellent.  Our server was friendly, and knew the menu well.  We were seated in a porch-like area that was delightful - bright with lots of greenery!   

This is a great option for dinner in Christchurch!

In what has become a theme in Christchurch, Fiddlesticks has excellent service. Very attentive but still relaxed staff make it a pleasure to drink and dine here. We went for a quick lunch and were not disappointed by a very nice duck parfait to start and pork pie as the main event. The meals were served quickly but not so as to make us feel rushed. The drinks menu is extensive with a reasonable priced range of alternatives. 

The restaurant is well located on one of Christchurch's main thoroughfares between Cathedral Square and The Botanic Gardens / Canterbury Museum. We will definitely be back.

After a long journey to make it to New Zealand from the U.S., my wife and I came here for a relatively low-key dinner our first night in the country. We showed up pretty late - around 8:45 in the evening on a Sunday - and while the restaurant still had several tables when we came in, it was virtually deserted by the time we had finished. The restaurant has a modern feel to it, and while it is also a bar, the noise from the television didn't really intrude on the dining space at all. The service was solid at best, with it taking a bit long to place our order at the start and to get the check at the end. While there are some local beers available for order, the one I had (Pointer's Pale Ale) was one of the weakest offerings I've had in that genre of beer. My wife was less than impressed that flavored iced teas were the only option available in that kind of drink.

As for the food, I would say that the the bread was arguably the best part of the meal. It tasted like it was all cooked in-house and was warm and fresh. The wheat bread in particular had warmth and fluffiness to it that you would not take from how it was presented (as sliced triangles, like it would be for a sandwich). The butter was also very rich and worked very well with bread as soft as what was served. For an appetizer, we split the seared scallops. While the salsa verde worked very well as a complement to the scallops (which were prepared pretty well), the pickled fennel was a bit of a dissonant note and added too much acidity to the salsa. The entrees were also a bit on the inconsistent side. My wife's lamb shoulder fell apart quite easily, and it had very good smoky flavor - especially paired with the dahl - but paradoxically, the meat itself was also too dry - very little succulence with any bite. After my first choice was dk'ed (the king salmon), I went with the pork belly noodle soup. The pork belly was very juicy and flavorful, and the glass noodles were also pretty solid as well. However, the broth had a very muddled flavor, really making the soup more of a conveyance vehicle for the rest of the dish, as opposed to adding anything to the dish.

Overall, Fiddlesticks is a nice spot to take in a meal, but I was not blown away by it. The lamb was surprisingly overcooked, and while some of the fusion elements of the dishes were good (e.g. the dahl), others missed the mark. As a tourist from the other side of the world, I would probably check out another restaurant in Christchurch next time I am in town first.
Started in the afternoon for a beverage. Delicious & unique Mai Tai. Nice server as well. On our way for dinner now!

I would say this restaurant has many good features but value for money is not one of them. I've eaten here twice and each time have come away feeling that something was missing, like the main course can seem a little stodgy.

I think this place really deserves 4.5 stars but couldn't quite justify the five. I came here for dinner with a group of seven on a Sunday night. 

The food presentation is stellar, a real feast for the eyes. Most of the food lived up to its looks with the exception of the whitebait patty which the eater felt was a little sparse on the whitebait, heavy on the egg. The fried chicken entree was raved about. My beef fillet was good although I asked for rare and everyone agreed it looked more med-rare. The highlight of it was the proscuitto fries which were very morish, and make up for the fact that  Quality of all the meats was top notch though. The fresh fish was absolutely divine, and the venison feast received two thumbs up (well four technically since its a shared dish!). The chocolate truffle dessert was outstanding, a real highlight of the meal for me. The salted caramel dessert was less spectacular but still good. 

I thought service was above average - friendly, attentive, good humoured. The only small letdown was we were not asked if we wanted another round of drinks which we probably would have gone for if we had been asked, but weren't worried about enough to attract the attention ourselves. He also went to a lot of effort to bill us separately for our individual meals as we requested, even though this is a lot more work for him.  

There is a lot of seating options in this restaurant including some nice outdoorsy areas which are perfect for summer evenings. I liked the decor, it was fresh and green and welcoming. They had a TV playing old black and white movies on silent which I though was an interesting touch and point of difference! 

Price was ok - I spent about $80 on sangria/main/side/dessert which I thought was reasonable for the quality and size of the meals.

I came here with my elderly mum and her partner for her 85th birthday. They were fantastic, with excellent food and great, friendly service. This place serves gourmet pub food, lots of excellent choices, and a good variety of beers and wines.

We arrived early on a Saturday (6:15pm), and by the time we left at 8:30 if was full, with a pleasant buzz and great atmosphere.

I would come here again for myself, and recommend it.
Delicious food, a great place to eat in the heart of town - particularly as there is not a lot else that has opened in that area yet. Friendly staff, good atmosphere. I'd recommend.

Fiddlesticks was ok. I had the beef sandwich and although it tasted and was prepared perfectly the presentation left a lot to be desired. It is presented on the menu as a sandwich but when it arrived the bread was drastically too small. In that case fine, you can pick up your knife and fork and enjoy it as an open faced sandwich but that was very difficult as it is served on a wooden board (for aesthetic purposes) that was entirely too small so lunch turned out to be a messy experience which is never fun. Service was alright.

For what at first I expected to be a traditional pub meal I was really pleasantly surprised by the quality of both the service and the food.

Inside was warm and inviting on such a cold night and the staff were equally up to the task, offering advice on their favourite menu options and suggesting matching wines to try.

I had an expertly cooked steak with mustard and pickled vegetables and some specially prepared "fries" and a side of broccoli, the later unfortunately was a little over cooked for me; a very enjoyable meal

Upon recommendation from our friends, we stopped into Midnight Shanghai for dinner. We were seated on the back patio -- a covered open-air patio with limited seating. We ordered a lot of food including the red chili fish in broth, a tempura style cauliflower, scallion pancakes, mapo tofu, veggie gyoza (dumplings) and the veggie stir-fry noodles. The food comes out as it's ready, and dishes are great for sharing. This works out well for a long meal, except that our noodles came out about 20 minutes after the rest of the food (and we were about ready to leave). We ended up taking that whole dish to go (takeaway) after it was served. 

My personal favorite was the chili fish -- the broth was spicy and delicious -- but everything on the menu was great!

The food here is fresh and excellent.  During my stay in Christchurch I had the pear &gorgonzola salad several times and the beet & goat cheese salad once.  My 5-year-old grandson lived the margharita pizza so much he wanted to have it every day for lunch.  My daughter-in-law and I shared the lamb ragu with tagliatelle at dinner.  It was delicious. The service is friendly and ambiance calm. And the prices are very reasonable. We recommend it highly.

This is some of the best Italian food I've had in years! I had the pea, asparagus, cheese risotto which was amazing, and a pear, gorgonzola and arugula salad that they made especially for me!  The wine was great and the service was attentive and excellent!!!  My friend had the gnocchi in red sauce which she said was one of the best she's had in years. Make a reservation as this place is packed and worth it!

Delicious Vegetarian Spaghetti Puttanesca. Bold flavors of tomato, garlic , peppers and capers. One of best meals during my stay in Christchurch. I will be back. Don't miss this gem. Great service and clean and modern ambiance.

We ate here on a weeknight and made reservations just in case - on previous nights we saw there were no tables available so we didn't want to chance a drop-in. This was a great restaurant, fairly roomy but seemed cozy, and with attentive service. We had focaccia to start, and I ordered the mushroom risotto which was SO flavorful. Others in my party had the squid ink linguine and potato gnocchi with beef cheek. Everyone's food was great.

We arrived at Francesca's Italian Kitchen without reservations, but the welcoming staff member said that we could eat at the window-facing counter, side by side. Actually, we then got to people-watch as they passed by on the street, while viewing the activity at the restaurant, as well.

With the menu offerings focused on pizzas and pastas, we both chose to start with a pear-and-gorgonzola salad, with toasted focaccia for the table. The salad greens were perfectly dressed, and the pears had just the right amount of crunch. I would have preferred a bit more gorgonzola, but I'm quite a cheese lover.

The duck ragu risotto was fantastic. The risotto was cooked perfectly al dente, and the rich flavors of the ragu and texture of the duck crackling pieces on top were fantastic. Just note that the portion is large, and two people could easily share one serving of this rich risotto.

There's a nice wine selection, with offerings from New Zealand and Italy.

What a delightful place and a delicious meal! Book a reservation because, even on a Monday evening, the restaurant fills up.
