Amazing! We fell into Francesca's. It was recommended by a local server in a bar. 
I've never had duck risotto, will probably never see it on a menu again, but it was so delicious. 
I would come back and order again TOMORROW!
My partner had the squid ink seafood pasta--again, delicious! They're busy, had to turn a couple walk-ins  away, so maybe make a reservation, or come early! Worth it!

Really loved this Italian place and especially enjoyed the beef carpaccio. We considered ordering it again and thought we'd be back to try the pizza on the tail end of our trip. I usually try to choose the fresh pasta at any Italian place I'm at - we chose the tagliatelle and squid ink pasta. The squid ink dish was a bit too salty for me but oddly my husband who usually likes less salt than me thought it was fine. Get the carpaccio!!
Food was AMAZING in every way! Service was great and personable and knowledgeable. The bar staff new how to make martinis!!!! Ambiance was open and simple. A no fuss no muss.

Visited at 5 pm on a Sunday.  Reservations were required,  did not have any but they allowed me to sit on a stool. Was not very hungry so ordered garlic bread and a gorgonzola and pear salad.  The salad was small and had apples, but no pear in it. Cost $30. Price to value relationship was not there fur me.

This is a really decent Italian restaurant right around the corner from New Regent Street. We had the tagliatelle ragu bolognese and the cappriciossa pizza. 

Both were very tasty. Not the best I've ever had, but definitely decent. Nice ambiance.

A cute spot that's close to the main strip, yet in the cut (with a cute gift shop around the corner). The wine and pizza here are tasty and organic. An unexpected, yet cool find in Christchurch. Great service, comfortable space.
Really delicious gluten free food. A little on the pricey side. In a beautiful building with a warm and welcoming feeling on the inside.

Italian food in New Zealand, I didn't come in with high hopes.   I was extremely surprised and pleased.   The gnocchi was cooked and prepared to perfection.  I've been all over Italy and I would put this gnocchi up against some of the best in Italy.   This is a really gem.  Did I mention that the gnocchi is delicious?????    Gosh I can't get over it!!!!

Perfection. Imagine that you are arriving into a new city alone and travel worn. You wander down a cobblestone road and stumble into a festive modern establishment with elegance hailed from the early 20th century. Now imagine that you are greeted by servers who great you like family, long lost, recently found and treated to wine that sets your appetite on fire. Then as you engage in a dance with a parade of exceptional dishes, salads and pastas each unique in their own right you might admire the superb decorating or the music that does everything to elevate your senses and therefore the flavor of the food. And as you wander back into the street with a belly filled with a warmth only great food can give you have the chance to fall in love with the new city you happened to fall in. 


Based on the personal experiences of Coleta Marie

1/1/2018, my fiance and I arrived at Christchurch that day after a long drive from Picton. Not surprisingly many restaurants were closed for the holiday so we were searching for places on Yelp and calling the ones that seemed appealing. Luckily for us, Francesca's was open.

We came here for a relatively early dinner and were able to get street parking. The restaurant itself is a quite larger open space, while I can't say it stood out appearance wise, it was definitely pleasant looking. We were seated almost immediately and considering that the rest of the city seemed to be abandoned, it was pretty lively in here.

The menu has a decent amount of options, we usually order a bruscheta to start but didn't feel like it this time around so we just went with mains. I ordered the Pasta Norma (tomato, chili, capers, goats cheese, pecorino with casareccia pasta) while he went with the House made potato gnocchi (braised Wakanui beef cheeks, gremolata, pecorino). I enjoyed my dish a lot, it was fresh and flavorful.

For a place of this size the service can often be compromised as waiters tend to forget about some tables, this wasn't the case here. 

Our time at this restaurant was short but definitely enjoyable.

Got there right after 5 to score a table since reservations really seem to be necessary. I saw several people get turned unfortunately bc they were booked up on a Tuesday night. The house pinot grigio is very crisp and bright. The zucchini bruschetta was bland  I think it needed salt And acid maybe. Not enough goat cheese either but the pear gorgonzola salad was terrific! Fresh and flavorful.  My porcini prosecco risotto was rich but not overpowering. Decadent almost. I could have eaten more it was so good. Generous amount of mushrooms And cheese. Very nice dish. Would love to have it again. Well balanced. I could go on and on. The service was good and friendly. Prices were on par with everywhere else I've been in new zealand. Loved the style and decor, simple modem with fun accents. I wish I was here longer to try one of their pizzas.

Me and my wife's favorite spot on our honeymoon. The pasta was to die for! The gnocchi (house made) and beef cheeks... amazing.  Whenever we come back to New Zealand this restaurant will be a must on our list.

This place was a hidden gem for us. We wandered in for an early dinner at 5:30pm and were seated immediately. They told us we had to be out by 7:30pm for dinner rush, but honestly... that's plenty of time to eat.

We ordered two different mains. One was the Salsiccia pizza. We saw the chef tossing the dough fresh before putting it into the pizza oven! This pizza came with pork sausage, tomato, roasted onion, ricotta, rocket and mozzarella. So... if you like cheesy sausage pizza, it's the one you want.

We also ordered the lamb ragu paparadelle. Super fresh pasta, rich flavors with the lamb... it absolutely hit the spot and was a flavor party in my mouth.

The service took everything up a notch and we had a great conversation with the chef as well. 

Come if you can!

The lamb Raghu was an amazing dish. Pear and Gorgonzola salad was as stated. Service was friendly and attentive which really pushed this to 5 stars. I came in for lunch which wasn't busy but the host was verifying a bunch of reservations so can assume one would be needed for dinner. Recommended.

Wandered in to this restaurant for lunch. The food was outstanding and the wait staff kind and informative.  The potato skins were crispy and the kale salad fresh . Had a beetroot pasta that was exceptional . Would definitely come here again.

The pizza was amazing - so it was absolutely worth wandering around for a bit to find this place! We didn't realize Base was in the Little High Eatery and it took walking around the block to find it. What a fun food area. A little something for everyone in the food court. We were very pleased with our pizza. The crust wasn't too thick, the right portion of toppings - it was perfectly cooked and worth waiting for. In fact, we grabbed a drink and an appetizer somewhere else while we waited.
Our go-to on UberEats. Always delicious pizzas. The mushroom feta is a must-try. Proper wood fired pizza bases and quality toppings.

We had the best pizza here!  This buzzing place is located in the Little High Eatery.  Looking online Little High Eatery has reservation times so we thought this included all of the restaurants, including Base Pizza.  Since no seating times were available we ordered takeout and walked over to pick it up.  I think the reservations are for indoor seating because there was plenty of open seating outdoors!  We just grabbed a table and went up to the host and they simply moved our takeaway pizza up in the queue for "dine in" and it was ready even sooner!  The large pizza was perfect for the two of us.  Such great pizza!  Highly recommend!  (And if you're with a non-pizza lover, there are many other food options at this location)!
great pizza, love the little high. not a big difference between the small and large size though

This was great wood fired pizza. We came here twice on our trip. I was so focused on pizza I didn't even look at the rest of the menu until we were about to leave and I think I missed some other good things! Someday when I go back to NZ I will try the other items on their menu!

3 of us dined here tonight (July 2018) and throughly enjoyed our meal. It is situated in the little high eatery, which has an eating hall feel. Very hip and trendy with lots of boutique beers on tap throughout the 8 different businesses. I cannot recommend highly enough. We had the spring rolls from the Thai stall, very fresh. Our main meal was a pepperoni pizza (sgt peppers) and meatlovers (sir george). Very very nice. Base was the best wood fired base I've had. Toppings where spot on too.

The map is correct! Ignore the previous reviews, Base has moved from the restart mall to Little High. The pizza is excellent. Little High is a food court with about 8 appealing restaurants. Cool, funky, and busy. All of the offerings look good.

Excellent pizza. Crust is thin, but not crunchy like a cracker. Slices are foldable for easy (and quick) eating! Definitely made to order flavor. Pepperoni is also notable with lots of black pepper.

Hard to find with all construction, but inside upscale food court at Little High Eatery. Not in container mall any more, take note.

ITS NOT WHERE IT SAYS IT IS ! 
It's amazing pizza we really enjoyed it but the map says it's in re start mall but it's actually in a place called little high eatery. We made that mistake.
But otherwise it's really really good pizza at a good price and I would highly recommend it!
AMAZING PIZZA! Made fresh and was cool to see it being made. Very friendly staff, defiantly recommend and certainly will be going back :)

Delicious pizza! The perfect blend between simple flavors and unique pizza combinations. I tried both the Moroccan Lamb and the Sir George pizzas. Absolutely fantastic. Portion size isn't huge, I'd say get a pizza per person. And for New Zealand pizza, it's got good prices. Overall, I'm a fan of Base.

Base Woodfired Pizza, undoubtedly serves the best pizzas in town! Located in the re-start mall, this is one of the many other restaurants, cafes, shops, food trucks located here. Really cool place to walk around by the way.

They carry a limited variety of pizzas and I really wanted to get the butter chicken pizza. Unfortunately they sold out of butter chicken pizzas that day and I ended up getting a large order of Moroccan lamb pizza. We were initially a bit skeptical because the menu board mentioned that they add yogurt sauce and mango chutney on top of the pizzas. But ordered it nevertheless and took a seat outside waiting until our token number was called. 

Within a few minutes, our token number was called out and the pizza was served.

Oh my, this was way too good. The crust was thin and crispy, just the way I love it. The thin lamb slices were marinated an cooked well. The yogurt sauce and mango chutney which we were quite skeptical about worked out so well. And the arugula on top - yumm.

Two of us split the large pizza and it was perfect! Love this little find. Thanks to Yelp.

Nice place to have a good pizza. I have been there with the family several times.I love pizza and have eaten it all over the world and this is a good one.
The place is also very cute it's at the container mall,there is always a great atmosphere. Love to go there.

I have been exploring food joints in the city lately and I found this place really good. They have some of the best pizzas in town and every food lover out there should try.
My personal recommendations are butter chicken pizza, vege supreme, and almost everything in their menu :)

Freakin delicious pizza!  Located in the Re:START mall, this is a perfect stop for lunch or just a snack. 

The Sgt. Peppers had a nice spicy marinara and meaty slices of pepperoni.  I  even came back the next day to try the butter chicken pizza which came juicy chicken and a mild curry sauce.  $10 for the small pizza is plenty to share.  Highly recommend!

Really good pizza with inventive ingredients in the heart of the container mall downtown Christchurch. As with virtually everything else down there, it is operated out of a shipping container, but there is a large beer hall style table in front that you can sit at while you enjoy your pizza. The prices are good and the pizza is interesting and tasty.
stopped to get salad. got greek salad + falafel + lebanese hummus. everything was amazing. delicious food. would come back if I could.

Best take away I have had!

The lamb is so perfectly seasoned and tender! You can tell the dish has been cooking for some time! The potatoes soak up all the juicy goodness but don't mush. The peas are perfect with a hint of mint and made to order. 

The service is efficient and friendly. 

Please note it seems that when they run out they close as I tried for a couple days before I successfully got to order. You can order from an ap for delivery so that is a choice as well. Also, you must pre order if you would like a leg.
It's a takeaway joint. There aren't any seats nor tables. I bought it back to savour with a group of friends. It was the best lamb shoulder I've eaten! Meat was just nice. Very enjoyable

It's simple.  They have the BEST lamb.  Lamb and potatoes, it doesn't get much better.  They have figured out the secret recipe to these two simple and delicious dishes.  If I wouldn't feel like such a fatty, I would eat an entire shoulder by myself in one sitting, just because it taste so good.  If you are in the area, do yourself a favor and go pick some up, bring it somewhere and eat it while enjoying a bottle wine.

Pedro's House of Lamb is a takeaway restaurant operating out of a trailer in a parking lot. That having been said, they do only one thing, and that they do very well. It's all about the lamb. It is very moist, tender, and delicious! It comes with scalloped potatoes, period. That's it for the menu. The price per portion is $50. It wasn't until I got home and opened the box that I realized that one portion easily feeds two people. The benefit of buying too much food is that there are left overs for another day! One can book online but if ordering between 4-8pm it is better to order by phone. If you like lamb shank, this place is for you.

Walk up for takeout.

Such a succulent piece of Lamb. The rosemary and spices were absolutely done to perfection. 

Simple pan of meat and potatoes, but add a salad or pick one up at a store, and this is a "MUST DO" in Christchurch.

Huge portion for $50 NZ

My petite wife and I afterwards, were thinking, I can't believe we almost ate the whole thing........

Well done guys!

I will eat here again and bring friends......and then we will go to the park and have a great meal and enjoy the park beauty.

This place is the bomb!  I was staying at the George and was looking for a bite to eat--this place was only a 2 minute drive away and the reviews looked good so I gave it a shot.  The lamb shoulder and potatoes were delish!  More than enough food for two.  The key is to shred the lamb a bit and mix it in with the juices--makes it nice and tender and flavorful. Highly recommended.

Our debut into New Zealand lamb, and Pedro's did not disappoint. Luckily, they were close to our hotel, because we had to check back a couple times to catch them at a time when they were open (4-8). Other than some novelty shirts and sausage, they only sell one thing: lamb shoulder with scalloped potatoes and you can buy bread baguettes. 

The sales guy was great, even showed us the plate of food so we could understand sizing, and recommended bread for soaking up the juice. The lamb is so tender, almost like a pot roast, with a lovely, crispy exterior. The potatoes are not as cheesy as scalloped potatoes I've had in the past, but they accompany the lamb very well. Definitely get the bread...because soaking up the juice is the best part!

I wish there had been a few outdoor picnic tables, but nevertheless, we grabbed our mound of food and had a nice time eating it back in our hotel. We even had leftovers for breakfast.
So easy and so good! Rosemary infused potatoes and lamb braised to perfection. They offer excellent rustic baguettes tthat are well worth the $2. Don't miss this ample, delicious meal.
wasn't outstanding but simply good. if you drop by christchurch, this is a must try. I love the lamb but not the potato though. maybe just my taste.

Love it. My first meal in NZ and what a winner.  Cost is still 40$ which gets you plenary of food for 2 people.  The lamb shank was perfectly cooked and very soft.  The potatoes are ok- personally I would've preferred roasted m or mashed. 

Add some bread to dip in the gravy.

You know those delicious-looking wool-covered white things that you see all over New Zealand? Well they actually are delicious. I have not found a place in the world that cooks 'em up better than Pedro's in Christchurch.

If you mistook this place for a place that screws around, then you would be mistooken. They most certainly do not. Pedro knows what the people want, and what they want is a big ol' lamb shoulder + potatoes, bathed in the juices, paired with either a top quality brew from an establishment like 8 Wired, Epic, Renaissance, Tuatara, or Liberty, or a top quality pinot noir from Central Otago. That is it. You do not need anything else on the menu, or in life. (Maybe tacos occasionally, and a good episode of "Game of Thrones")

If you're by yourself like me, aimlessly roaming around New Zealand as Bob Dylan would say "Like a Rolling Stone" (in my case I like to picture myself as Mick Jagger), and you go here, be hungry. Very hungry. There's one meal you can get here. It's enormous, and it's $40. Want something else? Something smaller? On a diet? Vegan? If so, the only thing to do is GTFO and STFU. The guy there pegged me as a morbidly obese McDonald's-gruffling American even though I'm only a slightly overweight taco-gruffling American, and he said I could probably finish it all. Dude thinks we're all Joey Chestnut. I'm not, so it lasted two meals. May last more than two for you if you're not American and/or not fat. 

In short, this place is the most legit lamb joint in Kiwiland. For the upcoming elections for the king of the "Game of Thrones" House Lambister, I have three words for you: VOTE FOR PEDRO!
Highly recommended as a good all-round top class meal - those that remember dining in at Pedro's pre-quake can reminisce and the rest will still love one of the heartiest meals known to man!!

Looking for a GREAT meal at a great price? Looking to savor some delicious New Zealand lamb? Look no farther - this is the place. They say it serves two, but if you have three people you'll still each have a full meal. 

Slow roasted lamb, accompanied with scalloped potatoes. Cooked to perfection the meat falls off the bone. 

Accompany this with a glass of Otago Pinot Noir and you'll have the quintessential NZ dinner.

We love Pedros! One dish comfortably feeds both of us with sandwiches for the next couple of days.
It's just a good hearty Lamb meal with delicious potatoes as well. We normally add greens as a side.

This place SO rocked and they were open on a Sunday night.  Chef told us one tray would feed two but we ordered four trays, three of which was a good feed for 10! Lamb was cooked to perfection and the scalloped potatoes were the perfect addition. Pedro's is located next to an equally awesome liquor store with a great selection of libations.
Zc. I couldn't be in New Zealand without having New Zealand lamb I stopped by Pedro's and pick up the best meal I've had since I've been to New Zealand

I understand the skepticism for a five star review of a food truck located in a liquor store parking lot, but you have to trust me on this one. You can pre-order your lamb dinner to pick up on your way home so you can strut through the door like the dinner hero or, if you arrive on the early side, can try your luck the day of. The meal is easily enough for 4 people to enjoy and consists of a perfectly prepared lamb shoulder that is fall off the bone delicious and roast potatoes that are smooth and creamy. For $40, you absolutely get your money's worth and then some. I recommend it for couples on a budget as you can get several meals out of this one amazing dish. Can't fail to mention how nice the guys in the truck are either!

Pedros does one dish, lamb and potatoes. It used to have a restaurant location, which was destroyed in the earthquake. They've reinvented themselves as a food truck with no seating.

A small place with no real physical location is easy to evaluate. The lamb is fantastic and potatoes are mediocre. There is plenty of food (3 of us shared it for a lunch and were full). And at $35, it's one of the cheapest meals around.

Pedro Lamb that falls right off the bone. Delicious! The meals are huge - with the lamb and the potatos so you get a lot for your money. Since the quake Pedro has set up home in a little food truck in front of Liquor King. Pedro and his staff are always lovely to deal with. Highly recommended.

Quoting from the last reviewer, "roast lamb done right".  That's exactly what Pedro's is.  It's lamb, out of a food truck, with sketchy ever-changing hours, no seating, and they run out of food some days if you leave it til too late, but they do their roast lamb right.  We got a lamb shoulder for $35, which fed two girls (*ahem* ladies) for two meals - so I think a family of four could turn this into one tasty, complete meal.  The lamb came with potatoes, also done right, in a large takeout aluminum container.  Definitely delicious, and definitely worth a try.  I thought it was expensive at first until I realized how much food we got. Dinner for four for $35 in NZ?  That's practically unheard of!

This place obviously specializes in lamb, and as a food truck/trailer literally serves only lamb shoulders and legs, along with scalloped potatoes as a side.  They also sell some pork products imported from various parts of Europe, but that's definitely not the emphasis. 

The first night we tried coming here we found that the lamb was already sold out- the owner kindly told us that it'd behoove us to call in an order for the next day (which was the last day of our trip in NZ).  We did so, and picked up a HUGE leg of lamb and a large tray of potatoes for ~$50 NZD.  The leg was more than enough to feed my parents, my wife, and me.  Flavor wise, the lamb was done very well- it was simply roast lamb done right.  There was a crisp but not charred/burnt surface, with a pool of natural juices enhancing the flavor of each bite of meat we dipped into it.  

We ate our meal off of a picnic bench in front of a bunch of kids playing tennis before returning our rental car to the airport.  Nothing elegant about it- and I woudn't've had it any other way.  This place is a winner folks.

Kind of hard to beat this location just inside the gate of the botanical gardens. What a pleasant atmosphere it has! The food was good, not great...but good. The best part is the freshness of the sauces and vegetables thanks to the fact it's all grown right behind the restaurant. The gardens are amazing and well worth the effort to check them out either before of after dinner. We had the seafood special and the seafood stew...both delicious. It's a nice dinner out.

Loved this place!  Found some good so tried it for lunch and the food was great.  The calamari was not my favorite, but the garden salad, croquettes and cheese plate were wonderful.  Had some great dry rose wine, as well.  If you are in the area, it's a must do.  Nice scenery.
A very pleasant lunch location at the edge of a large park and gardens. Fresh seafood and small plates, with a delicious soup. Service was a little slow, yet friendly and helpful with the menu.

Went by for an early supper with my wife. A very nice place, and despite the rating the prices were not too bad. We had the Tapas sampler plus the lamb tapa, and they were all very good. I felt we were ignored a bit by our waiter, but perhaps they were getting ready for their 6pm rush. I would definitely recommend reservations unless you are going by at 5pm as we did.
Had the grilled fish and sangria. Lovely meal. Had to whisper because it was so quiet!

We went here for dinner and it was a lovely experience. The service was exceptional, good menu knowledge and could accommodate variations. I also found the service attentive but not intrusive and could anticipate our needs without us having to ask. The food was amazing. Big portion sizes too. We had the bread with tomato and olive oil plus a dish of olives. For main we had vegetable trio and lamb shoulder and desert was brownie and almond tart. The food was fresh, full of flavor  and cooked to perfection. I know the chef not only takes pride in what they do but loves what they do, this was reflected in every dish. This restaurant comes highly recommended from me

Beautiful setting in the Botanic Gardens situated next to the Avon river. There is an extensive herb garden on one side of the old stone house. It was really hot so we ate outside on the side patio under umbrellas with a view of the garden.
We had the croquettes , lamb and an amazing salad with goat cheese.
It was all delicious !
We had a sweet waitress who was very attentive and nice glasses of wine ( pretty good selection to choose from).
A wonderful way to enjoy a warm summer night in Christchurch .

A bit of an oddball place for lunch, but the location (literally in the Botanic Gardens) and the view (the Botanic Gardens) are hard to beat and the tapas were excellent. 

The restaurant was quiet around lunch time, and we sat outside on the verandah to avoid the wind. Initially, we looked at the tapas menu and started wondering what we'd gotten ourselves into--ordering the plates piecemeal from the menu was a bit pricey for lunch. Fortunately, we noticed the lunchtime tapas platter that was meant to share, reasonably priced, and happened to include the tapas we'd planned to order anyway. Everything--the mushrooms, the croquettes, the chorizo--was delicious. 

I only wish we'd had time to come back and explore the wine list...

For our last night in Christchurch we stumbled upon this restaurant while exploring the Christchurch Botanic Garden. We ordered potatoes and croquettes. Along with that we had a pitcher or red sangria. Amazing ! Make sure to have the sangria. The atmosphere was astonishing, the staff was super friendly. Definitely check this place out if you're around the area.

Curators house,
The truth is that ,I did not enjoy the paella,it is once again not authentic Spanish.saying that I also have to say they have the best chorizo I have tasted in Chch.The chorizo can be bought from there shop.
I know what I am speaking about I lived in Spain for 20 years and got trained there as a professional chef.
The place is gorgeous,and it has a beautiful view.
Fine dining at its best. The type of place you go to that you always have to order a Scotch Fillet. Staff are always polite and friendly.
Not really a Tapas sort of guy but the authentic Paella topped up with the odd Tapas to fill was spectacular. Great setting in Botanic gardens open (fake) fire on cold, wet night. Fabulous.

A great spot to enjoy a glass of wine and some tapas after getting lost in the Botanic Gardens. With spectacular views of the Botanic Garden fountain and blooming flowers, it's hard to find a more picturesque location. The Curators House has indoor and outdoor seating which caters to the warm days and the chillier days. Their spanish tapas menu will set you back some dollars, but will leave you satisfied and they have a great list of local and imported wines for pairing.

We're a long way from home (San Diego, CA, USA) but at the Curators House we were made to feel right at home.  The staff was very friendly and helpful and the owner Javier stopped by the table twice to say hello and talk about the preparation of the dishes.  

We had been to the restaurant before the big quake and had heard that they had damage and had been closed for quite some time.  We wondered if it would be as good as we remembered - and is was!  We had several tapas plates followed by lamb shoulder and a Spanish seafood stew.  They were top notch.  The wine list was not spectacular but solid and we had no trouble finding good pairings. 

Of course, dining at the Curators is not complete if you don't take the time to roam the gardens.  A real first class garden mixing both a working garden and a decorative.  All in all a real complete experience!

What a wonderful place to have dinner while in Christchurch.  The location is lovely, adjacent to the botanical gardens, and the restaurant itself, is, as the name states, in the old curators cottage so history and charm abound.

We were lucky to get in on this Thursday night, the place was busy but I was lucky as my concierge pulled some strings and got us a cute table for two right in front of the window overlooking the garden.  A prime location, indeed!

Service was a bit slow which is why not the perfect score, but that may have been due to the fact that the place was very busy as it was a holiday the next day.

While they are known for their Spanish tapas, their menu has a pretty wide range.  Depending on how you want to eat, you can order a range of tapas to share as your dinner or a couple of tapas to begin with and then a couple of mains.  We chose to do the latter.

First up, we split the charcuterie plate.  This thing was huge and came with several kinds of meat as well as some bruschetta to enjoy it in.  We also had the lamb tapas which also was perfect for sharing.

For my main, I went with the lamb shoulder special of the day which was super tasty and very tender.  My friend wanted a steak and his came out perfectly prepared as well.

The ambiance is cute and the food is very good.  I also liked that the location allows for a stroll before or after dinner in the beautiful botanical gardens.  Dinner with drinks for two ran about $168 which was really reasonable given the quantity of food we consumed.

Too bad I don't live closer as this would go on my "to go again" list for sure!

I've been here a couple of times pre and post earthquake. I have very fond memories of having my 21st dinner here (way pre-EQ!) which was fantastic. Decor is nice, its a wonderful old house with fantastic views across Hagley Park. 

Post-EQ I would say its a lovely place to come for drinks when the sun is shining. The outdoor area overlooking the park is amazingly relaxing on a warm summers afternoon/evening. 

Last time I ate here though I have to say I was quite disappointed. There was a group of 6 of us and the meals were nothing special. Two of the steaks which had been requested medium-rare were in fact very well done and chewy and not so nice to eat, bordering on inedible. We debated saying anything as all of us are quite non-confrontational but one of us took up the baton and made the waiter aware! He ended up comping some desserts but I couldn't recommend this place on food alone. Although the chocolate mousse was good, the rest of the food was underwhelming. Maybe we hit the chef on a  bad day? 

I probably won't be back for dinner, unless someone else makes the reservations.

On my last experience I would give this place 2.5 stars but seeing as I can't give half stars though yelp I rounded up to three as two seemed a little harsh. It gets rounded up for the outside drinks area.

I've heard such good things about the Curator's House Restaurant so we headed over there to celebrate my sister's birthday. Unfortunately the experience was one we'd all like to forget. The food wasn't good - two of the meals had to be sent back as the requests had been ignored, one of them was under cooked and the service was terrible. The waitress looked like she really didn't care and had so many other places she'd rather be (which is probably true but at least pretend!)

None of us have been back since. Such a shame as they have a really lovely location....
Great food and atmosphere!   Beautiful day here in Christchurch.   There's so many choices you can't go wrong

It is a food court filled with so many amazing restaurants! Everything looked good. I went to the Asian one and it was fire!!!! 

There is seating, bathrooms and filter water :)

Doesn't look like much when you walk pass but definitely worth popping in at this place. We had lunch at El Fogón Grill and  the steak and chicken was so delicious and juicy. Ankush gave us excellent service.Tx

When your part can't agree on a cuisine, this is a great solution. Multiple eateries under one roof makes for a bowl of ramen and a  margarita, or ca pizza & sushi. The process are reasonable, and the outdoor seating was lovely. We had starters here, then on to bigger things. However, you could spend a lot of time exploring eateries here, and leave satisfied.
Little High Eatery was a great find. We stumbled across it after having already eaten lunch unfortunately. But we sampled a few things. Lots of options. Beautiful space.

There is not enough seating at all, and after all of this time that Little High has been opened, you'd think it would quieten down and there would be more seating available, but there never is. I've gone there at least 5 times and had to walk away and find a random restaurant at the last minute due to not being able to get a seat. 

The range of food is good, although it would be nice to see more gluten free options in the Asian cuisine food stalls.

A great find in Christchurch! There was an option here for everyone. I ended up going with the Thai restaurant and tried their Pad Thai. I was surprised that they put cauliflower in it, that's not something they do back home in Seattle!! But it tasted great, I just wish it had been more spicy

This is a building with several restaurants and shared seating.  This review applies just to the space.  It's a fun set of restaurants with several choices in different styles.  Getting a seat is pretty competitive, we had to orbit a bit to get a spot to sit.  Probably a better choice when it's nice outside and the patio seating is also available -- it was raining and that eliminated a percentage of the available seating.  The signage is subtle so you may need to look around a bit to find it.

We had a fantastic meal here with our friends and our kids. We kind of got some of everything and had quite the feast - it was really fun. 

Highlights were a meat plate, dumpling sampler, matcha soft serve, noodles and the apple mango rolls. 

Skip the margaritas - no alcohol in them. I paid $20NZ for a large - which it was - but it was pretty much like flavored ice.
Not visible from High Street, at least when I went. You need to walk into the building to find it. Listen for the music. Really great place with lots of food choices, but not much seating indoors.

Little High Eatery is a wonderful, casual area of several small restaurants covering various cuisines and sharing a warm, lively space.  I remember places focused on burgers, pizza, and Japanese, as well as a bar, but there were four or more additional restaurants.  (Thai, Chinese, Latin American, and desserts, maybe?)  There's also a Malaysian restaurant just outside.  I've had very good burgers and pizza here, and I would definitely come again for those or to try more of the excellent-looking places.

There's plenty of indoor and outdoor seating, but the large crowds here do mean that these fill up.  This is especially true of the indoor area during the winter, but assorted heaters keep at least some of the outdoor tables mostly comfortable in the chill.  A very good musician was performing on one of the nights I came here, and nice recorded background music was playing on the other night.

It's nice to have a lot of choices here.  Everyone can choose what they're in the mood for.  We tried the pizza place, which was really good.  It is a little crowded, even during off-peak times, so be prepared for that.

Eightgrains:

I ordered two takeaway waffles, one with vanilla icecream, and one with matcha icecream. After waiting about 30 minutes for my order, I asked how long it would take and was told it was "on it's way", however about 10 minutes later, an employee approached me and asked what I had ordered. After telling her I ordered two waffles, she proceeded to look around and then come back only to say that they would get them started. About 10 minutes later I was handed a bag with the two waffles and the icecream, and when I opened it, there was no matcha. At this point I had waited 50 minutes for two $12 waffles and one of the orders wasn't even correct. The waffles also seemed undercooked and soggy.

The employees were nice enough to add popcorn and some syrups because of how long we'd been waiting, but it definitely doesn't make up for everything.

I understand that when working with food it is easy for orders to be forgotten and occasionally messed up but I'm just very sad.

To boot, when not ordered takeaway, it comes with a waffle cone, but there was no waffle cone. It would just be nice to be told that there is no waffle cone if you order it take away.

I am let down because all of my previous experiences at eightgrains have been wonderful, and after this I am unsure if I would return.

:(

Exceptionally good and an excellent value!

Bacon Bros Burgers are located INSIDE 'The Little High Eatery' which has multiple fine eating establishments.  It's on High Street, but it's a little hard to find because you're looking for the Bacon Bros sign which is hidden, so look for the 'The Little High Eatery' sign (see the picture I posted...)  The whole eatery is more like OFF an alley off High Street and is easily obscured by some taller buildings.  Doesn't matter, FIND IT, it's worth it.

'The Little High Eatery' has about a dozen really cool, bohemian, artesian places.  Always better to support local than chains, go get out of Bubba Gump or the Olive Garden, and go to Bacon Bros.  Seriously kickin' burger, cooked perfectly, all the ingredients were fresh, the brioche bun soft but slightly chewy at the same time, and some nice slab bacon on top.  Very reasonably priced.  ABSOLUTELY PERFECT!!

If I lived in Wellington I'd be a serious regular and they'd know my name within a couple weeks.  It's a serious burger done right...

This food court is a hidden gem in Christchurch. I was in the city for 2 days and went both. The miso and tonkotsu ramen from Sushi soldier were delicious. On top of that, the parrillada for one from El Fogon was really tasty.

Review for eightgrain, the Chinese dumpling place. Pan fried red wine brisket dumplings are fantastic. Plump and lots of meat. The crystal shrimp dumplings are har gow and are tasty. I like the thicker skin on these. The XLB are ok. Skin is too thick and breaks because they have the dumplings touch each other!! Ugh. Flavor is good though. Pork belly bun is bad - pork belly is dry and way way too much peanut on them. If you want pork belly, get a Bacon Brothers burger next door.

Tried this place out on a whim a few nights ago and I was really glad I did! I ordered the Fried Chicken Donburi Rice Bowl. . .so delicious!. . .The meal was served nice and hot and the noodles were especially tasty. For dessert, they offered a delicious chocolate cake with ice cream. . .the service couldn't have been better. . .very attentive and offered with a smile. . .Needless to say, I will be going back!

This is the hotspot to be for happy hour or before a concert/sporting event at Horncastle or AMI Stadium. I hope you like meatballs! Most of the menu is dedicated to meatballs served many ways. Not a meatball lover? Fear not, there are other pasta/meat/pizza options as well as a small bites menu that features chips, dumplings and the like. Great finger food for sharing with friends. This place gets ROWDY, particularly before a big event, so don't plan to come here on some intimate date. I also highly recommend a booking (weeks in advance for a big night) if you want guaranteed seats. The place fills up fast. It is expensive, but it deserves to be as it's arguably one of the best dinner options on Lincoln (for now).

I walked around Christschurch for hours looking for something that caught my eye and this did! Very inviting exterior with open patio leading into the bar. I love the open interior with subtle breaks in the space to add dimension. The style is classy mixed with sports bar, something doe everyone! 

The service was friendly, helpful, and fast!

The bathroom was so pretty I took a picture. I also love free wifi being I'm just visiting and have no other phone access. They don't hide it with passwords or usage restrictions, very easy. 

Full bar and lots of delicious brews on tap. I paired my veggie nacho with a crisp apple cider. The nacho, veggie option was loaded with portobello mushrooms! No skimping for the vegetarians here! 

No complaints here would highly recommend!

Food is pretty good. Meatballs are their thing and they do them well in a variety of guises. We tried them in the pizza, the shepherds pie and the hoagie. Restaurant area is cordoned off from the restaurant behind screens which seems rather weird and unnecessary. Place was pretty empty, and the restaurant seems to be a bit of an after thought. No matter, it all worked pretty well.

This place is awesome. Something for everyone. The food is the highlight! Decor is comfortable and service friendly. The bar snacks are awesome and the ribs would go close to being the best I have had. 6 stars out of 5!

YES.

This place is so unique. A restaurant/Bar where the dining area is nicely seperated from the bar area which is quite a large space. 

The menu is pretty unique. You pick your meat for your meatballs, your style of having them. Straight, with pasta, in a pizza and many more, and then you pick your sauce.

Dessert: I highly recommend the mars bar bread and butter pudding.
Had butchers platter, very good cuts of wagyu, lamb and filet. Cooked just right medium rare. Good service.
Delicious beetroot bruschetta and Pinot noir. Great service in the bar area. Very comfortable time. Thank you.

Overall Bloody Mary's was a good option for a nice dinner.

Unfortunately the service was horrible while we were there. The waitress kept trying to take our plates and drinks away before we were done. I had to ask her three separate times to not take my bread plate. We were being pushed through our dinner. Then when we ordered more cocktails it took more than 30 minutes to get and we only got them after we flagged down another server. 

They do have a nice cocktail list with good options. Loved The Sandi'a. The oysters were ok but very briny. I ordered an award winning New Zealand beef cut that was delicious. (Greenstone Creek Scotch). The potatoes that accompanied were underwhelming. 

The atmosphere was a highlight - comfortable and classy.

Food was excellent! Unfortunately our experience was not the best. Due to our servers lack of knowledge behind the restaurant/menu. She did not introduce us to the restaurant or the menu. We ordered the oysters. "I'm sorry those aren't available. We sold our last ones last night." What? Why didn't you say that? They post the grams/ml for drinks / food. which we're not used to. I asked about the wine size in ounces. They post under grams 250. She said she didn't know. Of course I could do my own calculations on my phone. And ruin the ambiance. The steaks are definitely for sharing. She let us order 1 steak each. Never mentioning how big they are- a whopping 20 ounces. As soon as she left I waved down the maître d. I explained what had happened. And he said oh yes those are huge steaks. He went to the back to cancel one of our steaks. The manager then comes out and says it's too late. That they're already being prepared. That he would give us 50% off the steak. The
Money was not an issue. It's food waste. I tried to explain the server issue without ruining our experience. Felt like we were getting into a back and forth discussion. The service we received was not at the level you would expect from a fine dining restaurant. I did hear our neighbors server explain every detail of the menu/restaurant. So they do have knowledgeable servers! Next time!
Great steaks, great experience, well worth it. One of my pork bellies was overdone but the other was absolutely superb. My partner got the Wagyu and it was mind blowing.

Food and service excellent.   The Silere Alpine Merino Lamb Rack was perfectly prepared and tender.   The fully loaded seafood chowder starter full of tender seafood.   We've been in New Zealand for two weeks and everywhere we went the lamb was great and found this the best so far.  Recommend giving this restaurant a go.

I wanted to have lamb lunch, so I yelped and found some lamb pictures on this place. After I got a menu I realized the lamb is only served for dinner. This point was a bit disappointing since the lunch was the last meal in New Zealand trip. I instead had serloin steak, which was good. So I had a good experience but if you are seeking for lamb at lunch it is better to look for other places.
Fantastic food. Beat meal we had on South Island. Venison was to die for. Highly recommended.

We had the chicken Caesar salad. Has to be one of de better saladas for centurions of Roman legions. It was mainly young tender but crisp lettuce. With crunchy bacon and dressing on side. The chicken was a bit dry. The salmon main was delicious garnished with mussels. Just warm with crunchy seared skin. The prices for the beef mainswere similar to countries which didn't grow cows. So took a rain check fora birthday party or anniversary.

We came here to order the Mary's Cut Aged Beef. It's 7-day aged and slow cooked over 24 hours. Leading up to the main meal we had the garlic flat bread and oysters which came out both fast and incredibly tasty. They were probably some of the best oysters I had and were light enough to prepare for the main dish. The steak itself was incredible. The meat was so tender and flavorful that you didn't need any additional sauce or seasoning, however if you want an extra level of depth I enjoyed the garlic butter and peppercorn sauces for just the right amount of added flavor. Afterwards we had the Mary's affagato which wrapped up the flavors perfectly.

Honestly the food was so good it left me almost in tears. The meat here is also sourced from a halal plant in the area so it's friendly for Muslim travelers like myself. A must-stop place if you find yourself in Christchurch.

Well this place lived up to its name. 

Our steaks where very good. 

The staff where helpful and very friendly. 

There's not much more to say than if you're looking for a great steak restaurant then go no further than here.

In town on holiday and had the best meal of the trip! We were in search of something authentic to New Zealand and for me that was lamb chops. I have to say they didn't disappoint!! They were absolutely amazing and delish. My husband ordered the prime rib and he was as equally pleased. The roasted beets with goat cheese is were super yummy as well. My daughter ordered a steak and gobbled it up as well. The overall experience was topped by great service by Bella. We highly recommend you try it out!!!

The food was good, although the blue cheese and asparagus soup was tasteless with too much raw asparagus in the soup.  However, the service was really poor for a lunch time meal without a lot of people in the restaurant, took far too long.  

We actually stayed at this hotel and just decided to try lunch on the last day.  The hotel is much better than the restaurant.

We didn't make a reservation so we walked in as we stayed close by.  They have to sides to the restaurant the bar (doesn't require booking) or the main restaurant which requires booking.  They weren't full either sides but the reception said they can only spare us a table in 20 min.  We had time anyway so we waited at the bar.  Staff were friendly.  The service was a bit slow.  Food was very good.  Esp the lamb.  But don't go if you are extremely hungry else you may faint before your food arrives.
Delicious steak and amazing sauces. Great service and a nice atmosphere. Able to secure a last-minute reservation and a reasonable price.

Wonderful experience at this restaurant. We had to choose between the fine dining area vs the casual dining because we didn't have reservation for a table. I'm glad we chose the fine dining because we had the yummiest chataeubriand steak for two. It came with broccolini and potatoes. Wow so good! They cut it up on a large board right on your table. Loved this dining experience! We dipped it in horseradish and it was perfect! 

They have extensive wine list and beers too. I recommend this restaurant to anyone who would want a good steak!

This was the best choice we made today! My family and I all have such different taste palettes so as you can imagine making a decision on where to eat for dinner is very hard! However, making the decision to eat here was rather easy. We were all impressed about how versatile the menu was. From pizza to rib eye and fish, we were all happily satisfied with our dinners!
It's no longer here. I came all the way from a cruise terminal excited about the menu and it's not here.

This place was absolutely terrible. Ordered Jambalaya bites, which was a sad attempt to disguise undercooked rice with tomato paste and chili peppers. Fried chicken was overcooked and tough to chew.  Yuck.

To celebrate my 39th birthday, I found this restaurant called Orleans here in Christchurch, New Zealand. I did enjoy cajun and creole soul food from the USA, so it was a perfect dining option. Plus, it was a couple of blocks from the hotel.

Turning 39 years overseas was interesting, since the time zone difference in the USA was a day earlier, so it allowed me to celebrate twice. With that said, I arrived here at the Orleans restaurant and bar around 8pm on a brisk Monday evening in mid September 2018. I thought initially that the restaurant itself was closed, since there was construction going on the opposite side of the street, not realizing that the restaurant was on the other side. To my relief, I was okay and entered the restaurant. I almost had cut my losses and tried to find somewhere else in walking distance, but thankful that I had found the restaurant. During my visit here to the Orleans restaurant, it was typically Monday night in the city. I guess I came in when the dinner rush was largely over and found a group of people finishing up and leaving, letting me having the entire restaurant and bar to myself. The ambiance here was very casual and basically what you'd find in a bar setting. 

The overall experience here at Orleans restaurant and bar was nice and quiet. Kind of like the casual attitude of the place and didn't like the loud noises when coming to such places. Maybe I'm getting old and like quiet places. Either way, Orleans was nice and cozy. I dig the decor and the service was nice, friendly, and fast, even for a place that was slowing down for the night. They told me they were closing at 9pm, but the yelp page said till 12 midnight. Probably need to change it sooner or later. With that said, celebrating a birthday here with southern comfort food was nice and definitely one to remember. While I was dining alone, it was nice and pleasant. Orleans restaurant and bar is located at 89 Litchfield Street in the heart of downtown Christchurch, New Zealand. They offer live music, but during the night I was there, there was no live music. Probably on the weekends or something. They accept major credit cards, usually Visa, which are usually a great thing for us tourist folk who live on the plastic. 

Not sure about parking, although street parking is your best bet. I'm not from Christchurch, but I walked it here during my holiday in mid September 2018. Hotel was nearby and I had a craving for New Orleans type of cuisine. I'm sure Christchurch's public transportation can get you here too. There's always uber, which is nice. I ended up spending an hour here, enjoying my meal and soaking up the fact that I am not 38 anymore. It's kind of disappointing, but that's life. For my meal, I ended up getting a po boy sandwich, which is basically standard for any southern style delight. Along with that, i ordered some curly fries, which ended up being some sort of regular fries curled up and spiced up to taste differently from your Burger King type fries. I finished it up with an order of sweet ice tea. I should have gotten liquor, but I figured I'll celebrate with that later on. The po boy itself was good and tasteful. It was delicious and harmoniously hit the spot after a long day of travel from Sydney, Australia. The fries were surprisingly epic and the sweet tea was interesting. With the restaurant closing earlier than I thought, I opted to get dessert elsewhere.

Prices here were okay. Their menu was surprisingly and shockingly limited, but I guess that's how it is sometimes. Although the food ordered and the ambiance was pretty good, I thought for an place that served Cajun / Creole USA cuisine should have more items. 3.5 stars for the overall experience. 4.0 stars for the ambiance and the food. 3.5 stars for the service. 

Support local!

C+

First time trying Orleans in Christchurch. Food was very tasty. The waffle stack was delicious and a great share. The beetroot salad was light and refreshing. We then tried the cheesecake sample and the Orleans Beignets which are incredible! Our waitress Grace was amazing and checked on us to make sure everything was going well. It made the experience that much better!!

We ended up here a couple of times while we were in Christchurch.  The atmosphere was fun and the food was great.  We tried the waffle stack, which I recommend, but their recommendation to be hungry or eat it with multiple people definitely applies.  We couldn't come near to finishing it.

I used to go here a lot when it first opened, mainly around 2015-2016. When Orleans first opened they had a fantastic menu that was simple yet delicious. Their food was always hot and on time and they worked to a "first come first serve basis" without taking reservations for parties smaller than 6. 

Last night me and my Mum went back to find we were not able to sit in the restaurant because they were "fully booked". Obviously this was our fault for not researching it however I'm disappointed they have changed they way they run things. They did offer to give us food if we sat at any of the bars in Stranges' Lane (three other establishments). This sounds like it would work however after our experience, theres evidence it does not. 

We decided to stay and sit in Capa (which used to be Vespa) We looked at the menu to find that our favorite classic dishes/ sides were gone e.g no Po boys, mac'n'cheese or cornbread as well as the fact that we couldn't order a jug of lunch as we used to before. Instead we ordered two gin cocktails, overpriced for what they were- watered down, juice like cocktails, not nearly as good as we expected from this establishment. We ordered chicken and waffles and pork belly as well as a side of grilled cheese cornbread. The food took almost 40 mins to arrive, we then had to wait an extra 5 mins for cutlery. The food had clearly been sitting out as the kumara mash on the pork belly was stone cold, the pork belly was extremely chewy and impossible to eat the pork crackle. The chicken was warm, not hot and the waffle was soggy as the syrup had been sitting on it for ages. The grilled cheese was hot however the basic recipe was flawed- cornbread on its own is meant to be sweet bread as a side. When you add cheese or jalapeños (which this had) it overpowers the cornbread - basically rendering it just bread. Whoever decided to change this recipe - I really don't think they've had/ appreciated southern American cornbread before. Overall it was extremely disappointing - which we expressed to the staff at Capa. He offered us two more drinks but at that stage we just wanted to leave. We would expect this sort of service and food at a cheap takeaways however we expected a semi-fine dining experience as we had two years earlier and it was definitely not worth the $61 we paid for in our final bill. 

It's my opinion that management has changed the fundamentals that made this restaurant so great. Their kitchen may be able to handle food service for four bars in Stranges' Lane but their staff certainly can't. As we left we found another couple visiting from Australia who were also disappointing in their cold food and said it had been the worse meal they had, had in New Zealand. It makes me angry enough that a great restaurant in christchurch has been changed for the worse and I have wasted money, but to have it be a poor representation to the tourists this city dearly needs, that makes me rope-able. I won't be coming back again. And I dearly hope they change their system and menu back to how it was or least find a way to improve.

For a seafood fan - an entire  flat fish baked and stuffed with cajun prawns - simply delicious.   1-kg of BBQ beef ribs served with tangy cucumber pickles...what a combination.
.
Food : 4/5
Service : 4/5
Price : $$
Place : 4/5

I went here for dinner. I ordered the waffle with fried chicken and the fish..the taste were okay. Staff were friendly..

CONCLUSION = RECOMMENDED

This is a very cool place in a precinct close to the downtown bus depot.  I had the spicy wings, which were delicious.  I also had the rum punch cocktail -- also very good.  The service was attentive and the bar space itself was relaxing to be in.

I had just returned from working in Antarctica for 5 months and the things I missed the most was southern food and real bourbon. I found it here. Albeit, the portion sizes were not up to par what you'd find in the Southern US, but who gives a crap, morbid obesity isn't rampant in New Zealand like it is in the States. Coincidence? Maybe. Probably not. I don't know. I'm writing this after drinking several quality bourbons. 
I almost cried when I saw they had Sazerac Rye. The chicken and waffles was phenomenal. The slaw was meh. But back to the bourbon. Yeah. I'm freaking thrilled about that.

My family and I stopped here while on vacation. We happened upon it while walking around Christchurch. We are from Texas so we definitely know southern food and we were very impressed. We tried the chicken and waffles, the potato sald, the burger, and fried ocra...all of it was amazing! Fresh tasting and reasonably priced. I would definitely recommend stopping by this place while in Christchurch!

Great Southern US style food in a great atmosphere. You can sit outside in Stranges lane and order from Orleans, Stranges or 9th street, all variations on the same creole style food. Food was fantastic, the manager gave us great service, chicken & waffles, Po Boys, loaded fries, pouting with dirty gravy, fried green tomatoes....all good. Desserts even better and alcoholic shakes as well. They had a great craft beer special when we ate there, a dark IPA. I can't complain about anything really. We'll probably go back later this week as a group with my work.

Probably hands down the best chicken and waffles in New Zealand.

My family and I were skeptical of eating Cajun food in New Zealand, but Orleans proved us wrong.

The shakes were wonderful as well!!

Excellent service! Live music on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday.
Have had a number of good meals here, i'm a fan of cajun food so keep going back - menu changes frequently which is great because everything they add seems to be as good as the last!

Stopped in this place for lunch while on holidays. An absolute amazing layout that is in a cool precint. We shared the mumbo gumbo that was a great size for two people. With drinks about thirty a head. Would happily stop here again

I checked this place out based on previous recommendations and have to say it was very good. The chicken waffles were very tasty (but the waffles a little cool), as were the potato skins. The chicken was perfectly cooked. The pecan nut tart dessert was nice but a little to pre-made for my liking (e.g. ice cream scope frozen solid in round shape :(
The service was great; attentive and very friendly (but not over the top). Overall a good place for food & drink. I will likely be back.

This is located in a groovy little cafe precinct that you would walk past and completely miss if you weren't looking for it. we were recommended this restaurant by friends a colleagues and it did not disappoint. The meals were authentic New Orleans fare, the beer was cold and the service warm. Oh and there was live music too!

An absolute must-visit in Christchurch. Conveniently situated next to Strange's Lane in the most hip area to come back since the quakes, Orleans flawlessly blends New Orleans soul food with the Kiwi hospitality. If you visit this establishment, bookings are not accepted for groups under 8, so be sure to arrive early. Around 8 pm the place is crawling with hungry (and thirsty) patrons. For imbibing, I recommend the Hurricane pitcher to share or the Dr. Pepper Martini. For food, you'll absolutely kick yourself if you don't order their chicken and waffles with a honey glaze. It's simply perfect, and a moderate portion size so you're not too stuffed to order and additional side or dessert (which must be the cookie sandwich). I love their curly fries, but if you need something healthier, the burnt cauliflower is fantastic (and not burnt, dispite the name). I love the jazz and New Orleans soul music that plays in the background and the decor is spot on to theme. Definitely don't miss this amazing restaurant!

One of the few open options near my hotel - absolutely fantastic food. Deep South, Soul Food, Yum. Fried chicken, pork belly, slaw, ribs, CHICKEN WAFFLES.... Nice interior done up like blues bar. Get in there. Highly recommended.

We go to the Hop every Thursday for Happy Hour. The beer selection is great and always changing and Matt is always around to advise on choices. 

I would give them 5 stars if not for the food which is ok but not inspiring.

We visited The Twisted Hop on the 4th of July. They were promoting a 4th of July celebration event that evening and we decided to check it out. The first small victory was the private parking the back. Though there aren't many spaces, it was nice not to have to fight street parking. We entered through the back patio door which leads onto a covered, cozy patio great for enjoying a beer with a friend on a warm day. The restaurant inside is dark and rustic, but the bar is aglow with the colorful chalkboard promoting the beers on tap that day. We spent some time with the bartender discussing the beers available and he helped us find the perfect fit for our palates (pilsner for me!). We sat at a four top table near the wall of books at the front where you can buy a book for a donation that benefits the Nepal Earthquake Relief Fund. I can get behind that! There is a spot for a stage and a counter full of board games. Awesome. For dinner, we stuck to the American-theme menu and ordered tacos and wings. They were delicious, but the tacos were definitely my favorite. Next time I would like to try something off of their real menu, which looked wholly filing and belly-warming. Do you have a favorite brew? They take special requests and will do their best to stock it for you! Definitely recommend this a top bar to spend the afternoon or the evening imbibing craft brews and devouring delicious snacks.
Excellent atmosphere and welcoming décor, not to mention the beer. Staff are always friendly as well. I haven't eaten here for a fair while so can't review the food just yet.

One of the best brewpubs I have been to in the world. Whatever else we may want to say about the English, they understand the science of crafting a good pub, or at least they used to. Wooden tables and floors with a comfy interior that beckons you to sit, drink, think, and talk in a convivial mode. The twisted hop has all of this as well as great food and beer. 

They brew their own beer, or rather Jim brews it, and they specialize in English style "real ales" although they have other varieties of beer and wine as well. Real ales are ales that are cask conditioned, that is, they continue to ferment in the cask. They are also dispensed with a hand pump instead of a C02 tap. This makes them delicate and amazingly flavourful in a way that typical lagers and "bright" ales are not. The beers at the Twisted Hop are great and you will want to give yourself some time there since you will want to try them all, maybe more than once. 

The food, despite The Twisted Hop's English DNA, is really good as well. They have Scotch eggs (ask, or maybe don't ask, what is in them), excellent chips and fish, and everything else looked good too. If you live in Christchurch, you should be reading this while seated at the Twisted Hop. For those traveling to Christchurch, this should be on your list of stops.

Came in last week hoping to get dinner along with a couple of drinks. We asked for a table for two and were quickly sat at a table near the bar. 
The server was quick to get our drink orders but we were never given menus for food by either the host or server. About 15-20 minutes go by before we were able to get hold of the server that took our drink order and was told they are only serving snacks. 
We were not told this when we asked to be seated and had we known when we got in, we wouldn't have even bothered ordering drinks. The website mentions that the dinner is served from 5 PM to late and we had arrived at around 8:15 PM which is not late at all, since they were open until 12 AM that day. Super disappointed with the service and lack of informing us that they are no longer serving dinner when we asked for a table for two. 
Hands down the most disappointing experience in New Zealand so far especially when the other reviews hyped up the restaurant.
Great dinner! Nice restaurant environment! The food is absolutely amazing. Strongly recommend the seafood the stew and the salmon tartar.

Food had no seasoning and tasted bland. Service was poor - didn't clear any plates, didn't offer any water, didn't ask for second drinks, just dropped the food and ran away. Ambiance was kinda cool, but they had the door wide open and even though the place was empty sat us right next to the open door in the front. Definitely seemed like they didn't want us there. At the end of the night they screwed up our tab and tried to over charge us.
Fantastic service, amazing chicken salad and mock tails, staff very friendly and helpful. Definitely going back.
Nice location near the Avon river and the seafoods is good. Good for group and great view of the bridge of remembrance.

Fantastic breakfast and fantastic service, have visited twice now for different occasions. Cocktail menu is the best in Christchurch
Will come back again an again.

What a fantastic meal! Our server was Hamish and I've seldom had some recommend dishes with such passion and outstanding knowledge of the ingredients to create perfect cocktail pairings!
We ordered the rainmaker and missionary's downfall at our server's recommendation and both drinks were some of the best cocktails I've ever had. Later on, my husband got an Inca Haze. Also an excellent drink!
Moving on to food, we asked out server for recommendations and followed his direction and he did not steer us wrong. The chargrilled jalapeno sausage was flavorful, delicious and had great dipping sauces. I wish it was a bit more jalapeno-y, but I know spicy food scares people here... We moved on to the Pork Belly and Broccolini. Wow. The pork belly had a perfectly crispy layer of skin on top, the inside was tender and not overly fatty (due to the rotisserie cooking process maybe) and served on black bean sauce with pineapple salsa. Fantastic! And who gets excited about broccolini? Anyone who eats the broccolini from here. Delicious! We scrapped every bit of sauce off the plate under the veggies.

To finish we got the Zesti Roasted pineapple. Wonderful taste explosion! Fruity, spicy, creamy,, everything you want in a dessert. I also appreciate how helpful our server Hamish and the other staff were. About 90% through our meal another couple was seated next to me, who I can only describe as a perfume-bomb. The smell was so overwhelming it was almost sending me into an asthma attack and I couldn't breathe. The put our dessert into a to-go container and got our bill and we were able to finish our meal on the patio out front. I hate people who dip-dye their body in perfume and fumigate the rest of us. I appreciate the restaurant's help in allowing me to escape from the cloud of perfume as soon as possible.

Absolutely delicious steak and seafood. We did not have a reservation but the host made room for us at the counter overlooking the kitchen. Our waitress was professional and helpful. Best food in Christchurch!

Delicious food, friendly service, and a pleasing environment. Amazing patio seating is available when the weather is nice. It is also centrally located. All in all, you can't go wrong at Amazonita. Give it a try.

Our second time dining here and it was just as good as the first!
The atmosphere is busy, but not noisy and made it easy to hold a conversation at the table.
The waiting staff are prompt and friendly, can not fault the service :)

What really makes this place stand out for me is their knowledge around food safety for my pregnant wife.  We ordered some french fries as a side plate which on the menu comes with a spicy mayonnaise.  The waitress identified that my wife was pregnant (a brave call but she is obviously pregnant), and informed us that the mayonnaise had raw egg in it and that she can bring a small dish of ketchup if that would be better.  It's the first place that we've been to during the pregnancy where the staff were knowledgeable and informed about the food safety recommendations for women who are pregnant.  Good work Amazonita!! 

Additionally the food is delicious and well priced, and with a wide range of food you are sure to find something that you feel like.

Looking forward to many more trips to this awesome restaurant.

Portershed is my favorite vegan place to eat at in Christchurch.  The owner and staff are wonderful and amazing people!  I always have a blast eating there.  I have not had a bad menu item here. They have a wide range of menu items ranging from various yummy desserts, delicious meals, and drinks.  There are so many options that I have trouble deciding on what I want to eat whenever I go there.  On top of that, they sell other stuff on the side such as hemp protein cookies, snacks, milk, jackfruit and cooking ingredients.  Portershed is life!
Amazing vegan choices, great atmosphere and friendly staff.  A must for those who want unique plant based options without breaking the bank!

What a lovely place to visit and dine! The food is excellent and it's definitely worth going in!

Yes - it's fully vegan, but keep your mind open and enjoy trying something new and rest easy knowing you're doing you're body good!

If you're vegan or vegetarian it's novel and frankly amazing to be able to order anything with no worries. 

The food itself is very nice, truly enjoyed the sausage roll and the others enjoyed a pinwheel and the dumplings. They're a great proxy for the 'original' items too - if you're concerned about that sort of thing!
The chicken and corn dumplings are so so yum! Highly recommend, ordering online service was so handy and they have very helpful staff! Yummiest dumplings i've ever had!! :)

So busy and sooooooo good. Everything was SO flavorful. The Dan Dan noodles were very good, the dumpling sample was fun. I didn't like one of them but most were very good. I loved the pork and rice dish!!!!! Seriously I highly recommend.

Eightgrains served me the best gua bao (called pork belly bao on the menu) I've had since Taiwan! Just the right amount of pickled greens, peanuts, and a dusting of spice - mmmm! If I had more time in the city I'd have picked up a bag of these to have a picnic with (although really you can't let these sit, the bun will get soggy).

I also enjoyed the dumpling sampler platter, although I don't think it came with every flavor of dumpling like the lady behind the counter assured me. I also wished the sauce for the red wine/pulled beef didn't spread out all over the rest of the dumplings, because they had their own flavors that didn't need to be overshadowed. I think my favorite dumplings was the chicken, corn, and coriander - and I loved that they offered both spicy chili oil and regular sesame oil for dipping.

Eightgrains is located in the Little High Eatery, which is a food hall with eight local eateries.  We ordered a fried chicken bao, a fish bao, and two kinds of steamed dumplings.  They all were great.

As I mentioned in my Little High Eatery review, you'll need to grab a table to get seating.  On weekend rainy days that could be an issue because some of the outside seating won't be available.
Good food, friendly service. The food presentation was nice, and the taste was amazing. Lovely place for both lunch & dinner.

So impressed with this place! We are visiting tourists that tried the croissant sandwich and sweet muffin. Both were so unique in their ingredients combination and both were delicious! We got black tea and coffee- both were great. This is a must visit place.

Excellent flat white coffee and delicious breakfast! We stumbled upon this place at night while walking around and made a note to go back the next day. The line was a little long but well worth the wait. We sat outside and enjoyed our morning and even ordered another cup of coffee to go. I would definitely recommend.

This place was so tasty! They made a great flat white coffee, but the avocado toast was amazing! It is a little higher priced, but totally worth it. It was more of an undone type of avocado toast with seasonings, poached eggs, tomatoes, and some sort of tangy butter or aioli, I'm not sure. It was just so pleasing to the eye and tasty! I did have much more avocado left, so I wished it had a bit more bread but it was still a good amount of food. I would recommend, it seemed to be a busy place with a few tables inside and some outside seating. Also a great spot on regent street next to other shops.
Great coffee and food for breakfast. There were 8 of us and the restaurant managed our order well. The outdoor setting is very nice right at the square with the trolley line nearby.

Didn't think I would be writing a raving review about a breakfast place, but this place definitely needs a mention. Just around the corner from the Rendezvous Hotel, I decided to give it a shot over the same tired breakfast buffet at the hotel. 
The flat white coffee was awesome, but guess that was to be expected. What did surprise me though was their Chili Scramble -- scrambled eggs with red chilies, shallots and Parmesan shavings on country sourdough bread. The shallots were crisp, the chillies fiery and the eggs just right.
The hot dark chocolate is a must have for any dark chocolate fans out there. It's an actual 70% dark bar of Peruvian chocolate dipped into the milk, the taste is just surreal !

This is a cute little corner coffee shop that has a variety of yummy breakfast choices from eggs and toasts to breakfast sandwiches and other breakfast goodies for a sweet tooth. Everything looks and tastes fresh! The service was good too. It is a quite small little coffee shop with a few tables inside but they do have outside seating for a nice day.
Very delicious breakfast-smoothie, muffin, eggs on toast, and acai bowl were all  great. The coffee is excellent too.

I can't think of a better coffee joint to inhabit adorable New Regent Street than the Caffeine Laboratory. This is a great, small cafe that specializes in all things coffee, but also pumps out some pretty amazing cafe dishes as well. I'm pointing at you, Bacon and Egg Brioche. I had a hard time choosing what I wanted to pair with my flat white because their menu items sound just as appetizing as their case items look. The menu is small, which helps you make the decision quickly, but I can promise that no matter what you order, you won't be disappointed. Seating is limited so I wouldn't bring a group of friends (5 tables) but it's great for a coffee date or for takeaway.
Greasy charred burgers that fall apart at first bite. Will not return.  The burgers were cold but the fires were hot.

As an American, I believe I'm well qualified to rate a burger because the hamburger is the great American contribution to the culinary world. I'm here to tell you, however, that there's not an American restaurant I've ever eaten at that makes a better burger than Bacon Brothers! Simply brilliant!!!

Best burger we have ever had in our lives! Came here straight from the airport and left very satisfied! Highly recommend, great food and ambiance. Very large craft beer selection too. Five stars for the service- everyone is super friendly and nice!
Great burger and excellent service. New Todd cooked me an excellent vegan burger. The jack fruit is a great substitute for a vegan like myself.

Me, my wife and daughter had just landed after a long trip from the states and were starving.  We jumped on Yelp and Bacon Brothers had good reviews.

The restaurant is inside an upscale, hipster food court with a number of other eclectic places.  The entire place was clean, bright and welcoming.

We had a bacon cheeseburger, vegan burger and and an order of fries.  The burgers were hot and tasty.  The fries were a huge portion and well seasoned.  My only criticism is that they were a bit soggy.  They appeared double fried, but should have been left in a bit longer.

The guy and girl at the counter were both friendly and professional.

Definitely worth it.  Highly recommend.

MY LIFE IS CHANGED AFTER EATING HERE!!! The burgers are so good, I'm wishing we had one of these places in the states. Maybe they do but I just don't know about it. Either way, a trendy and fun place, pretty reasonably priced, only downside is they got my mom's order wrong, but that can be easily remedied. 

I got the Ben from accounting and it had pineapple and the bacon was delicious and I love love LOVE the bun. Also really fun that they put your fries/onion rings on cutting boards. 

Also, in love with the Aoli/bbq sauce combo they give you. 10/10 would recommend!! Come to America if you haven't already bacon brothers!!

***
NB for non-locals: 
This listing seems to have wrong hours - it can be hard to find when the eatery is closed! FYI, the eatery houses many restaurants and this is just one of them. it is located INSIDE the food court. 
***

We're vege. You can swap bacon with coconut bacon on any burger ~ and ~ they have a burger with Mac & cheese crocquette patty. It's amazing.

The service took a long time but the eatery was PACKED and it was NYE so forgiven. 

The chips come with the most amazing sauce. Loved it.
The burgers looked pretty impressive and tasted pretty good - they're just pretty buried in bun and fixings; not much meat!
