Vegan option is excellent. Normal burgers also good. Kinda hard to find. Location is good. Service was fast. Menu far less expensive than it could have been ($12 for a sizeable burger) but beer is a bit overpriced at $7 for a glass of speights.
Hot rod burger was tasty. Good loc surrounded by plenty of food spots in the hipster Little high eatery. Will he back

(This is probably closer to 3.5 stars to me.)  Bacon Bros. is located in the funky Little High Eatery conglomeration of restaurants.  The burgers and fries are very good, and served in large portions.  My family had split perceptions of the unique fried cauliflower side, between being excellent and being good-but-a-little-too-sweet-because-of-the-honey-sauce -- I recommend trying them and deciding for yourself.  The staff is friendly, patient, and efficient.  I'd happily come back again.
So to start with this place is inside "the little high eatery" staff is friendly, food is relatively inexpensive, and quite decent.
Excellent burger in fabulous concept. Ciabatta bun fresh and not overdone. Will be back!

The burgers were ok but a little overrated. I wasn't a big fan of the bun. The fries were pretty good but we're literally SWIMMING in bacon. I normally wouldn't complain but it was a little overwhelming.

This place was a little difficult to find, because it is located inside a building that is shared by a bunch of other restaurants. Once inside you'll find a host of other delicious eateries, much like a hipster gourmet food court. I ordered the Big Jim and it included fried chicken, bacon, avocado, and a yummy aioli (a NZ favorite which is a more delicious version of American ranch dressing). I had to remove the fried chicken because I couldn't bite into the burger due to its size, but it was fantastic! I got the fried cauliflower as a side and it was absolutely delectable. They were drizzled with maple syrup which was a salty/sweet combination that made my taste buds flutter with excitement. The guy at the counter was super cool, and gave my husband a discount for having a rad beard. Also, something I thought was extra special was that anything on the menu can be made vegan! 

Keep in mind that seating is a fight for your life ordeal, so be aggressive and send your friends to find a spot while you're in line to order, otherwise you'll be walking around forever trying to find a spot to sit. Still worth all the trouble, though. All in all, one of the best meals we had in New Zealand, and the best food in Christchurch.
Great burger,  excellent friendly staff. If your family doesn't all want burgers there are other great eateries in this indoor gourmet food court.

Very cool place tucked into a conglomeration of eateries called Little High. We came for breakfast sandwiches and added onion rings (10am, right?). Everything was delicious and the vibe in the place was perfect for a rainy Christchurch day.
This is one of the most popular eateries in the Little High complex so be prepared to wait.  The burger was delicious - good quality meat patty with tasty bacon - and the chips were amazing!!

Exceptionally good and an excellent value!

Bacon Bros Burgers are located INSIDE 'The Little High Eatery' which has multiple fine eating establishments.  It's on High Street, but it's a little hard to find because you're looking for the Bacon Bros sign which is hidden, so look for the 'The Little High Eatery' sign (see the picture I posted...)  The whole eatery is more like OFF an alley off High Street and is easily obscured by some taller buildings.  Doesn't matter, FIND IT, it's worth it.

'The Little High Eatery' has about a dozen really cool, bohemian, artesian places.  Always better to support local than chains, go get out of Bubba Gump or the Olive Garden, and go to Bacon Bros.  Seriously kickin' burger, cooked perfectly, all the ingredients were fresh, the brioche bun soft but slightly chewy at the same time, and some nice slab bacon on top.  Very reasonably priced.  ABSOLUTELY PERFECT!!

If I lived in Wellington I'd be a serious regular and they'd know my name within a couple weeks.  It's a serious burger done right...

Best chicken bacon sandwich of my life. So huge and delicious. I didn't need to eat for 7 hours after! Ha. Coming from the US, people talk about Fergburger in Queenstown being the best burgers in NZ. But having had both, I say Bacon Brothers hands down is better. Just go and eat there. Located in the Little High Eatery. You won't regret it. Pro tip: go before 11am. There's no line.

Delightful customer service, however very disappointed to be informed that of the two vegetarian options, neither could be fulfilled to their full potential. On a positive note, we have discovered a new found love for cauliflower. 5 stars for the cauliflower and customer service. 3 for everything else.
Very friendly staff, great menu with a wide selection of drinks to go with awesome bacon buns.

Friendly staff and delicious food. I ordered the Bernie and it was ready in no time. AMAZING and reasonably priced. I would definitely drop by again. Was tough decision in little high eatery as there were many options but I'm glad I went with this.
Very good service; I wish I would have ordered a spicier dish. It was a busy place but  we received our meals very timely.
Amazing food and service!!! I highly recommend it if you're craving for good Thai food!!

We needed a vegan meal on a Monday night (many restaurants closed!) during Lunar New Year (Chinese restaurants closed!) in Christchurch. Thai Orchid to the rescue! Although not a vegan place by any means, the staff listened very attentively to our dietary restrictions, confirmed clearly that they understood, and then delivered an absolutely delightful meal.

ABSOLUTELY THE BEST THAI FOOD EVER!!! 
Okay...In full transparency, I have never been to Thailand. However, I have had a lot of Thai food all over the United States and nothing has even come close to my experience at Thai Orchid! I normally order either Pad Thai or Geen Curry, but the owner had a few other suggestions. We took his advice. My husband and I split the #9 Goong Tod, # 31 Pad Phed and #41 Ped Thai Orchid. The #31 was so delicious that we decided to go back on Christmas Day! That night I ordered the #31 AGAIN and my husband ordered the Pad Kee Mao (not sure of the number). The food is authentic, fresh and full of flavor!!! I don't think you could go wrong with anything on the menu. Bonus...The service is FABULOUS! The owner is amazing and all of the servers are great!!! I would make a trip to Christchurch next time we are on the South Island just to visit Thai Orchid. I cannot recommend highly enough!!!

What a find! Crispy duck, spring rolls were fantastic. Even though they were not very busy, I would say the service was terrific with very helpful suggestions for our dinner. If we weren't leaving NZ in two days we'd definitely go back...next trip for sure.

Excellent food and I really appreciated the great service too. Very friendly staff, and the manager went out of her way to show us her hiking (tramping) photos since we told her we were going hiking. We had the pad Thai (#44) and #23 curry, which I can't pronounce well. Hoping to visit again.
Amazing steamed salmon special! Super tender and flavorful. The red curry was delicious too. FYI the orchid salad consists of 90% fried chicken and shrimp and only 10% salad.

We came to Christchurch for the post Christmas week and unfortunately most restaurants were closed on Dec 26, Boxing Day. However, this unfortunate event turned out to be a blessing - That Orchid was open tonight and we got really lucky! 
Although the ambience is modest and nothing much to write home about, the service and food is everything one could desire for. 
We ordered Pad Thai; Massaman curry, chicken wings and fried banana with ice cream.  Every dish was fragrant, well cooked and delicious, the surprise was definitely the dessert. Would definitely advice everyone to save room for dessert :)

I was travelling through Christchurch and saw this restaurant had good reviews so we decided to try it. We intended to do take out but the charismatic owner convinced us to dine in. Thankfully we did, the decor was gorgeous, the service was absolutely amazing and we felt very well taken care of. The owner had many suggestions for food, we ended up going with the Fish Cakes, Fried Rice, and Pad Se-Ew. The fish cakes were okay, a little bit on the greasy side but everything else was fantastic! The owner insisted on the fried rice being cooked in a special way using green curry to give it an extra "kick" and it was a great suggestion. The pad se-ew noodles were delicious with a generous portion of tender beef slices. I would highly recommend trying this restaurant and if I'm back in Christchurch I will definitely be coming back here!

For Malaysian I think the food is okay okay
Tom yam soup more like ready-made(diluted)
Food is less spicy

I am on travel from the U.S and I have been here several times now.  The staff are courteous and provide great service.   The food is amazing and I have not had a bad meal here.  Their prices are reasonable as well for the food portions. A plus is that they are vegan/vegetarian friendly!  That is hard to find out here.  I will definitely be coming back more often and recommend for others.
Friendly service. Nice ambience. The food was very tasty! Definitely try this place out.

We happened upon this place just before closing time, but they welcomed us in and never made us feel rushed. The food was wonderful - especially the Gaeng Kari curry and the crispy duck! Really warm, nice people and delicious food - what a great find in Christchurch!

Important - this restaurant has been around for years but this summer it was bought by Jules and Jum. Since then, most of their ratings have been outstanding but they are still averaged in with the poor ratings from the previous owner.  We recently spent 14 days in New Zealand and Fiji and found most of the restaurants we ate at to be unremarkable..until we accidentally found the Thai Orchard.  Jules greeted us at the door as if he knew us and started tutoring us on selecting a Thai beer.  His partner Jum came right to the table to offer her selections on their best dishes. Believe me, she didn't steer us wrong.  It was by far, the best meal we hAd in all of New Zealand. The desserts were out of this world. But what made this place so fantastic was the staff, especially the owners. I noticed a previous comment about the decor...like I said, Jum and Jules are new owners and have great plans for the place. In the next few months they are updating the decor, fixing up the outdoor patio and adding the Crazy Horse Bar upstairs. Give the place a chance, I promise you will love it.  If you are one of those that tried it under the old owner, give Jum and Jules a chance to win you over.

Excellent food and excellent service.  Jummi is the owner and very friendly and welcoming.  We had actually gone to a different Thai restaurant first and we treated so poorly (and their menu was Thai fusion at best) that we left without ordering.  Thai Orchid was wonderful.  Soup, chicken satay and yellow chicken curry were all delicious.

This is a hotspot for the post-work wine drinking crew. When I arrived for dinner, I had to claw my way through the extremely space-limited bar area to get to the dining room. I was disappointed though to see that the wine list is limited and not high quality. The decor and the dining room is very dated and could use some updating, but that has no bearing on the food quality. I had the spring rolls, which were fantastic and fried to perfection. The sweet and sour sauce was no slouch either. I had the Pad Thai for dinner and it is a huge portion! I could not finish the whole plate, but Lord knows I tried. The Pad Thai tastes pretty authentic and has good flavor. i was missing a little "green" though, and would have like some spring onions or something garnished on top. Overall, if you're staying nearby and need a quick, tasty Thai meal, this is a great spot to check out.

Good food, shonky decor! We dined here when extended family came to town. We shared 8 dishes including three different curries, larb, beef and mushroom, and a tofu dish. All were very tasty and at least moderately authentic. I especially enjoyed the red curry. The decor however, left a fair bit to be desired. For one, we found ourselves looking into a laundry area (possibly the owner's home?) whilst dining. Also, the table  was very unstable and on closer inspection was actually a larger piece of wood attached to a small table underneath! Wait-staff were very casual but perfectly friendly and overall it was a nice evening out!

Came here on a whim during my trip to NZ, was blown away by the food. The lamb was amazing, the oysters were also pretty good, and I loved all the desserts. The beef and duck were also good but the lamb was my favorite. Definitely want to return if I ever come back to Christchurch.

Looking for a spot within easy walking distance to our AirBnB in Christchurch, we stumbled upon this small restaurant literally around the corner from us. It was quiet, but there were people there and the staff was super friendly. The menu was interesting - and in an effort to taste as much as we could we decided to share. We weren't disappointed! They poured a nice drink and remained attentive and friendly throughout our meal without being intrusive. Go for the salt and pepper squid, excellently fried and crispy.  Followed that with the mussels, but asked the chef to please do a simple steamed which he did, no problem. I did the garden salad, amazingly fresh, lightly dressed and my partner did the baked market fish - on this evening monkfish - and prawns. Superbly done. We finished up with tea, coffee and the burnt cream - a lemon and almond creme burlee with a peanut butter cookie. Amazing.  Would go back in a blink.

The food was very good.  I had the special fish that was very uniquely prepared.  The menu is non-traditional, so it was a bit hard to make a choice with many unfamiliar items on it.  I got lucky with my choice, but my wife wasn't has excited about hers.  

The ambiance is very nice in an old restored house.  Service was good, as well.
Amazing food.  Mussels are Gold Medal winners for an entree.  The Pork, venison, lamb were unbeatable as mains.  Don't miss it.  Service is fabulous and friendly.  Christchurch lives on!

Was visiting NZ for a few weeks. Had such a terrific meal there I went back before returning home 3 weeks later. We were lucky enough to try their Whitebait special & it was great. Sampled a few different regional beers that were recommended as well. Exceptional service & great food!

Solid all around. While the focus is on the food, the atmosphere doesn't disappoint either. This Christchurch staple serves up two styles with two restaurants in one - Astro Bar is in the back. 

Cook'n with Gas - traditional New Zealand dishes done right. The keystone to the menu is lamb shanks with a mint jelly that will make a impression in the memory. The wine menu and pairings highlight what New Zealand has to offer to the wine world. 

Astro Bar - good for drinks beforehand, after dinner, or a meal if you're not looking for the Cook'n with Gas full experience. As the signs in the bar say, "May the sauce be with you." Don't miss out on the Atomic fries and sauce. 

Asaph Street may be for the up 'n comers and a good place to extend your night, but this is an essential Christchurch stop.

Cook'n with gas has been around a long time and for good reason. Our party of 6 dined here recently and had a fantastic evening. Our table was nearer the back of the restaurant and had a lot of space around it so we didn't feel crammed in and were able to be a little bit noisy. The food was fantastic, all the meat was perfectly cooked and delicious. I had the mussels as a starter and it was a very generous helping and the flavours were spot on. Next I had the mixed grill and wouldn't hesitate to order it again. Chocolate brownie for dessert was rich and decadent and a perfect finish. I tried most of the other dishes on the menu that other people had ordered and couldn't fault them.

What made dining at cook'n' with gas really special was the service. I think it takes a lot to make an impact as a server and NZ has a lot of good but not great service. Our waiter had extensive knowledge of wine and kept us entertained during the evening. Every wine choice he made was superb - it went with our meals and with our individual taste preferences. As a result I now have a few new favourite wines to hunt down!

Very nearly a perfect dinning experience; the staff were certainly aiming for perfection as I arrived here, having the door opened before I got there and for the first half of the meal serving in bulk two wait staff came to tell me  about the specials and drinks list!

I got great advice on trying the best oysters I have had the fortune of trying in all my visits to NZ and it was unusually matched with a dark hoppy ale that was supposing terrific! I asked for some tabasco and got that plus Lemon and Cracked pepper too.

Next came my lamb cutlets which were beautifully prepared and was promised a match unique wine; unfortunately the later never arrived, and since by now the restaurant had started to fill I was unable to flag down anyone to point out this fact till long after the meal was done.

Pressing on I tried the chocolate dessert that despite my fears it would be too sweet I was assured that it was the most elegant to try and it delivered as good as I was promised.

Unfortunately again when it came to getting the bill I had to wait 10 minutes to get someone's attention and again for them to return with my receipts so that I could leave.

Despite these few small missed that seem due to not enough staff or over booking at one time this was a most enjoyable dinning experience.

1. Excellent food choices and a wide variety from vegan, gf, meat, seafood, land-based meats and wide variety of veggies and meal choices.

2. Great service quality.

3. Good bar / wines.


Only negative is that service was linear so those arriving first typically got their meals, deserts based on the queue.

There were opportunities to serve desert to those who had ordered and finished main meals well ahead of other tables who started first but were slower to eat.

This is one hopping place on the weekend evening! 

We arrived without a reservation and they still found us a table straight away. Had there not been room they would have us sit at the bar. Great service throughout the entire experience from start to finish. 

The restaurant itself is small and cozy. 

The menu is the perfect size with plenty of choices yet not overwhelming. We all chose a different dish and each one was spot on delicious! We enjoyed our experience and would love to return for breakfast one day.
This is the perfect place to come for brunch! The food is delicious and the plating is picture perfect.
Nice food and great service .. save room for dessert... so many deli-shish choices to try.

This came highly recommended with good reason. Wonderful service, love all the big Windows and yummy food. We came for a late breakfast during the week so didn't have to wait. The duck hash was delicious, unusual and perfect. Poached eggs, added bacon and avocado which made for a huge plate of fine food.

I made a reservation for my partner and I to come here for my birthday because I've heard great things about the food - especially the desserts. Big mistake. On arrival we waited at the top of the stairs to be directed to a table. The waitstaff stood there and made no effort to greet/communicate with us when we approached them and snapped at us as we went to walk over to a table as we weren't getting directed to go anywhere else. We established that we had a reservation and were then directed to a table. There next to ours was another empty 2 seater table with a view out the window so we decided to move to that. Another member of staff came over and she proceeded to snap at us to move back to our original table. We decided to leave before ordering anything. I have never been treated this rudely by staff. Definitely ruined my birthday. I wouldn't have had a problem if she was polite and friendly but it appears she didnt have an ounce of customer service skills. Wouldn't recommend and wouldn't go back.

Came around breakfast/brunch with my sister. Eggs benedict was good, strawberry pillows to die for. I wanted the lick the plate it was that good. The desserts are definitely a highlight! The portions were surprisingly hefty, so sadly couldn't try more of the desserts. I would have liked to order the entire menu of dessert options if my stomach and wallet allowed it.

Excellent food! 
Highly recommended!
We enjoyed a sensational breakfast at this establishment! 

Awesome egg benedicts!

I feel bad for being the only low star review for Strawberry Fare. My friend and I came here for dinner services. Honestly I think its dinner that was really bad because everyone seems to come here for desserts and brunch. 

This was what we ordered: 
Kikorangi Blue Cheese Plate
Salmon Ceviche
Braised Lamb Pappardelle 
Tropical Coconut Freeze

All the dishes lack in flavor, especially the Pappardelle. Watered down sauce, with no flavors, and the pasta was not good. The lamb was so tough and it shouldn't be because it was braised.  As for the ceviche, they give you a lot but its does not look like the normal ceviche you would get anywhere else, just gross. 

We did like the Tropical Coconut Freeze. It was our only dinner in Christchurch and it was disappointing. Also, service was super slow even when the restaurant was not packed. I just don't understand the high reviews.

Delicious food and delicious coffee. The eggs Benedict was to die for as well as the tomato chutney that came with the eggs and toast. The flat white was my favorite so far in NZ. The service was exceptional and the waitress was willing to give us all sorts of recommendations of places to visit on our trip.
Went there a month ago Most overatted and expensive desserts .Never going back .Rather get a sundae from macdonalds

We started our South Island trip in Christchurch and this was our morning fuel up stop before we headed out, and what a good decision it was to come here. Impeccably decorated, clean, gracious service and delicious food. The upstairs looks out to the street which is lined by weeping willows, and downstairs you have to option to sit in the sunny balcony. Breakfast eggs, waffles, French bread they have it all. Highly highly recommend, this was of the the best places we tried when we were in New Zealand.

Yummy yummy in my admittedly oversized tummy! Strawberry fare is a real treat for me and my hubby but it truely is a worth while experience. The fillet steak is to die for (so tender!) and the mash potatoes are oh so creamy mmmmmmmm  the desserts are my guilty pleasure (besides of course my sex swing collection) the ultimate chocolate dessert is my go to every time I love the moose and the grainy ice cream is just brill. Unbeatable. I must admit the pre-earthquake location was better but they are nevertheless doing well in the new place! 
I will be back (not a dark Vader reference)

We got eggs benedict! By far the best Benedict I have had to this date. Their poached eggs were the best. . We also got the warm raspberry drenched cake which was a bit sweeter than we expected but nevertheless great because of the texture
Loved this place.. amazing waffles and egg benedict. Staff was so good. Reserve this place as it gets busy during weekends.

This place is well known for its delicious desserts and for good reason. 

Bring your appetite, the dishes we had were generous in size. 

Not much more to say than if you're craving for a sweet treat then this place will do the trick.
This place is famous for its desserts. When I'm in trouble with the missus I treat her to some of their desserts and I'm back in the good books !
Easy to find, can park just outside the restaurant, friendly staff but most importantly the food was amazing.  Was there for breakfast and had Eggs Benedict and a Duck Confit Hash.  It was soo good.
Was very disappointed in the mains meal we had, didn't bother to stay for the dessert. We had heard a lot of good reviews but didn't do much for us, sorry Strawberry Fare but we won't be back

Just booked a reservation for our third visit, during our four (split-up) nights in Christchurch.  We're touring the South Island from the USA and have multiple stops here in Christchurch.  The first two experiences were great.  The food superb.  The drinks I ordered however were just ok.  I ordered a Moscow Mule and it tasted good, but wasn't served in a copper mug as it should.  And yes, it matters.  Another night I had a Mojito, which was just so-so.  I wouldn't order it here again.  The food however made up for it...both times.  I had the risotto the first time and the duck the second.  Both were very tasty and cooked to perfection.
Service was better the first time around and just average the second.  I hope it will be better tonight.
With some slight improvements, I would have given it 5 stars.
Wonderful atmosphere and the service was incredible. I had the duck hash and would recommend highly!

We are tourist who came for breakfast and decided to do dinner the next day. Excellent choice on our part. I had the fish and my daughter had the filet, both were excellent! Their sauces are amazing! Not one piece left uneaten. Save room for dessert. Dessert prices are high but the desserts are fabulous.
Thank you for a lovely birthday dinner. What a meal to remember

I didn't think the price point was on the higher side like other review said. I feel like this is the price you will pay if you are going to a nicer restaurant that has quality food. 

We only ordered deserts here but saw someone had proper brunch that looks like they also gave generous proportions. 

I ordered the Chef Trio because I'm a libra that just can't decide on anything . ($21.50) 

Chocolate cake ( rich and moist with slightly melted vanilla ic cream) Cheesecake was super delicious and creme burleeeeeee ( texture was thick and creamy but not too sweet) yummmm!!  10/10

Dad had the Strawberry Pillow - this one was suggested by the waitress stated was the most popular but we all agree this one was the least favorite one from all of us. Its just angel cake splash with some fresh berries (which we appreciated and lots of whipped cream and sauce) Angel cake was decent . 6/10 

Poached Pear and Ginger Pudding - it was also good but nothing wowing! 7.5/10  


Well this also depends on what you like but seems like the locals here usually go for the cheesecake and chocolate cakes. Menu is massive , you can definitely find something you like !


Oh yeah, Parking is a b*tch! Good luck!
I would come back here if I'm in Christchurch to try their breakfast & brunch.

Fantastic food, but do to the proximity to a hotel, had a lot of family traffic on the day I went.

I had the grilled fish of the day and it was really good, everything you want in a main with a mix of complex flavors that blended well together. One bite gives the lemon of the sauce over the fish, the next gives a hint of the balsamic under them. 

Wine selection was limited, but covered all the varietals. 
I definitely recommend.
A little bit on the expensive side, wanted $5+ for sides such as avocado and bacon, but the food was delicious and the staff lovely. I would go back.

An overall solid place for dinner or just for dessert. We sat around 8pm and it seemed like most parties seated came especially for dessert.

Highlights: Each dish was placed beautifully. Get their fish of the day pan fried. They also cook a good steak. They have more desert options than meal options and the creme Brule was AHMAZING. 

Low light:
Pork cassoulet was way too salty but otherwise well flavored.
Lovely atmosphere and great food.  Desserts were amazing and dinner was very good.  Worth the splurge!

Enjoyed great service and superb food here.
Been to breakfast and lunch.
Great steak with true taste of quality.
You have to try Salmon Croissant for breakfast. 
See pics bellow

The classic Christchurch dessert destination. Expect to wait for a table if you don't book, but it's worth it! Staff are friendly and the setting is cosy but comfortable and quiet. Limited parking though.

One of my favorite breakfast/brunch spots in Christchurch. Delicious Eggs Benny, *incredible* French Toast, and very decadent coffee concoctions.

I've been told that it's equally amazing for lunch and dinner, but have not personally tried those meals.

And the desserts are one of the main draws.

We have always talked about coming here for brunch when we pass by. So glad we finally did!! Such a lovely place. You get to sit above street level and get a nice view of Hagley Park. The food we had was amazing and the prices weren't crazy. We both had 2 mimosas, a mocha, a flat white, fritters, and French toast. Everything was made well and tasted excellent. I can't wait to come here for dinner!! Definitely try it out.
This is so Frickin good like omgi can't explain yum oh hell really good stuff no crap at all really good I'm talking no shit it's good

Worse service ever we had a birthday party there only 7 of us, they forgot orders, forgot our table and left us waiting along time for food, so disappointed as I had heard great things. When I expressed my unhappiness it was blown off with just oh sorry bout that, will not spend a single cent there again.

This is absolutely one of my favorite restaurants in Christchurch. It is the perfect spot for all occasions: anniversary, Sunday brunch, casual afternoon catch-up with a friend, drinks and especially dessert! The second story seems to attract a little bit of a nicer-dressed crowd while the lower level seems to be for those who just rolled out of bed or came from a workout. I wouldn't come here in anything less than a nice pair of jeans, at least. Strawberry Fare prides itself on serving local, fresh and organic food whenever possible, so you won't find fresher food anywhere else.

For breakfast I have tried the french toast (which I think is their best breakfast item), the BET (which just seemed plain, though the flavors are nice), the blueberry pancakes which are delicious and looks like the batter is poured over a scoop of large blueberries on the skillet. The Corn and Capsicum Fritters and Salmon Deluxe were huge favorites with my friends.

For lunch I enjoyed the bruschetta and the summer chicken salad. The bruschetta is fresh and the summer salad is refreshing but also has large pieces of asparagus.

For dessert I absolutely recommend the Sunken Chocolate Cake. It is gluten free and vegan, but you would never know. It is also beautifully decorated with thin, frozen honey drizzle. The little girls I was with devoured their ice cream sundaes (but who doesn't love ice cream?) 

The cool thing about Strawberry Fare though is their baking school! You can take classes at the restaurant to learn to bake (almost) as good as their chefs. This is definietly an experience everyone must do! If you haven't been to Strawberry Fare, put it next on your list - you'll be glad you did!

My friend begged me to go with him for years,  I wasn't enthusiastic as this isn't a place I fit in. But the ultimate chocolate dessert is amazing, everything is perfectly placed and has amazing flavor, I would come back just for that.

I think that  the reason SF does well is that it is one of the only places in Chc that specialises in desserts. So when you think 'dessert' you think Strawberry Fare.  Good marketing, but it would be better yet if the desserts were actually better for the price charged. Citrus Dreamy Cheesecake is closer to one of those gelatin cheesecakes that doesn't have much taste,  The Chocolate Drench cake is really a mud cake - wish it had been advertised as such.  If you want a dense slab of chocolate, that's the one for you.  I was hoping for a nice piece of actual cake.

Went for Saturday brunch and got a nice window seat. Decided to order BET - bacon eggs n tomato on kitchen's own seeded bread. Figure if a restaurant can't do basics, it'll fail everywhere else. And it was quite nice. Eggs nicely poached, bacon crispy, tomatoes ok. But the bread is delicious. Pity they only served one piece!!!

Strawberry Fare used to be my favourite restaurant. Now they're back, in a different location and it just feels very different. The vibe and atmosphere is different. The meals are limited and overpriced... the desserts are still very good and I would probably recommend just going for dessert. The lunch/dinner meals are good but the old menu had much more choice and the mains never seem to change. The service is also very slow. Nevertheless, still a great place to go.

Went here on a whim and I was very pleased. I had the beef filet and it was so tender!!!!! My dish also came with truffle mashed potatoes and asparagus (also amazing). For dessert, my boyfriend and I shared the Carmel and hazelnut torte. Wait staff was friendly and I think my only regret that night was that we didn't order more dessert! Lol

This place is popular, and I have heard the desserts are awesome.I went for the bread pudding, which was pretty good, but not worth the $16.50 in my book. Ironically, it may be that creme anglaise, a special ice cream, and the sticky date bread and the caramel sauce is a bit much - and why raw bananas on top of all that? The place was packed though, so maybe other things on the menu are a home-run?

Also, allow time for parking - there are only a handful of spots.
Not like Mexican food in the States but very tasty. Great service. Fun decor. Good tequila selection.
Not authentic and not good. Service was ok. Environment was nice. A lot of traditional Mex decor. I would not recommend or return.
Good margaritas and food. Very friendly owner. Loved all the Mexican pictures. Enjoyed it. Good location.

The margaritas are not to be missed, especially on Tuesday, when you get a free taco. 
The tacos are great also.
We had the appetizer of the jalapeño poppers, oh my goodness, 
were they ever delicious, with the slaw that comes with, I'd get those again.

This place is super sweet and has an awesome vibe to it. We were looking for some good Mexican food and found exactly that! Their chips and guacamole were amazing! 
.... so we got two!! The service was fast and friendly  , they had some really nice people! Not to busy but obviously a well liked place with the locals. Can't wait to come back to Christchurch and this restaurant!

This is a gourmet Mexican "street food" type restaurant that caters to foodies. It isn't like the usual Mexican food that you find in America and it isn't like any authentic Mexican food I've had. A lot of the entrees are meatless and have creative twists. The chicken that they are famous for is very tender and good. The atmosphere and decor in the restaurant is great-- that alone makes it a worthy destination.

Lovely decor in this trendy tapas joint/bar.

We had 2x croquettas, 2x tacos (vege), and the jackfruit quesadilla! 

The jackfruit was good - the tortijja was a little over-done, and better paired with the sauce that came with the croquettas. I don't know what the sauce that came with it was meant to be.

Crocquettes were fantastic, and the tacos great, although were also a little charred. 

Quick n easy going place though. Good pricing, and quite enjoyed their personal touches on the hot sauces.

Went here on a whim while visiting Christchurch for 24 hours or so. They only had one option of salsa with chips, no queso or bean dips. Only had tacos, chimichangas, ceviche, and quesadilla on the menu. The tacos were good & the Margarita was fair but the chimichangas couldn't be eaten because they were so salty. For the quality Id say it was overpriced compared to authentic restaurants in Mexico or even California. Wouldn't try again but was satisfying enough.

As someone who has lived in Texas and California most of his life and eats some kind of Mexican food (traditional, street food, Tex/Cal Mex, etc.) a few times a month, the last thing I wanted to do was eat Mexican food so far away from Mexico. But everything else was closed on New Year's and we ended up here - a real blessing in disguise.

We ordered a steak taco, a fish taco, and guac to start. All were great.

I also wanted to order ceviche, but that was too risky - I didn't want to risk ruining our entire trip on the minute chance of food poisoning - and ended up ordered the torta instead. Bad idea. The bread and pulled pork were mediocre - I've definitely had better.

This place is the real deal.  If I could give them 6 stars, I would.  Will definitely be coming back here anytime I'm in Christchurch. 

TL:DR -- amazing small plate Mexican food, excellent hot sauces, and well crafted drinks 

Food: we split plates of tacos and patatas fritas (amazingly seasoned potato cubes) but the menu of small plates all looked exceptional.  Tacos were all delicious.  

Drinks: don't overthink it, just get a margarita and kick back and relax, the margaritas are exceptional 

Atmosphere: cool funky vibe with interesting Mexican-inspired art but with a modern funky take

If you are visiting Christchurch and happen to be from somewhere that actually has Mexican food, then you should skip this place. They are confusing burnt and bland as Mexican. Expensive, small portions and not worth it. A very disappointing end to what was a nice trip.

Amazing.  Go here. You won't regret it.  Awesome food and margarita selection. 

Sweet as!
Decent food. This is the only place where we found other people. Ask for a mezcal margarita! They don't have it on menu but they will make it for you.

I would give it the lowest stars I could 

First of all they are not at all accommodating with topping we asked for green peppers and beans on our tacos and they said no 

Specially if you are a vegetarian you shouldn't go there 

They have a very limited menu and especially only couple things for Vegetarians 

I wouldn't recommend it at all

Great place , super food , friendly staff , highly recommended !! Enough veg options 
Dessert took a little time to come , but to be fair they were busy !!

The food here was great. The family and I stopped here our first night in Christchurch. It is definitely not traditional Mexican food, I would consider it more gourmet with a twist. I had the crispy calamari, amazing and tasted very fresh. My family also got the caramelized beef special, the chicken enchilada, and some tacos. Everything had good flavor just unlike the Mexican food I'm used to in Texas. The only negatives were that portions were small and the food did take a long time to come out.

This isn't your typical Mexican restaurant! It's gourmet Mexican food served in small portions - so you can order a lot and try a lot, especially if you go family style. 

- Black bean and bacon dip with plantain chips: 3 stars. Good but not exceptional. 
- Fried chicken: 5 stars. Crispy and flavorful. With 2 different but equally delicious creamy dipping sauces. 
- Pork cheek barbacoa soft taco: 5 stars. Flavorful and the pork goes so well with the pineapple elements in this taco!
- Pipian chicken soft taco: 4 stars. Solid. Nice crunch from the sunflower seeds. 

One downside: the first night we came was a Monday around 8:15pm. While waiting to be seated, we were turned away and told that they were closing early because it wasn't busy enough. What?! Disappointing and weird from an American standpoint - maybe this is normal and acceptable in Christchurch though? I don't know.

Mexican fried chicken was delicious! Aqua Frescas too! Mushroom quesadillas we should have passed on. 

Family style seating was fine until a couple decided to share the one bench with my wife and the elderly man needed a lesson on personal space. Maybe he just wanted to rub elbows with her. Lol!

I'm from the US and Mexican food is a staple in my life. We have so many great Mexican restaurants where I'm from and this place tops them all. The food was unique, delicious, fresh and hot. We loved the interior and the service! We ended up buying all five bottles of their homemade hot sauces.
Wow this place. Wow! Woah wow wowowowow. Great food. Wow. Nice people. Just don't go at peak times. Wow.

Went there today with the family. Food was fast out and very tasty! Guacamole was nice, but could do with some more spicing up. Quesadillas for the kids were very nice. For mains, we tried all the different soft shell tacos on offer. All very good, nicely spiced without just being hot. My favorite was the chicken taco. Kids finished with a vanilla ice with cinnamon churros. I was lucky to score some of the delicious fresh warm churros of one of the little people! Our waiter was attentive and friendly. Overall one of the best Mexican dinners I've had in NZ.
Awesome night out great food ,fantastic service and staff. I went with a group of friends cool atmosphere and music we'd Highly recommend it.

So excited to check out this joint as hubby and I hail from a tex-mex state of mind in the states. The decor is spot on and the music sends you straight to Cozumel. We put our name down for a table for 2 (1 hour wait) and headed to the bar area for drinks and snacks. Reservations are only accepted for groups 6 or more, so be prepared to wait for dinner reservations. 

In the bar area, the whole menu is provided for the bar area though only snacks and tacos are available for purchase. Upon seeing that, we canceled our table, ate tacos and salsa and had a caraf of margs. The guac and salsa was solid, but our chips were stale. :-/ Their tacos however, are DELICIOUS! Small portion size but healthy and filling. Definitely reminds me of Southern California's take on Mexican. Order the lamb if it's on special and don't miss out on the chicken! The prices are also extremely affordable which is great. My gripe with the menu is that it is extremely limited. Where are the enchilladas? One third of the page is food, one third advertising and one third drinks. I'd like to see more dinner options available. 

The staff still seems a little overwhelmed (give the people some credit, it's brand new!) but our drink order was forgotten as they have a confusing system of who handles the drink orders. Keeping drink orders to the respective seating area (bar v dining area) will stop that in the future. Also, to pay our tab we had to go to two different people (the front of the house and then back to the bar to get our card). There are still some inefficiencies to work out here. I'm confident they will be soon fixed. I will say though that the staff is eager to please and will do whatever it takes to make sure you leave happy. And we did! Definitely take some time to check this spot out and bring back the CBD!

Go for the creative and tasty food - NOT for the margaritas.

We ordered a non-virgin rosewater margarita.  It came virginal.  When we mentioned it to the waiter, he smelled the carafe and told us it indeed contained tequila.  We complained again when the bill came.  The manager came to talk with us, asking us  if we knew how to make a margarita, telling us that Mexico's margaritas are designed to not have a tequila taste and questioning our experience of what a good margarita tastes like.  After I asked him if he was making us wrong he backed off and took the cost of the margaritas off the bill.  The manager would have been ahead had he just asked us what we needed to make us happy - eliminating the difference between the virgin and non-virgin option would have done it...but his arguing with us has just made us more unhappy.

We've been to Mexico in Wellington and Christchurch.  The food is creative and tasty and we particularly appreciate their attention to providing gluten free options but we'll never order margaritas here.  Their original margarita (ordered in Wellington) wasn't very good and this rosewater variation in Christchurch wasn't good either.  Based on two tries we conclude Mexico doesn't "get" margaritas.
Bun Bo Hue in here is the best I've ever had . The taste is really authentic of south side!!!

This restaurant had some of the best pho that I have ever tasted outside of Vietnam! I ordered the seafood pho which included shrimp, squid, quail eggs, etc. It was very flavorful and came in a large portion size. 
I came to the restaurant with a large group, and it was a very nice setting with turning table so that people could rotate entrees and appetizers around the table. 
This is one of the best Vietnamese restaurants is have been to, I highly recommend!
beef noodle soup is so good, the beef bone and beef ball makes it much more delicous.

Our last meal in Christchurch. After a movie in Riccarton, we decided to check out Hello Vietnam Restaurant for pho. They specialize in Southern Vietnamese (believe they are from Can Tho).

We dropped in on a Wednesday evening (around 8:15pm) and the place was packed. A mix of customers which is a good sign. FYI: it's BYO (for wine only). 

The menu is humongous; appetizers, salad, soup, rice noodle soup, rice vermicelli, fried egg noodle, fried rice noodle, steamed rice, fried rice, meat dishes (chicken/beef/pork/squid/fish/prawn), tofu, vegetable, egg omelet, chef special menu, roast duck and desserts. They even have a couple set menu options. So many things. Only thing I ever look it as the pho/speciality soups!

- Pho dac biet (#23) ($16.00 NZD) - special beef rice noodle soup. Comes with the standard bean sprouts and basil (super fresh!). Broth is flavourful but on the sweeter side (Southern Vietnam influence). A bit too sweet for my liking. Meat was generous and a good variety; beef tendon, beef flank, pork balls, tendon and oxtail. Oxtail was bomb. 
- Bun rieu cau ($13.00 NZD) - spicy crab rice vermicelli soup. Always a must whenever I see this on the menu! This was delicious; fantastic broth with depth and flavour. Good variety of meats including two tender meat balls, pork, a small piece of pork rib and crab. There was also a few tomatoes, tofu puffs (silky smooth) and green onion. I ate every last bit.

Super satisfying last meal. We were stuffed and in food coma heaven. 4.5 stars.

Fantastic meal, lovely new building and a wide choice at reasonable prices.
3 of us had dinner for $70.
Ginger chicken and vegetables was my hit.

Authentic with a capital A. Also reasonably priced. Visiting two good friends who moved hear a few years back, this is their "go to" for Vietnamese. The appetizers and main courses were all delicious and quickly delivered. Note that they may ask you politely to head along if you've long since finished and there are others waiting for your table. It's expected that you share the accommodations! :-)
Fast, friendly service. Lots of seating. The food was delicious and fairly priced. Friends go there often and it is consistently great. Would recommend the Lemongrass & Chilli Tofu

Wow a random and delicious restaurant close to our hotel. Pho was a huge portion and delicious thick meat slices. NZ beef is very different from American beef - it's all free range and grass fed and has a gamier taste that I think is delicious. We also got the bok choy and salt and pepper fried squid. The salt and pepper fried squid was the BEST I've had in years and years. Wow! Flavorful and tender and moist while still crispy!

I didn't expect it to be in a little shopping mall in "Chinatown".  The fish and chips were amazing and so are the price.  Under $5.00, for a large portion of fish.  I ended up ordering an extra piece of fish.
Best fish and chips. The fish is fresh and crispy. Cheap! Under 5NZ. One piece is so big!

Little fish and chip shop with fresh fish selection that has been part of the local community as long as I can remember. Really great fish and chips with options of multiple fish either battered or crumbed to takeaway. Always deep fried to perfection. Friendly service. Highly recommend. 

PS they don't take credit cards and I am pretty sure they only take cash though I could be wrong...
Extremely friendly staff and yummy food! Tons of options, including vegetarian. Make sure to specify if you want spicy ;) Cost effective, average bowl is $9.

Tried takeaways here(as we've had reasonable sit downs) but this was unacceptably awful.
Both entrees deep fried from frozen with the sick taste that causes.
Fried rice with slabs of gristly and fatty meat and a steak dish with the same low quality ingredients.
It is possible, I suppose,  that the kitchen had only just opened but this food was unacceptable and we threw the whole lot out when we got home.

North and south gourmet is a great place for dim sum/ morning tea. It is great to come here with a group and order a variety of different dishes. As an American who likes to venture out of my comfort zone and try different foods, I loved bringing a group of friends and ordering dumplings, spring rolls, meat balls, pork ribs, bao, and even tripe. The spinning table is a great feature for sharing among friends, and the food is reasonably priced and delicious.
Ordered their mixed pork (BBQ and roasted) rice and Xiao Long Bao. Mixed pork rice is great with generous portion of pork. Xiao Long Bao has room for improvement.

After having local food for 10 days. We are craving for Chinese food. We manage to try this restaurant visited by many Chinese living in Christchurch.  It is Hongkong style food. 
Pickled duck wings.
Steam blue cod fish. 
Ginger and spring onion Venison hot plate. 
Crispy skin Peking duck. 
Steamed oyster with vermicelli.  
All cooked to perfection and taste like food eaten in Hongkong.
.
Food : 5/5
Service : 4/5
Price : $$$
Place : 3/5
.
Halal
Rest : North & South Gourmet
Location : Christchurch
City : New Zealand
.

Dishes are fast & fresh however not a huge selection of dishes if taking the Yum Cha option on the weekend. Bookings advised as they get incredibly busy but they do have a takeaway option available. A typical Sunday lunch for 2 would be $35-$45. Friendly obliging staff & overall a good consistent place for a casual lunch.

I'm not completely convinced on this restaurant.  It's OK... Their Dim Sum (Yum Cha) is good... Better than their dinner menu.  We have been here several times over the past few years, and, I feel like it used to be better.  

On our most recent visit for dinner their seasoning was rather bland.  So, minus 2 stars for that.

This very busy restaurant is the Best yum cha in Christchurch.
Best to book early as they fill up quickly. Fantastic price for what you get and there are enough choices to suit all.

As far as Chinese restaurants in Christchurch go this one is certainly up there.  We regularly go there for Yum Cha on a weekend and know that you have to book well in advance to get a table.  The Yum Cha selection is extensive and generous with trolleys frequently coming out.  Evening meals are also pretty good especially the roast duck and the pork with ginger and spring onion.  We always start with hot and sour soup which is done really well here.  The popularity the place is testimony to many happy customers returning again and again!
Seriously the best sized and cooked fish in Christchurch. Perfectly cooked every time. It's worth the 15 minute walk.
Delicious, fresh, affordable fast food! Ordered the way you want, with good service.

After searching throughout the town of Christchurch for a bite to eat on Christmas Day, we finally stumbled upon Chillikiwi ('Thai in Da Box') on our way back to our hotel. I'm giving this restaurants 5 stars not only for the quality of the food for its pricepoint, but also for the effort put in by the management for opening on Christmas Day (which I think is really a truly needed public service).
We ordered the pad thai with prawns, as well as a fried rice with chicken. The pad thai tasted authentic with very fresh (and plentiful!) prawns; not spicy, but I was able to add siracha to my liking. The fried rice was good, with some vegetables thrown in as well. I personally liked the pad thai more, of the two.
The service was also very attentive. Really appreciate the staff opening shop on Christmas Day! Finally, the price was on point - the best value for our NZD on this trip so far. The three of us only spent 30NZD on our meal.

We had the 5-course degustation menu, which they happily modified for a vegetarian. Every dish was phenomenal, perhaps the best I've had in Christchurch. The Jerusalem artichoke soup was particularly good.

PHENOMENAL first meal in New Zealand. We had the 7-course degustation menu with wine pairings and every single dish was fantastic! Highlights include a perfect scallop, melt-in-your mouth salmon, amazing beef course, and the most wonderful apple dessert. 

I will highly recommend this restaurant to any of my friends who come to Christchurch.
Nothing to complain a bit here! Incredible food and service, couldn't ask for anything more.  I highly suggest the tasting course with win pairing and prepared to be stuffed when you leave.

Hands down the best meal I've had in New Zealand and one of the best meals I've had ever. I cannot believe this gem was hiding from me! I wanted to take my boyfriend out for a nice meal for his birthday (since he's quite a foodie) and was referred by the chef's cousin.

We opted for the fine dining and had the 6 course meal that the chef picked, as we didn't know what to choose haha! Each course was so delicious: melt-in-your-mouth truffle pasta, delicious fish with herbs, perfectly cooked beef, creamy chicken and Waldorf salad, a tangy and sweet rhubarb sorbet, and a lovely chocolate fondant for the birthday boy. Mmmm so yum!! They cater to your choices so don't feel like you have to get something you don't like. I'm not a big oyster fan and they were accommodating to not give us that in the meal.

They take you to the back room in a beautiful dining section. The staff are so attentive and helpful. We aren't super fancy people and I felt like we fit in just fine. Obviously we dressed up and had a few wines. The meal is expensive, but you get what you pay for. 

All in all, amazing food, great ambiance, and helpful staff. What more can you ask for?

WOW! ! The food was spectacular. Every dish that was served was so refined and the flavors just complimented each other so well. Every bite left you wanting more and more. The staff were so attentive as well seeing to our every need. Pricey but you get what you pay for.  A fine dining experience to say the least. Don't go for a quick meal make a night of it.

this jawn was fye (aka this place is awesome)

pardoning my gen z lingo: the barbacoa quesadilla, barbacoa taco and the lamb taco were absolutely delicious, but my soft shell crab taco stole the show!! ('twas munched down before a photo could be taken rip)

good service and kind waitress who was obviously happy to be here!

ambiance is medium volume and comfy benches with large tables, community feeling and very upbeat and authentic

overall this restaurant gets cinco stars!! :) definitely come here if you have a chance! we needed some Mexican food while in Christchurch and Mexicanos did NOT disappoint!!!

Stopped in here for dinner and the food was delicious. Being from SoCal I was surprised that none of the entrees include rice and beans, and it's not even an option to add and make a combo. I enjoyed my meal but it did feel like something was missing as a result. Mentioned it to the server and he'd never heard of rice and beans being standard fare in a Mexican restaurant.
Very busy, great atmosphere. Staff were great. The nacho dish was excellent but the tacos which i had, whilst had great flavours, was very sparing in actual substance. Basically poor value.

Great choice if you're in the mood for Mexican food. We took our kids here since we're traveling from out of town. We were the only ones with children at 7pm for dinner. They did have a kid's menu that included a drink and popcorn sundae. Kids loved it. Tacos were yummy. The pork and prawns had good flavors. The flank steak and chicken needed a little more spices. Maybe a cilantro jalapeño mayo for the beef tacos? All in all a delicious place to eat!

Wow! We had no idea what to expect with Mexican food in NZ. Saw there were good reviews, and checked it out. Authentic for sure. We both got drinks at the bar while waiting for our table. The grapefruit margarita and I forget the one my husband got, but it has basil, pineapple, and jalapenos. Spicy and delicious. 

We ordered the corn fritters, nachos, tacos (fish, steak, and shrimp), and sticky date pudding. Everything was tasty. Tacos seemed a bit overpriced for the portion (comparing it to really good places back home), but had interesting flavors. Our favorite was the steak taco as the meat was perfectly tender and came with this tomato olive tapenade? Delish!

We had just arrived in Christchurch and were starving after a long day of travel. Mexicano's seemed like a good option, and boy, did they deliver on delicious food. We started out with chips and salsa. The salsa was fresh, like it had just been made, and the chips were just the right texture to complement the salsa. My husband and I ordered some tacos. I had a grilled shrimp as well as a a portobello mushroom one. Both were perfect, and packed full of flavor. To top off the meal, we had a Sticky Pudding Cake that was served with a scoop of ice cream. It was wonderful- overall, our experience here was all around spectacular! I feel so fortunate to have had such a great meal straight off the plane after a long travel. I would highly recommend this place and if I lived locally, I would definitely eat here often. Great job Mexicano's!!!

went yesterday and had the original fried chicken and chicken quesadilla. The ambience and decor is great. Food was tasty too. Unfortunately, the menu food options are limited and the price for the amount of food given is sort of steep. I guess this is more of your casual drink spot for bringing a date with some delicious bites to eat on the side.

Had a craving for Mexican food while traveling on our honeymoon and Mexicano's hit the spot! Loved the shaken pomegranate margarita that had a chili salt rim. The chicken nachos were delicious - would definitely recommend. Steak taco with olive salsa was a little odd but still tasty. Overall good food, drinks and atmosphere! Also, they take reservations.

Wow - tacos (chicken and pulled pork) were delicious! Would definitely recommend. Braised beef quesadilla as full of flavor, and also highly recommended. Ambiance was very pleasant; filled up fast for dinner and constant on a Monday night. Service was positive!

Delicious food, with each dish having its own distinct flavour. Busy, and we had to wait 30min past our reservation of 9:15.. Maitre De friendly but inefficient. Had to remind him that we were still waiting, and then got immediately seated. But the food is so good, its worth the wait.

A short walk from my hotel, this place was just what everyone said it would be - hip, delicious, friendly, and affordable. An interesting menu, with Mexican staples and unique offerings makes this a place that tempts even a short-term visitor to CHC to come back.

Once we found this hidden gem, everything was fine. Anna greeted us and although they had bookings, wedged us in.  Started with frozen margaritas which were perfect.  Very tart and with a flavorful tequila, of which they offer many.  

Smallish menu with starters and small plates, taco's and a few entries. Was sampled several taco's and each was unique and flavorful.  Will return when we get back to Christchurch.

I was looking for some comfort food and tacos is always my go to. So when looking up places to eat this one caught my eye. My friend and I waked in and the place has a great atmosphere about it. The Art Deco and music were wonderful. We sat at one of the high tops and the waitress brought us waters. Gave us a few great recommendations. Then gave us time to decide. We both went with a taco and appetizer. She then came back and asked if we were thinking about any cocktails. I asked what was on draft and they only had 2. Normally Mexican restaurants don't have very many so it was cool. She told us about both and I asked to taste one and she brought both drafts for tasting. It was very thoughtful cause I actually went with the one I didn't ask for. Once we got our food we started eating. And I'm telling you, the grilled chicken taco with mashed Avocado and pickled mango is one of the best tacos I've ever had. And I've had a lot of tacos. 

I fully recommend this place to anyone who loves Mexican food. I'm hoping to get there again before I leave New Zealand. It's only been 2 days. But maybe I'll get there today for lunch. 

Try them! You won't regret it at all!!

We have been in New Zealand for a week (having a wonderful time thanks to all the great people here) but being from Texas we need a Mexican food fix on a regular basis. On a whim we searched Yelp and we're pleasantly surprised to find this place listed. After seeing the rating it was a no brainer. We started with the standard Margarita and although it was different from our normal it was very tasty (shaken not frozen). We wanted to taste a variety but we were late and their menu was limited for the evening crowd which made the difference between five stars and the four we gave them. Some of the photos posted made up our minds as to what we wanted but couldn't get it when we arrived around 7 pm.  We ended up ordering the potatoes skins, fish taco, pulled pork and a chicken taco and if you like corn on the cob you gotta try theirs.  Roasted corn on the cob covered in white cheese, may be parmessan, and some yummy spices. All the food was five stars and the service was great. They even have a great salsa that we see in Houston. Not our first choice but the fact that they had an authentic salsa sauce made in Mexico was a real sign of their authentic intentions and we salute them for that and their very tasty cuisine. Got our Mexican fix in Christchurch, New Zealand...who'd have guessed
Had a fish taco, pulled pork taco, and house margarita. The fish taco was amazing! So good I ordered another one. Ambiance is cool and fun-they have moustaches and sombreros for sale at the bar:)
Fantastic food. Great service. Really cool decorations. Nice to have a solid Mexican meal on the other side of the planet.
Fab tacos and margarita's!  fun atmosphere!

Decidedly average food, nothing Mexican about it.... Tacos with gross Eta mayonaise and skinless bbq sauce tasting "adobo" chicken? But quite pleasant service and a tasty ceviche, although it was actually not ceviche but poisson cru - hence two stars apart from the defensive and annoying duty manager. Try somewhere else.

Can't to this place because another place I went to wasn't serving full menu so they suggested I come here. However this place wasn't serving full menu when I got here either! But I was so hungry I ate here anyways. 
The decorations were awesome. Very cozy and fun looking restaurant.,love the nail light fixtures. Very cool ambiance!

So limited menu since it was before 5. 

I ordered pulled pork and beef tacos. Both were very tasty on flour tortilla. I also got guacamole ...home made and very good with salsa that was basically just fresh tomatoes with spices but still very good. 

My favorite part of the meal was the dessert! The caramel popcorn sundae! So freakin finger lickin good! Also had cotton candy on top! I highly recommend getting this. 

Also the cocktail list was very good. I got two different drinks and they were both very good. 

Only downside: there are no rice and beans. Being from Texas I'm like what kind of Mexican place has no rice!? Also hard to get any queso solo. Have to get it with other food. 

Overall great experience. Service was also good.

Had dinner here for our first night in Christchurch. Friendly service, nice atmosphere, and the food was tasty. Luckily my friend and I were a bit earlier and was able to be sat before the dinner crowd. 

I had the beans as a side, along with the mushroom taco, the titty twister draft, and split the popcorn sundae. 

Only suggestion is to add a stout draft to the menu :)

Short answer-it's okay. Long answer. 
Potato skins with queso fundito were bland. Fried chicken and braised pork quesadillas were good but not great. Had a bit of an odd experience I think. First wait staff we encountered asked if we had a booking and when we said no (in an empty restaurant at 5pm) she looked concerned and said she'd have to direct is to the manager. He seemed as if it was no problem and told her we could use table 14 until 645. She then relayed that to us and asked if we would like her to go over the menu. We said sure and she basically read the whole thing. I think she was just a bit awkward, other staff seemed to interact with customers in a typical way. Not a big deal, just tainted our meal. My dad tried to mention it to the manager while paying but he was distracted and didn't hear.

Mexicanos ,
The place is very cool.love the decorations.now the food,it is not an authentic Mexican food it's all a little bland for my taste, but the quality of the produce is very good.what I really enjoyed are the Margaritas .I have been a fan of Mexican food since I remember,at home we eat Mexican food twice a week.I have also lived there for a while.so my advice is ...........Go there have a few drinks at the bar and get a feel your self.

Not too bad, chips need a little work, salsa needs some jalapeño added! When your from Texas you like it hot, hot, hot!!! I had veggie quesadillas excellent... Asked for sour cream... They do not have!!! My husband had the lamb chops special he said it was edible just needed some spice!!! It was a good place to get a chip salsa fix when your missing the real thing!!! $77 for two includes two drinks!!!

Went here while hanging out in the NZ waiting for the weather to be good enough to get to Antarctica.  
The Margs were small, but super yummy.
We were choosing from the lunch menu and I had the fish tacos.  There were really good.  I forgot to ask for corn tortillas, but the flour ones were yummy.
I also got the guac and salsa app.  Fresh and tasty for sure.
The service was great and the place isn't really the Mexican that I am used to in the states... but I wanted Margaritas and the ones they had were spot on...  If you get them frozen... I tried the on the rocks one of a friends and it was odd. That's all I am saying about that.
We visited once only, service was average and food was poor. We aren't great cooks but we can make better Mexican at home with a kit from countdown. They also ran out of beer . I wouldn't go back

Easily some of the best food in Christchurch. From what I can tell, it's authentic Mexican with a few twists. The tacos have soft shells, but have fruit in them (chicken & mango, pork & pineapple) which adds a really nice touch. The meat is juicy and delicious. 

I also tried the corn chips with salsa. The chips were plain with some salt on them, which lets you taste the nice corn flavour without any distraction like you would get with Doritos (not that I don't like Doritos). The salsa seemed like authentic pico de gallo, a fresh chunky salsa with citrus and coriander. I don't normally like fresh tomato or coriander, but I could eat this stuff for days.

I also got a beef quesadilla, which was nice and cheesy. Not sure how else to describe it, but it was good.

As for prices, you get pretty good value for money. The tacos are small, but I think they were around $7, which is not bad considering you would pay at least $5 at a food truck for something nowhere near as good. I can't remember how much everything else was, but if you get a couple of tacos and couple of other things to share, then you get a good meal for just over $20.

This place rocks. Definitely recommend making a booking, especially on a weekend. There are two seating areas: the bar (first come first serve) and the dining area. The dining area is mostly tall top tables with some lower tables around the edges. I recommend the dining room as the service is much more attentive and efficient. Be sure to ask for sombreros to wear with dinner (no charge) or mustaches to take home ($2). 

The dining menu is more of a shared plate style atmosphere. For 5 people we ordered double tortillas (2/pp), chicken, beef cheek, side coleslaw and seasonal veggies and were satisfied (granted we all had had snacks before we came). We also ordered 2 margaritas (the ginger: FANTASTIC and the Locos y Explosivo: delicious but VERY caliente!). Definitely an interesting dining experience as the theme seems to focus on Dios de las Muertas (Day of the Dead) and their food is very traditional Mexican. They also serve tacos, guacamole and salsas and other options if you're not comfortable with the shared plates concept. Definitely recommend checking this place out if you're craving Mexican!

MINDBLOWING!!! Stumbled here for dinner - the tacos are to die for! 
Should the restaurant be full, you can simply go to the resto/bar next door (sorry forgot the name) where you can enjoy all tacos next to a fire pit. 

Probably the best meal I had in New Zealand.

Enjoy!!!

To be really honest I was pretty underwhelmed by the food and the way it was delivered. The potatoe skins were terrible and my main was ordinary. 
The place is really busy and I'm really surprised.  While I would go back and try something else I'd  much prefer to try other restaurants or go somewhere where I know I'll get the food I'm paying for. 

I don't like being so negative but I'm really annoyed by the potatoe skins that they include on the menu but have no idea how to prepare or that they took absolutely no care.

Great little Mexican place we stumbled upon during our time in Christchurch. We were there early (6ish) but it was already pumping.  Started off with the guac, salsa & chips which was really good, and then the fire roasted corn with chipotle mayo & queso which was amazing! I then had 2 mushroom & black bean soft tacos which were great... But then came dessert. OMG popcorn sundae! Just amazing!

Mexicano's is always busy so it pays to make a reservation well in advance. Just be careful as they do have dining windows and you may be evicted from your seat before  you are ready as they will have the table booked for someone else. I don't mind this, as long as you are warned when you make your reservation. In my most recent experience (staff xmas party) we were made to give up our seats before dessert, while people were still contemplating ordering more main dishes, which left a sour taste in everyones mouth. 

The food is pretty good but does come in small sizes. You will often need at least two dishes to actually start to feel full. The guac is ok, and I really like the crispy potato skins. The larger dishes are all pretty good with strong flavours. I always try and get a taco (favourite so far is the pulled pork), and a larger dish such as the ceviche or the chicken/chorizo sticks. The braised beef and pork hock are pretty good as well. And of course, some fried chicken for the table. No dish really stands out as a absolute must have, and none are particularly bad either.

Mexicanos is noisy, and dark. The atmosphere is very cool but its not a place for quiet conversations. The drinks list is pretty limited if you are after wine but has a good selection of margarita's and sangria.

From what I can tell, Victoria St is where it's at these days. There's a ton of restaurants like Mexicanos and the street is buzzing with people. 

We went to Mexicanos at about 9:30pm on a Saturday and struggled to get a table. Initially we sat outside but were soon told that they stopped serving alcohol outside at 10pm. Inside we went.

The food reminds me a bit of the Mexico chain but perhaps a bit more 'traditional.' We had the usual guac followed by an array of soft shell tacos ($8). Unlike Mexico , the filling were generous and the meat well-cooked. They could of done with more fresh herbs but that was only a slight niggle. 

If your looking for a causal cheap and cheerful restaurant with a ton of atmos Mexicanos is worth a looksie.
Best Mexican in town. Have recently travelled to Mexico and had authentic tacos. This place brings Mexico to Christchurch. Authentic flavour and fab paradise slushy. Love it!

The only blemish in our amazing Chch trip was coming here. Advertised was buy 1 dessert, get 1 free however upon reviewing my receipt when I got home I noticed I had been charged full price for the desserts. When I emailed them they admitted their mistake and said they would refund me the next day. After leaving it a week I followed up with an email which I got no response from. I am still waiting for my refund nearly 2 weeks later which is disappointing. Happy to change this review if I receive my refund.

EDIT: Shortly after posting this review I finally received my refund. A shame I had to write a review outlining my experience to get a refund.

This pub and eatery is located at the Northwood Shopping Centre. It's easy to find, on Main North Road. There's tables for those who come for a drink, with nice areas for others who choose to dine also. It's good for groups of friends and families too. The service is lovely and atmosphere is relaxed. I haven't eaten here yet, only come for drinks, but it's an enjoyable place. The music isn't too loud for talking. There is plenty of parking as part of the shopping complex.

Enjoyed the atmosphere. I loved my twice cooked port and th'boys kids menu was good. He struggled to choose - and loved his  cheeseburger. It did look good. What really impressed me though was that K's steak was tough. She couldn't cut it - really! The reaction from wait staff was excellent. Meal was replaced - K switched to cod. Staff reacted with sympathy and concern. 

Look - everywhere can have a bad steak. The way the place reacts is the telling point as to their service. I can't recommend these guys highly enough. The cod btw was superb! Well done guys :-)

A local favourite!

Great beer selection and a fantastic place to catch up with family and friends for a drink. There's an outdoor seating area which catches some awesome afternoon sun, perfect for your beer!!

We've also dined here for brunch, lunch and dinner several times! If you're with a group, there's a great private dining area off the side - so quiet, you'd think you're at home. The menu is great, and as the name suggests, there are a large number of stone plate dishes that come out sizzling hot!

One of our favourites is the sharing platter. Great value for 2 people, and less than two mains. We struggle to eat it all. Pretty much an entree, main and dessert all on one board!

They have regular specials on different nights. Quiz nights and other entertainment available too (but we try to avoid that!). 

Be sure to book, because Styx and Stone gets pretty busy!

We arrived a little after 6:00 on a Friday and didn't have to wait, but it was jam packed half an hour later. We just told them3 people and sat down and they brought us food. Salad, rice with chicken & lamb kebab and butter chicken (drumsticks) all incredibly delicious. Mostly Afghan clientele but everyone was warm and friendly, chef called all the men "brother." Served ourselves water and bussed our own table and we happily anticipate our returning here.

Wow what a great restaurant.   I called them to ask if they had Afghan specialties such as Aushak or Mantu.   Someone answered the phone, I asked my question and he answered me in a heavily thick Afghan accent yes we are open and hung up.   I found that funny.   
My hotel check in clerk recommended this restaurant to me and said it was delicious.   
I got to the restaurant and it was jammed packed.   I was looking at the menu on the wall and someone waiting for carry out said to me "you have to ask the cook what he has tonight".    The menu is never updated.  There is only the cook and a cashier/assistant working in the restaurant.  So I approached the cook who was working furiously in an open kitchen in the same area as the dine in tables, carry out waiting area and cashier.   
There were about 20 people sitting at communal tables and when a dish was ready for the seated guests the cook would just hand the dish to the nearest customer waiting for carry out or to pay at the cash register and asked them to take to "that table".
He was working furiously and had not yet noticed me standing in front of him.  He was doing about six carry out containers at once with rice, one chicken kebab and one ground meat kebab with a side of salad.    He looked up and started giving people their carry out orders and each was 20 NZ dollars or about 14.50 US (per person).  All the time smiling and greeting everyone with hellos and goodbyes unless you were Muslim then it was assalamualaikum (peace be unto you).  
I told him I will have that same dish and he assembled it on the spot and added another container and said this is free.  I was hoping that was Afghan bread.   I paid my 20 dollars and left.  
The food was some of the best Afghan food I have ever had.   I lived in Afghanistan for awhile and have eaten Afghan food in many other countries. 
The ground meat kebab was lamb, it was moist and had all the right spices, superb!  The chicken kebab was marinated in a red yogurt spice which resembled red Tika but tasted better.    The rice was divine and the extra container was a butter style curry chicken with two chicken legs that was spicy hot.    It was the best butter chicken I have ever had.   I had no room for the salad so it went uneaten.  If I go back to NZ I will make a side trip just to eat here. All portions were huge.
Delicious food (small plates / sharing style) with unique flavors, great drinks and friendly staff - what else can you ask for!

Four out of four stars because we were there for an early meal and did not experience the more late live music etc. Another time. We are a family of four with the oldies keen on jazz and blues, so a winner withe the set up and piped music. It feels like a place that goes off later in the evening, but cannot comment on that yet.
The staff are friendly, efficient and not intrusive, just right for our needs.
The drinks menu is extensive with us two oldies just having beers, but our son had a Roger Rabbit? cocktail which he really enjoyed with his sweet tooth. But the range is extensive and only limited by your imagination and liver.
The food is based on southern USA and can be summed up as delicious sticky goodness. We shared some pretzel bread with a chilli molasses butter, which sounds interesting, but tastes divine and some Cajun fries which cater for the more timid Kiwi palate. Missy had chicken sliders which literally disappeared within minutes as we shared some Bourbon and coke ribs, gooey and tasty. We also tried the chicken tenders with a maple and black pepper sauce as well as the sirloin with loaded tater tots, both of which were delicious.
We have big appetites and we were unable to consider pudding.
Great place, great food and I want to go back without the kids for a later night.
