Came here for drinks and tapas.  I had a whiskey sour and my husband had another whiskey-based cocktail.  We had the macaroni and cheese, olives, and sliders.  All of it was pretty good, but the prices felt a little high for what we got.

We went for a Wednesday night to have some fun after dinner. It was an open mic night and the music was super enjoyable but we sat on the edge of the bar where there are several pointless wax candles burning. Midway through the night, a wax edge broke and it began pouring down on us, scalding hot to skin and staining to clothes! I ran to the bar to ask for help extinguishing the high candles and was actually laughed at by the bar tender. We were dealing with scalding wax burning us and the staff did nothing but laugh. It instantly went from having a wonderful night, to one of the worst nights out we'd ever experienced. I work in the industry, which makes dealing with such lack of common decency from others within the same industry even more deplorable. As an establishment, the candles should be removed for health and safety standards, as a staff, the male bar tender on Wednesday January 24th, 2018 should either be fired or taught how to treat other human beings with at least some sense of decency before being allowed to work in the customer service industry.

Honestly we didn't have many options. We had 3 other options and the main reason we ended up here was because the prices per meal were a bit lower. We didn't learn until we sat down and read the menu that the prices were only lower because this was a 'tapas' style restaurant. Whoops. So we ended up spending a lot of money on a little bit of food. But since the food was good I left it a good rating.

The drinks looked amazing but we were hungry and tired and not in the mood to add a hangover to our morning. Apparently it is all about their alcoholic milkshakes but the sugar would have kept me up all night and it was a freezing cold night and we didn't have a car and the hotel was a far walk from town.

We ended up sharing the deviled eggs app, the Venison balls, and the sliders. We ordered 2 beef sliders and one chicken slider and both were good. The beef was better so just order 3 of those. 

Afterwards we weren't full but also weren't still hungry. Probably would go to the other restaurants next time.
Nice bar, good drafts. Super friendly service. I like the decor as well. The selection of beer is pretty vast. 7+ on tap
Cool little bar with tapas style eats.  The night we were there, they had a great musician there. Worth a stop.

Came here with 5 of my buddies and right away loved the ambiance. Great vibes, with a great DJ. We ordered ton of pizzas to the table as well as our own dishes, we were stuffed to the brim, great food. Drink selection was great, and the check ended up being less than what we all had in mind.

Love this bar! Great whiskey choices, live music, pool table, and the BEST bartender ever Marco! He takes his mixology very seriously, but is so sweet and makes sure ppl get served in the queue in order. Wish I could say the same for the other bartenders. They seriously don't pay attention to anything and the really skinny blonde one had a huge attitude when she forgot to put a chips order in. Like who on this planet sits and argues with a customer when you're in a customer service industry, have a receipt, etc. Kiwi's for ya-just can't ever admit they're wrong. Anyway I'll be here again and just make sure to be on Marcos side of the bar.

Best bartenders in town!  These guys take their craft seriously and it shows!  Fabulous food to go along with the wonderful drinks.  Largest selection of whiskey I have seen in town.  I just wish I could transport this bar back to Texas with me when I leave.

Best food and cocktails in town with a great ambiance, music, etc. We were lucky enough to have the regular music line up followed by a great live band. Try the fried chicken and sweet potato salad, best this side is the southern US. Adorable bartender who knows his craft with delightful cocktails such as "Atticus Finch" and the "Scarlett O'Hara". We tried everything on the menu and were not disappointed. Even a pool table for those interested. Cheers to Boo Radley's for their clever name and charm!

This is a great pub in Ferrymead that's well worth the drive from Merivale for quiz night on Wednesdays. (You definitely need to make a booking if you want to play.) The bar is right off the water and the outdoor patio seating receives a nice cool, salty breeze. There is plenty of seating inside from tall top tables to more intimate seating and group tables. There are plenty of TVs to catch a game or catch the clues for quiz night. 

The menu is limited but good quality. The chicken sandwich is hearty and topped with an aioli dressing and bacon. The side of chips are thick-cut and soft on the inside. You can order aioli or ketchup on the side. I have seen a fish and potatoes ordered, the fish are smothered in a sauce and, as a non-pescatarian, I find it sloppy and unappetizing. The onion rings as an entree would be a good choice as they are crispy on the outside and slimy onion on the inside..just the way any good onion rings should be. I recently tried the three ice cream and warm chocolate chip cookie which was heavenly. The cookie is thick and crumbly and the ice creams were stellar (double chocolate, vanilla with cherry and mint chocolate chip).  

There are on Monteith's beers on tap and some rotating summer options. There are other beer options by the bottle if you prefer as well as an adequate wine selection. Soft drinks and well drinks are available, too. 

The staff is great (our table loves Alex) - they're quick with orders and always wandering around looking to help. Definitely the best drinking establishment in Ferrymead and worth a stop if you live in the area.

Fantastic pan-Malaysian cuisine.  Good regular dishes like beef rendang and laksa with new items like a Dori donut with ginger lime ice cream.   Dumplings were light and tasty. Laksa needed more flavour but the pak Chou with confit garlic was delicious, combined with the very friendly priced lemak ($8) i was very full and happy.

Make a booking and beware the noise levels,  very popular on a Saturday evening

I rarely write reviews especially if I didn't quite like the place...I'd just not go back & never recommend it to anyone. But I'm doing this more for the Asian newbies in Chch who are homesick & craving for some great Asian meals! Was very excited when I found this place especially when I'm missing good Taiwanese food (though I'm not Taiwanese, I've had very good ones when I lived in the US & Singapore). Quite surprising their Facebook page many had given rave reviews. Which has now taught me a good lesson - DO NOT judge a place by it's good reviews LOL! The restaurant itself was nicely set up & rather cozy. Ordered three dishes + 1 dessert (which I would usually order at a Taiwanese restaurant)... 


1) Their Signature Giant Fried Chicken Cutlet - as per description it was not that Giant. It looked rather beaten, flat & dry instead of a succulent piece of chicken. The seasoning 
though was alright. 

2) Braised Minced Pork Rice (small size $6.50) - rather confusing as in this dish usually minced pork is used but in it's description it says finely chopped pork belly. The most disappointing of the lot! In the bowl there was approx. 3/4 cup of steamed rice, literally 1 tablespoonful of the finely chopped braised pork belly, half a braised egg & *note instead of using pickled mustard greens ...it was 2 slices of Japanese pickled daikon. 

3) Taiwanese Style Beef Noodle Soup - Surely they can't go wrong with a signature noodle dish which is eaten all over Taiwan! But they did! Egg noodles were used here instead of hand made pulled noodles which has more of a mouth feel. The braised beef was ok. Soup base fell very flat! It tasted like a soup mix out of a packet. Unusually & oddly sweet, not the kind of sweetness that is extracted out of a stock made from scratch. Small plus point, they did have pickled mustard greens in this dish.

4) Mango Shaved Ice with Vanilla Ice cream - Don't know why I bothered haha! Didn't want to make another pit stop for dessert & hey how bad can they mess this one up eh? Unfortunately it was not a sweet ending but a soupy one. The shaved ice was coarse & both ice and ice cream had half melted when it was served. Mango bits were the only good thing in this dessert. 

Four dishes & $40 later, totally not impressed ): I felt I was never going to find any good small eats but I did!!! A wee gem in a tiny food court right next to the Countdown Supermarket on the corner of Moorhouse Ave & Madras Street. There are just four stalls there but the one that was absolutely buzzing was Hang Seng Food Bar. I ordered the hot & spicy (& sour) noodle soup with braised beef, tripe, fish balls, bean sprouts & pickled mustard greens $12. A good serving, it arrived piping hot (: The flavours were balanced & one that was immediately familiar as it hit my taste buds. Not joking...it was almost tears at first bite!!! They delivered! SO GOOD!!! As I sat there observing, their fried rice & fried noodles were very popular too. For just a small stall they had an extensive menu (with pictures) & I can't wait to go back to try more! 

Peace & Good Eats

I was really excited to find this place. They've been open for a year. 

The place- well decorated, low key, good amount of seats.

The food- good selection of all the Taiwanese food that you can crave for!!! We ordered the popcorn chicken. Was a bit disappointed. The meat was on the tougher side and not well marinated. And lacks the familiar salty pepper power that you find in Taiwan popcorn chicken. 
The bubble tea was a bit too well done. It's a tapioca was a bit too soft.

Service- good, friendly. 

Price- average but not cheap.

Overall it's a good attempt! Good to have a Taiwanese restaurant to go to in Christchurch

Such lovely people run this small bastion of good ole down home Taiwan-style food that I was really sure the food would turn out to be good. I tried the quintessential Taiwanese dish--red cooked beef noodles (红烧牛肉面)--and was thrilled when they arrived and the familiar anise scent wafted from the bowl. The noodles appear to be handmade so they had that essential toothy texture and the beef was oh so tender and delicious. This was a great bowl of soup and at only $12 a steal, too. Can't wait to try their other dishes!

Never felt so rushed. Rushed in from drinks to table 1/2 hour early. Chased up dessert menus. Then had to chase dessert from the kitchen. No drink service at the table. Service was atrocious. Had organized 17 to eat, so big party very embarrassing. Definitely eat somewhere else.

Sure the food is alright but it isn't a place I'd run back to. If anything, the food is for people with bland or basic food tastes and there isn't anything incredibly exciting, however, the servings are bigger than expected.  I had the Burrito Ranchero as nothing else really appealed to me on the menu, it was not good nor was it bad. It just wasn't very 'out there' enough. Definetly pricey, around 25+ per meal but if you're looking for a basic restaurant dish then this is your place.

Very pleasant surprise. Restaurants by the airport are usually hit or miss. Mostly misses. This one was very good. 

We had the garlic prawns and the fish. Both were quite good. 

Service was prompt and courteous.  Good selection of beers.

It's 10mins walk from Christchurch airport, it's my second time to be here. I ordered a Running Bear Salmon, absolutely delicious! The salmon meat is tender, with that sauce is a beautiful combination, their seafood meals must have( I've tried other seafood meal which is good as well)! I like their music with pretty good sound quality, also atmosphere here as well. Highly recommended to enjoy here before leaving CHC airport.

Close to the airport, so my expectations were lowered, but I had a great meal. Johnny Cash chicken (all their meals have non food names), is a chicken breast stuffed with mushrooms and chopped veggies, coated with something thin but crunchy, and then covered with mushroom sauce and more mushrooms. It comes with chips and coleslaw, but I just got extra coleslaw. The chicken was big, hot, moist and tasty. The coleslaw was also a large portion, and was crunchy with a number of julienned vegetables covered with a slightly creamy dressing with a pleasant vinegar taste. The mushroom sauce probably had a lot of calories, but the meal tasted great, and I mostly had chicken and veggies. Three different waitstaff stopped by to make sure I had ordered and then to make sure I enjoyed my dinner. They seemed to be enjoying their work as much as I was enjoying my meal.

This place might have good food - we wouldn't know. We made a booking 24 hours beforehand, and arranged to meet friends for an early meal before heading to a show. We arrived to find another group (not booked) using our booked table. The staff were completely unhelpful - just shrugged their shoulders and were unwilling to move the people. We commented (politely) that we were not impressed, but in the end went to another restaurant. What annoyed me the most was the 'we really don't care' attitude of the staff.  We're never going back that's for sure.
Excellent!  Just What I needed.  I have been cRaving good dumplings since I left Taiwan  12 years ago.  Fresh and tasty.

I'm not sure why this place has good reviews.  I found their dumplings to be surprising average-- they don't even use homemade wrappers.  Tried the pork and chive dumplings and they were just not special. I also had the cha shao about which were ok. 

Where I am from this place wouldn't survive.

Hip little dumpling restaurant in Christchurch.  After a month of traveling and not always having the best food, I was definitely craving some Asian comfort food.  When I saw dumpling bar, it was like my prayers have been answered!  

We ordered so much food!  Pork 'n' Garlic Chive Dumplings, Pork 'n' Ginger and Spring Onion Dumplings, Pork Belly Bao Bun, Beijing Duck Bao Bun, Pork & Prawn Shumai, Steamed Asian Greens, and PSDB Signature Xiaolongbao.  I was soooooooo excited for our food.  

But then, a few items came out, we stuffed our faces, and then the food just stopped.  It took a very long while for the rest of our food to come out.  Turns out they forgot about the rest of our orders.  I was pretty frustrated (but still patient) at the time, and the server was very apologetic about the wait.  They even gave us a cucumber salad for free.  When I finally got the check, they took off about ¾ of our bill - most of the dumplings and even our drinks.  

So, in the end, we left as happy campers with full bellies.  Would I come back?  Absolutely!  The food was phenomenal.
Yum lunch, prompt food, the coriander pork dumplings are my favourite! Good luck getting a table during the lunch hour- they share seating with half a dozen other places in the food court area

We are Asian Americans who were on the last leg of our honeymoon when we came upon this place.  Let's just say I was longing for some Asian food after feeling like I smelled like a New Zealand lamb from eating so much of it.  Dumplings sounded like an amazing idea.  I knew I wasn't supposed to expect much..

First thing I noticed. 
We were the only Asians in the place when we walked in.  Hm.. hope that doesn't mean anything..

Second thing,
The place is kind of dark, like they are trying to make eating Chinese dumplings a cool, hip, bad-boy, thing to do.  Strange, but okay.  I didn't like the weird eerie dark background music with random Chinese going on.  Eerie, very eerie.

Now what about the food?
Food was good.  The dumplings (fried) were nice and crispy, though as another reviewer said, kind of an interesting style I hadn't had before.  The steamed dumplings were not bad as well.
The xiao long bao was good, but the skin was not as thin as I like (It's not DIN TAI FUNG, k guys?).  
They ran out of duck :( so we also got the pork belly "burger" ... that was good, crispy pork deliciousness, and kind of funny.  It's basically bigger than your average pork belly open faced bun (IDK how to say it in English), so they call it a burger!

Also, the service, was, really, not there.  
I would have given them higher stars if they had been a little, LITTLE more attentive.  We were waiting for so long sitting at the table with our menu that I started to wonder if we were supposed to go to the counter to order??  Genuinely!  We weren't.. ?  We also were given no napkins to start with.  We asked for a refill on water and it came the first time, but the second time, it didn't come.  

--Bottom line, it was good for a dumpling craving coming from California, but it was more expensive than what we were used to and we didn't like the bar feel.--

On our way out of Christchurch, we stopped at Pot Sticker to grab a quick bite. I have to say that their website is quite clear about their enthusiasm about dumplings, and the storefront - with a lot of manga art around the front - is similarly reflective of the affinity for Asian culture.   Placing our order was relatively quick, and after a ~7-10 minute wait, we sat down at the bar surrounding the restaurant, we started chowing down. The one upshot here is that the meat filling, particularly the pork, is much higher-quality stuff than your usual generic pork meat that gets stuffed in dumplings. The flavor of the pork is very good, and I really liked the flavor of the winter warmer dumplings. Unfortunately, the technique was not up to snuff, detracting away from the overall experience. The wrapper on the steamed dumpling was a bit rubbery, making each bite a tad strange. The fried dumpling was even more puzzling; it appears that all that is done is taking a steamed dumpling and having it sit in a skillet covered with a thin film of frying oil. All this served to do was give the outer edges a crisp, but since they were steamed, it made them extremely dry.

In short - while the filling is pretty top-notch, the wrapper and cooking technique of the dumpling fell a bit short of what I would expect in my favorite dumplings. If they could perfect that, along with doing a true fried dumpling (e.g. don't steam them, then attempt to fry them - just throw the whole thing on the skillet and give it a good oily crisp on the bottom) - this would definitely get a marked-up rating from me.

This is a tiny corner-store in the Colombo mall that looks like it belongs in a Japanese manga! 

Order a dozen steamed or fried dumplings, choose your filling and dipping sauce, then sit back and wait for the magic to unfold!  

Watch the little dumpling masters expertly cup each pot-sticker wrapper in their palm, slap a bit of filling, then lace it with sesame oil and the hot, soupy juice that will squirt out when you bite into it! A thumb here and there, and before you can say 'kung fu', the edges are sealed and neatly crimp frilled! 

Slosh goes the oil, in goes the pot-stickers until they start to brown, then comes the scoop of hot water and down goes the bamboo lid! Ask for steamed dumplings and watch the pot-stickers get chucked into boiling water and gently poked around until they start to float! 

Pick them up with your chopsticks, dunk them in the sauce and stick them in your gob for the best dumpling experience - this side of China! 

If you're still not convinced, then surf their manga-style website and prepare to have their red and black digital ink brand you with an unhealthy obsession for dumplings!

The best dumplings you will ever taste in Christchurch. 
Obsessed and I have tried all their menu items. Would love to go again and again and again...

I am obsessed with dumplings and this place does some of the best in Christchurch. I spent a year in Napier where there are no decent dumplings to be found for love or money so it was such a relief to return to Christchurch and discover Pot Stickers a mere 100m from my work. Don't expect to find any food here but dumplings but thats ok because they are exceptional. 
There are generally about 4-5 different flavours, and they do vege tuesday. The beef and beetroot is surprisingly spectacular (I had my doubts) and my personal favourite is the classic pork and coriander. Your options are 6/12/18 steamed or fried. Be prepared to wait if you want fried as its always busy. Steamed is faster. I go for the "dozen matter" which offers a selection of all the flavours, and yes you can get 6 of the dozen matter if you are just after a snack. These dumplings are exploding with flavour, packed full of filling, and perfectly cooked. There is a window that looks into the kitchen so you can see the dumpling chefs hard at work while waiting for your meal. 
I come here at least once a week and can recommend it wholeheartedly.

Nom nom nom.  Dumplings.  Nom.

This uber popular casual mall eatery features 4-5 flavors of dumplings daily.  You can choose steamed or pan-fried and watch your order prepared from behind glass.  My favorites are the pork & coriander and the beef & beetroot.  An order of six is not quite enough for one person, but twelve equals nap time.  Just know that going in.  Haha.  Wash the delicious bites down with a ginger beer and enjoy procrastinating at work the rest of the day.

This amazing little dumpling joint is tucked away inside Colombo Mall. I have only been during the lunch hour and the line is always at least 5 or 6 people long. They offer 5 flavors (4 are always the same, one changes) and you can order them by the 1/2 or dozen. I prefer to order the "Dozen Matter" where you can get whichever dumplings you want. My favorite flavors are Garlic Pork and Chive (staple) the Vegetarian option (staple) or Beefroot (speciality: beef + beetroot). They also have chicken dumplings, too. There are 3 sauces to choose from (or get all three) chili, vinegar, soy. You can ask for them to be extra hot if you'd like (as someone who can't stand heat, the chili does have a bite). 

There is seating in the mall, both at a large communal table and on stools against the dumpling joint. I love sitting at the stools because you can watch the dumplings being made, which provides entertainment while you wait (at least 10 minutes from order time).

Street parking is definitely hard to find, and you will need to find a spot longer than 30 minutes. This is not a quick "in and out" option as the dumplings are cooked to order. I definitely recommend driving out of your way to have lunch here. You will not be disappointed as these are some of the best dumplings I have had (outside of New York City)!
The ambiance here is great love the decor diverse group of people here for coffee and breakfast staff are friendly thanks always enjoy my detour here
My meal was pretty good, but I waited to be served for 40 minutes and I was a party of one. Other people sat down and were severe long before me.

THE BEST TASTING COFFEE in Christchurch--without a doubt! Always friendly and fast customer service. I think their menu could be freshened up more often with some lighter meals, but other than that it's amazing!

Stumbled across this cafe when I was looking for a place to study in Christchurch. They had nice outdoor seating with a rustic/modern look. I ordered the waffles, and it was a rich and delectable treat that looked pretty, too! I'm happy to have found a nice cafe to indulge my sweet tooth! I also enjoyed their meat pie.

After following Google maps with several trips around the block we found this warm and buzzy cafe where we enjoyed good coffee and breakfast. Parking in a city one is unfamiliar with was a challenge but saw there are parks at the cafe's back entrance.
The place was very busy attesting to its popularity.

I'm a bit fussy with snack foods and hate sweet things so it's hard for me to find a snack at cafes that is small enough to be considered a snack but not a super sweet cake or slice. I ordered the Bounty Bar Slice purely because it has a little sign saying "refined sugar free" . Oh my lord it was amazing! They have heaps of gluten free options which is awesome for those customers. The place was packed solid at 11am on a Wednesday but the staff are efficient enough to handle it.

This place feels a little tucked away but it's worth the stretch of the legs to discover this beautiful cheery cafe. The staff are friendly, quick to clear tables and keep the place looking welcoming. Although busy when I arrived it took no time for the coffee to turn up and with good upbeat background music, vibrant feel and lots of seating options this is the place to enjoy a good cup of Joe.

Lovely coffee shop with delicious food! I had the avocado toast which was incredibly tasty and reasonably priced. For coffee, I tried the siphon (also spelled syphon) brew of an Indonesian bean...absolutely delicious. Black Betty makes for a fantastic brunch spot with plenty of seating.
Absolutely delicious!  I got the Stacey's Stack, and the pesto hollandaise was perhaps the best hollandaise sauce I've ever had!!

A very good, and very filling bacon avocado sandwich plus some crazy coffee selections in a country that seems filled to the seams with great coffee. When I went it was a particularly dreary and rainy day and Black Betty provided a nice bit of respite.
Great atmosphere, friendly staff, fresh food, and good coffee. Love that they offer vegan/vegetarian options and kid portion meals. They also have a little area with toys for the kids.

I had an amazing chai latte and the big veg breakfast. I loved the latte. The dish was okay. My friends had Betty luck with their dishes. Betty's granola was phenomenal !! The crispy bacon hash was also very good.

Great service. Everyone is so nice. Had their cappuccino, latte, Mexican breakfast fish and the veggie big dish.  The Mexican breakfast was amazing. Especially their chipotle cream sauce which I mixed into their veggie big breakfast. But the service here alone would bring me back!

Service was great buy there was no table service and a long queue with only one person at the till. It didn't seem like a very efficient way to take orders
The food was out quickly and was nice but nothing to rave about (I had the smashed avocado)
My Syphon coffee was beautiful!!!! And the girl who served it was awesome :)

Great food, great coffee, free Wi-Fi, and a cool atmosphere. The coffee is good compared to other cafes, and the food is fantastic. Try the French toast crumpets.

They also have a wide array of coffee brewing methods. I tried the "Aero-press" coffee and they explained in detail the process of that brewing method when they brought it to my table.

This place was fantastic.  As a first timer, I was not sure how it all worked, so showed up Sunday morning to a line (fortunately inside).  I stood there patiently waiting and watching amazing coffee and food pass by.  I finally arrived to the counter after passing all the goodies.  Made my order got  a number, found a table and sat down.  The coffee came first and my friend ordered tea.  Her milk came in a little poison bottle which was very clever and cute.  My latte was perfect! Food next.  Spin on English breakfast.  Impressive display and amazing flavor.  The ambiance, food, and service were fantastic.
This place is awesome.cute tbles. Good coffee and a ton of yummy brunch options. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a sweet coffee and brunch spot

Used to be my favorite but not at more unfortunately. There is hair in the dish,the potato taste not right - something is out of date. When I ordered at the counter I wasn't even asked how I'd like to have the eggs cooked.
Great coffee shop! Has a minimalist and clean look. Food is to die for. The tea is great, the croissant with chicken and avocado is my favorite.

Really good, had avacado smash for brunch - was delish and fresh 
Super quick too - was out in 10mins 
Coffee really good, milk silky etc

Really cool Cafe in the centre of town. Was packed when we arrived at 11am on Sunday for brunch. But that is a sign that the place is going to be good. We found our own table and the waitress explained it was a 25 minute wait for the food regardlesss if it was kitchen or cabinet food. 

I ordered the avocado smash and a flat white. The coffee was amazing! I would come back just for that. The food was also top notch though. Great presentation and a generous portion. Overall a very good experience and would highly recommend this Cafe. Only thing to keep in mind is a wait time for food during peak times.

Nice food. A few different spins on the traditional breakfast which mixes it up a bits. Choice is also pretty decent too. 

Coffee is delicious and you can tell they are nerds and put a lot of effort into it. 

A cool setting with plenty of space and nice friendly staff. Definitely worth a visit

A fun and trendy spot for our afternoon in Christchurch. We had the desayuno de Mexico (tasty though beans were undercooked) and the creamy mushrooms (one of the better creamy mushroom dishes I've had recently). Really enjoyed it, but will probably try a different cafe next time I'm in town.

What a neat place! We are so glad we came here before we left town. The building is charming and fun to look around while inside. We had the boiled eggs and bacon twist and poached eggs on toast. Both super tasty and the bacon wasn't overly fatty. We arrived early and there wasn't any wait for brunch but it appeared to fill up quickly. They seem to really like their coffee and have coffee plants everywhere! Don't miss out!

casual dining atmosphere.
good food.
ppl enjoying affluent breakfast.
lastly, it gave me a kind of insights for the dining business.

When I was at CPIT I used to come here purely for the service. Recently I've tried cooked breakfast and it is SO good. I have no other words to describe the food other than YUM. Compared to other cafes in chch, this is by far the best! 

The food always comes out so quickly (sometimes amazingly quick) and the staff make a point to be friendly which makes it overall such a great environment and experience- no matter if you're by yourself doing a bit of work, or with a group of friends out for brunch. It's always a very busy place which tells me I'm not alone in my love of this place.

Lastly, as a barista of many years and a very picky person when it comes to coffee, I'd like to make a point of saying how consistently delicious the coffee is here, no matter what kind! 

I'll gladly travel across town anytime to come here. Worth it.

I found Black Betty on yelp when we first arrived in Christchurch and were dying for some coffee and breakfast. I'm so glad that I listened to the reviews. This place is amazing. I'd kill to have it as my local haunt. They have a huge, really cool looking facility with plenty of seating. Their menu was broad and diverse. The coffee was the best though. Thoughtfully crafted, smooth and delicious. I absolutely loved it. Would it be weird if I flew half way across the world just to come back here?

2nd day in Christchurch and came here for breakfast. We were not disappointed. Great breakfast with gluten free whole meal toast.
Breakfasts are not cheap but with free range eggs and bacon you can't go wrong.

Christchurch is meh but this place is awesome! Courteous and friendly staff and the food was amazing. I got the Shakshouka while my girlfriend got the Black Betty's Breakfast Stack. 10 out 10, just go there already!

I'm a coffee snob. There I said it. I'm a coffee snob and this shop gets 4 stars. The coffee here is amazing. I had a soy milk latte and it was perfectly foamed and not burnt. I'll definitely be back here.   I didn't have the food (still trying to swallow high NZ prices for brekkie) but what I saw coming out of the kitchen looked fresh, clean, and delicious.  Staff were quick to talk about GF/DF options and said they could happily accommodate a range of diets. Thanks so much folks!
Really nice coffee! & I'm picky. Great brunch too. Interesting atmosphere - but often quite busy.

We recently visited black Betty's when The restaurant wasn't busy and in sad to say my Last experience was really poor, both service and food was not good. Wouldnt go back. I tried to get the attention of various waitresses which just didn't happen so before I left I left a note with my number asking them to call so I could give them this feedback.. No response at all which indicated they weren't interested. Not s good effort from one of the city's supposedly better cafes.
Place had a gd vibe and was very busy. Food was nice but luke warm. Finished my food before coffee arrived!

Enjoyed the relaxed state of the 2 male staff.I asked for a bagel and spread, in which one of the guys replied..."What do you feel like?".I like this approach.The spreads and bagel hit the spot.Coffee was bang on.

We only had time for one breakfast in Christchurch before beginning our drive down to Queenstown, and I'm sure glad we found this place on Yelp. The cafe has a casual, comfortable environment. They served me a delectable toasted sesame bagel with cream cheese and pesto, and the best flat white I had anywhere in NZ. I got a double shot in their medium-sized cup, and savored every last sip. The espresso tasted almost caramelized. For the rest of my two-week trip I was just chasing the dragon, but nothing else compared.

Black Betty is a work in progress, at least from a structure standpoint as it is still recovering from the earthquake. The food is definitely not WIP - it's outstanding. Terrific innovative egg dishes (which I love, as does my family), yummy crumpet based french toast (for my kids), and super coffees. I had the avocado smash - a poached egg on thick multigrain toast with a huge dollop of avocado on it. My wife had shakshouka - this first time I've ever seen this outside of Israel. We didn't have the pastries from the case, but many other patrons were eating them, and appeared to be enjoying them. Probably our only time in Christchurch, as we were just passing through, but in the off chance we're back - we're definitely headed to Black Betty again.
Great brunch, good size & value for money.  Chairs & tables were quirky - good vibe.  Will definitely come back here again
First time in Chch....stumbled in here, in search of coffee. Bebop floated on the air and cake looks divine. Good coffee, big airy full of light. Wide spaced comfortable tables. Very nice.

They close at 4pm which is the only downside. Amazing coffee, baristas and food. Also, great savs on offer and big pitchers of water you can get freely from the fridge. Very happy with my multiple experiences here!
Food is nice, they are known for their coffee. It's good but not amazing (to me anyway!), service friendly but sometimes slow.
Amazing food and coffee. Normally a bit if a wait for a table and/or food but its what you expect in a place of this size. Recommended.

I really like this place - very good breakfast served until 2:30, fast, efficient service, and cool atmosphere: wood everywhere, blackboards with Poe-ish chalk drawings of ravens, warehouse ceiling and comfy chairs. No wonder this place is so popular. 

I tried the French toast crumpet with fruit compote which was very nice (14.50) - with sweetness from the raspberries balanced by the tartness of the yogurt. Not sure the bananas are necessary, but you get those too. Good flat white - only had to go with one sugar where I usually need 2. For the purist, they also have a coffee tasting set if you want to explore their variety of beans.

Felling a little bit hungry and friends had recommended Black Betty to us, the food from the cabinet was very high quality. My wife had a sausage roll which much was bigger then it appeared and a mixture of quality sausage meat, vegetables and herbs, she loved it, and I had a whole-grain chicken brie and salad roll. Staff were nice, overall a very satisfying lunch.

very cute shop with good coffee (tiramisu latte) and innovative meals (beef cheek hash + Black Forest oats). Turkish eggs for me were a little bland but crispy chickpeas were the best part of the dish- worth it. 

service was good and food came out timely :) a little empty this morning but lively nonetheless! overall pretty decent breakfast!

This is mostly to confirm the previous reviews were on point as the last review was a while ago.  Make reservations if you can.  We didn't and were seated quickly, but I noticed our table was reserved after us. The food and service were great.

Tom Jones playing in the background... mad rush of takeaway coffee slurpers... but if you sit down and take the time to enjoy breakfast (small but refreshingly different menu to to the nz/au fare) you will be very pleasantly surprised.  Had the shakshuka for breakfast  ($22) and was fantastic. Came with home made flat bread with sea salt and caraway seeds. Really good. And with an awesome friendly staff, this can easily become your go to place every Monday to Friday. Or even Sunday.

Sorry had to downgrade the rating because the smoked salon Benedict was just way too salty. The service is ok and the place is really nice. Really wanted to give it a 4 star but then crazy saltiness of the smoked salmon was too much.

This place is a must for breakfast if you are Christchurch! They are very creative with the food and their food is presented nicely.

I went with the beef hash cheek. It was good but nothing spectacular. The portion was good. If the potatoes were more crispier and salty it would have been better, nevertheless still a good order.

My wife went with the granola. I thought it was going to be a boring order but I was proven wrong!!! It tasted great and the portion was big.

Finally the reason for the five star rating is their banana loaf which we shared. It's a must if you are in hello Sunday cafe.
Tasty and beautifully presented brunch. Well worth the visit for the fresh take on beef hash alone!
Excellent food! I ordered 2 plates just for myself! Food is delicious and health concious! Excellent brunch venue!

Used my Yelp community to check out a place to eat after visiting the Ferry St Antique shops. Thanks to you all who previously reviewed Hello Sunday. Lunch was just what I wanted and even my mother-in-law was happily taken care of which her sweet choice of crumpets with berries and coconut yoghurt. My salad was excellent and the Japanese pancake chosen by my husband was delish!

Cute, hip breakfast / lunch spot about 30 min walk from the cathedral in downtown. Friendly staff and a good mix of people. There's outdoor space as well as indoor and an adorable courtyard out back with herbs growing in pots along the path. Definitely recommended as a local spot to eat!

The food variety is perfect and the range of heathy dishes available - some with meat and many others without, was just great. The falafel was soft and flavourful and the coffee delicious. Cabinet food also looked good

I definitely recommend a booking for this fantastic brunch spot in the CBD. It ranks up as one of my top brunch spots in Christchurch and one not to be missed by locals and visitors alike. There will absolutely be a wait if you don't have a booking (and maybe even so if you do have a booking and tables haven't turned over, the space is small and the wait is worth it). If you try to walk in (as we did) the staff will usher you to a waiting room in the store next door and ask for your drink order. Having the coffee while we waited helped wake us up and keep us cheery. About 30 minutes later we were seated at a small wooden table with a chair on one side and wooden bench seat on the other. My husband ordered the Ham Hock Waffles and I ordered the Avocado Smash (not listed on their online menu). 

The Ham Hock Waffle was a large waffle smothered in ham hock bits and a tomato relish salad complete with melted cheese covering the waffle, chunks of soft cheese, tomatoes, rocket and sprouts. The presentation is fabulous, but the flavor is even better. 

The Avocado Smash was simply a piece of multi-grain toast simply smothered in smashed avacado and topped with a poached egg, served with polenta fries and chopped cherry tomatoes on the side. Holy Yum. I didn't even want to share with hubby, but since he let me try the waffle, I had to return the favor. VERY reluctantly. 

We also split a cinnamon bun, which disappeared from our plates before I could snap a photo. It was warm, gooey and fantastic. Overall, effective table turnover, presentation, wait time and taste all exceeded my expectations. You MUST try this brunch spot out!
Good food and ambiance. A decent restaurant in christchurch downtown for someone craving indian food. A little on the pricey side but food was good.

Flavour-packed, generous portions, great service!

Stopped in for a casual lunch and was seriously impressed. The butter chicken was rich and creamy without being overly sweet, and the naan was fresh and fluffy -- straight out of the tandoor.

Service was fast, friendly, and the portions were generous for the price. Plenty of vegetarian options too, which is always a win. Will definitely be back to try more of the menu!
Service was great, ambience is solid, and food was exceptional. I highly recommend this place!
The food was great and different from what I normally have.  Service was on point and quite quick.  It's a bit loud but it's because it was very busy.  We all enjoyed our meals and would recommend.

Wow! We had an awesome meal at Mumbaiwala. Although two of us ordered four dishes, we weren't too full because they didn't come with rice and weren't as rich as some Indian food. The Prawn Koliwada was six prawns in amazing spices with a dipping sauce. The Sev Puri are small discs with yummy toppings. Not spicy. The Chaat Dal Chaat were toasted lentils with green apples and other spices. The Palak Panner Tikka was paneer cheese that was lightly charred with spinach, tomato and onion. We loved sharing every dish!

You can't miss this place, they are bumping modern Indian music with a flare of EDM/hip hop beats that make you want to dance as you walk by and then question yourself as why you weren't invited to what seems like such a fun party. 

Fear Not - this place is not one that requires reservations a month in advance. Show up and be ready for your taste buds to go on an adventure way more exciting than Frodo's Trip to Mordor!

*IF YOU DONT LIKE SPICY FOODS - READ THE MENU CAREFULLY* This place packs the heat!!

Foe those crazy souls still down to test your mouths limits, you've come to the right place.

As soon as you walk in, you'll smell the charcoal burning that's smoking the meats right in front of you. This place makes your dish fresh to order - no hidden microwaves in the back.

Every bite I had was better than the last.

Tandodi Chicken Wings were smokey, salty, and spicy. Use the lemon wedge provided to give that extra acidity and really take this dish over the edge.

Kadai Chicken was thick, complex, tender, and spicy!  It was not as sauce-heavy as a butter chicken, but there was enough sauce to be great over rice. We also ordered the Garlic Naan and it was a perfect addition. 

Green Apple Pickle - I wasn't sure about this at first, but I'm so glad we got this side dish. I enjoy spicy food, but I'm no wildfire warrior that can swallow spice without grimace. These Apple bits were the perfect palate cleanser and really reset my mouth before each dish. Still crunchy, and slightly tart, the apples were refreshing and crisp - a welcome reprieve for a mouth slowly catching on fire.

Overall, this place was INCREDIBLE, probably some of the best Indian Food I've ever had (not lucky enough to make it to India yet).

INCREDIBLE MEAL - best Indian food i've had outside of India! 
Kripy helped us when we were trying to figure out what we wanted...everything she brought was fantastic! Definitely will return and recommend!

We didn't feel like going out so ordered take out from Mumbaiwala. I mentioned this only because none of the previous reviews, or indeed the restaurant's own  website mentions that this is available. Maybe it's a given in this part of the world. They don't deliver though. I had a very tasty lamb curry with very good garlic naan. My dining companions shared a chicken dish and a veggie option which isn't my cup of darjeeling but whatever makes your day ! Recommended.

Really excellent find. We are foodie Indian Americans from Los Angeles. In Christchurch for 2 nights. Went there last night. 

Had ginger and chili themed cocktails. 

The Vindaloo chicken wings was excellent. The waitress said it was spicy hot, but not for our palates. 
We also had karhai chicken and the special lamb dish. With a regular and a garlic naan. 
Finished with kulfis. 

Had leftovers for breakfast next morning. 

Very good.
Tastiest chaat in town. Paani Poori, Dahi Poori, Dabeli, Puri Chole were all spectacular and authentic. Great service too.

In my admittedly limited experience, having spent only two weeks in Australia and New Zealand, Mumbaiwala serves up some of the finest Indian food available to Her Majesty's antipodean realms.  The vindaloo chicken wings blew me away with their tenderness and flavour. The butter chicken (yes, I know, bog standard) was some of the best I've tasted anywhere.  

I must ding them for one small thing, though, the "naan chips" were nearly indistinguishable from the crispy noodles served in Chinese restaurants in the States with egg drop soup.  Even with this, I can't deduct any stars, the rest of the meal was just too good. 

Really well done, Mumbaiwala.
Fantastic service, delicious food, fabulous drinks. This is the perfect spot to meet with friends and have a great night. Will definitely visit again soon!
Authentic look and feel of India in the restaurant. Food definitely doesn't disappoint. Everything tasted fresh and flavorful.
I always come here when i am in Christchurch. They have good indian food. And its really close to city center

Great find in Christchurch. Situated in city center this is a great indian dining place. Bombay chucked and butter corn as starters alongwith lime juice was excellent. Tried that dhal makhani and parsi mutton. Both great choices. Highly recommended if you are in Christchurch.

Good food, bad experience with the service. We booked a table for 8:30 pm on the website, unfortunately they were able to seat us only by 9:15. Our server took the our orders another 30 mins later and by the time we got our food, there was another hour's delay. 
In their defense, our visit was on a Sat evening and they were definitely very busy. Also, I have to say that our server did everything possible to make it up to us. He gave us one of the appetizers complimentary as well as gave us an discount on the bill. Having said that, I'd rather pay for my food and enjoy the overall experience than go through this experience again. 
I'd be happy to go back another day, probably a weekday to see the difference in service.

This place is amazing! We were traveling from San Francisco and SO happy we found this spot.
This is seriously some of the best Indian food we have ever had. 

The service was quick and friendly, the food was flavorful and filling.

5 stars all around!

Loved the ambiance. Little wait but wirth every extra minute we waited for sumptuous pav bhaji. Right in heart of Auckland. Wish you guys open a branch here in Bay Area, California. 

Wishes from tour fans in USA!

Excellent prawns with this spicy butter sauce, the best garlic naan bread I've ever eaten, Indian masala chai, and Czech pilsner.  That's what I had at Mumbaiwala.  The meal was superb, and can even put Indian restaurants in Sydney, Los Angeles, San Francisco, New York, London, etc. to shame.  What a gem of a find in Christchurch!  Service was great, too, they do a great job of being polite and attentive without being overbearing like the tip-dependent staff sometimes are in North America.

Mumbaiwala isn't cheap, but you probably deserve to splurge.  I'd return.

I totally agree with the comments made by Bansal Corp a week back.
The same sentiments are from customers
-Vijay Shekhar
- Husahnpreet Kaur 
The behavior of the owner exactly mimics the name of the restaurant "mumbaiwala" 
Which basically depicts street person with no customer centricity.Very arrogant and rude . No manners on how to deal with customers.
The owner has Absolutely no idea about being customer focus
This person Needs to stay in Mumbai rather than in a place like Christchurch 
I had very good impression about people in NZ during my Trip so far but this owner really puts a black spot on my total impression
Having said that my 99% experience in NZ was just fantastic.
I am so so so glad that we left the restaurant without eating their and then were suggested one of the best Indian restaurants in Christchurch called Coriander.
Thanks for the owners arrogance and his Mumbai tone , 
I will definitely not be recommending mumbaiwala to anybody in USA and being in field of public relations can at-least help over few thousand people to stay away from this restaurant and arrogant / rude behavior of the owner.
My rating is -5 as I believe that if you cannot be good to your customers you should not be in the business of serving people 
If anybody needs any more information
Pl ping me and I will respond .

Love the decor and the food was delicious. We tried some new things and they were yummy. The waiter was very helpful in describing the dishes. The homemade mango chutney was smooth, sweet, and perfect with the crispy flat bread. We had the chicken curry; it had just the right amount of heat. When you are in Christchurch be sure and give them a try.
Upscale Indian restaurant. They were a lot in interiors and the whole theme, but food was average and pricey I felt. Good choice for once in a while

For anyone looking for good authentic Indian food - this is the place. Really impressed by the decor, service and the food. Must try the kadai chicken. Masala chai could have been better but still was close.

Absolutely amazing atmosphere. Good music. Friendly and helpful staff. 
Ask about portion sizes as a few dishes are small. 
Flavours are good. Reasonable price considering all of the above :)

Awesome selection and service-- this popular spot was packed on a Friday night, but the staff did a great job managing the crowd.  Plenty to Kingfisher flowing to wash down the spicy dishes, and they've even got a great butter chicken for us novices.  Would recommend in a heartbeat.

Awful, rude service and the food was poor quality. Staff appeared melancholy and the atmosphere was constantly ruined by a slamming door and kids running in and out of the restaurant, bar area and kitchen. This is not a gastropub. It's cheap eats at inflated prices at best.

Awesome food.  Great drinks.  Cool atmosphere.  Fun hip vibrant.  You can go big and try their signature dishes (the duck and pork belly are awesome) or try more standard pub fare like a burger or fish and chips.  Everything tastes gourmet but the atmosphere is more fun, hip, and down to earth.  If I could import this bistro to Denver is would be the most popular place in town hands down.  Staff is super friendly and the service is impeccable, yet nothing feels remotely pretentious.  Also nice outdoor patio for warm evenings.  I travel to Christchurch often on business and this is definitely my go-to joint.

It used to be my favourite breakfast place but the quality has dropped a lot. Last few times it's always been overcooked eggs. And even when it's not busy it always takes forever to get your food. I like the interior but not sure if that's enough to make me go back. Maybe for the ribs, which are so tender and well seasoned.

Great food, particularly the pork sliders. Very nice, trendy environment and the service was also excellent. While it doesn't come across as a cheesy 'family' venue, it is equipped with a change table and high chairs and the staff are very accommodating. There's quite a range of low alcohol drinks. Would get five stars if they had some good NZ craft beers available.
Fantastic food, great setting, friendly staff and great GF options. A very pleasant place to eat and grab a decent beer.

A lovely evening spent here with my laptop on their wifi as I've just arrived in Christchurch and trying to figure out what's next. Friendly bartender who pulled me a delicious cold beer.

Lots of options for drinks and food, seats inside and outside and even upstairs. Quiet, cool, comfortable. 

[Review 365 of 2024 - 18 in New Zealand - 21398 overall]

Dog-friendly, solid outdoor patio, and right by the trolley line so you get to see the dinner-trolley-thing drive by.

Focused more on beer than wine, and the food is good enough to say it's better than average, but not so much that you might actually rave about it. Calamari strips and fried chicken were both decent enough deep fried items, and the seafood chowder was good enough to hit the spot on an evening rapidly turning cool.

Service was refreshingly honest (out of mussels due to a local shortage) and I think that really sealed the rating as 4* rather than 3*.

Possibly the worst food I've ever eaten. Poorly executed and lacking even the most basic of seasoning. 
A truely horrible experience 
Unfortunately I have to give it one star in order to post this review

Good atmosphere and nice staff.
Beer was really good and the food was great. Had the pork belly with soy sauce, Caesar salad (salmon was so nice with it) and BBQ seafood pizza.
If I lived locally I would definitely be back

An awesome experience dining at Inati. I say experience, as not only was everything absolutely delicious, all dishes were precisely crafted. Highly recommend to anyone in Christchurch to experience Inati!

I've often walked past this place thinking I'll give it a try. Finally my partner and I decided to. Now this is a small place and the kitchen is in full view situated behind the bar. 
We went for the trust the chef option because, well that was the only option I could choose when booking which has a penalty of $50 if you don't turn up. This have the place an air of exclusivity but it annoyed me. Not a good start but hey.
We also noticed people were ordering what they liked, so not sure if there was a limit on order your own or not. Anyway, ordered some wine by the glass from a snotty waiter. A young guy who clearly needs to eat some humble pie. 
The other waiter thankfully was the opposite and real nice.
So the food was below par, the chicken we got was cooked well, moat and tasty. But the rest of the 5 courses other than the dessert were how can I say, like stuff they wanted to get rid of.
I'm short, for what you pay and what you get, which includes the service, the food, the experience, it's not worth the money. It's overpriced and there is much better offerings out there for less money and with more welcoming service.

Despite all the other rave reviews, I thought this place was just ok. We made a reservation but the table was not ready when we arrived. At that time, there was also no space in the lounge, so they directed us to the building lobby to sit down and offered us some water. During this time, I wish they would have given us a drink menu or something because it felt a little strange to just wait outside in this random lobby (also, another party was given a drink menu). Then, when we entered the restaurant, we were directed to these high barstools that overlook the kitchen area. It took until we started awkwardly draping our coats on the barstools for them to offer to take our coats (we also witnessed the hostess take the coats for others before us, so I'm not sure why it was so awkward for us). We did the 'Trust the chef" option. The food was good, but not amazing. Some of the dishes were on the saltier side, and I couldn't finish the main entree, and they don't allow take away of any leftovers. The wine pairing was tasty and definitely showcased some great NZ wines! In the end, it was cool to watch the kitchen, but for the pricepoint, I was expecting a little better service.

This place is really something special. I feel one can tell whether chef is just cooking well or whether they really know what they are doing, and in my opinion, this place has it. I've been to "starred" restaurants around the world, and live in LA (which has the most exciting  restaurant scene in the world right now) and I feel Inati ranks right up there as a place of note. The duck trumpets (mini ice cream cones with duck mousse) , boeuf-nuts (donut holes with perfect beef) were excellent, but the charred broccoli was just spectacular. These all showed imagination and mastery. The next table couldn't stop raving about the mutton.  Not to be missed, when in Christchurch!

My wife and I enjoyed a wonderful dinner at Inati a few weeks ago. We had 7pm reservations and were promptly seated at the kitchen bar with a view of all the delicious dishes being prepared. The restaurant features a sharable menu in which you can either order dishes separately or you can "Trust Us".  We had to go with the "Trust Us" menu, which featured six different dishes. We also added the wine pairing featuring local New Zealand wines that went perfectly with each dish. The first dish was the Tua Tua Clam Crudo, Cucumber & Gin. These tender and fresh clams were topped with citrusy crispy cucumbers. This was a light but flavorful dish and a nice way to start dinner. Next came my favorite dish of the night: Duck Trumpets & Blackberry Jam. Rich and creamy duck pate with a hint of sweet jam sat in a crispy waffle cone and was topped with crunchy nuts. This was an addictive balance of flavors and textures. I was on the verge of ordering another pair but the next dish distracted me: Charred Broccoli Root, Smoked Ricotta & Almonds. Inati turned the part of the broccoli that you threw away as a kid into something amazing! The broccoli stalk was super tender with a hint of smokiness and paired with creamy ricotta and crunchy almonds. Next was the Parsnip, Apple & Candied Walnut. I don't think I've ever had a parsnip before but I quickly became a fan! The vegetable was savory with a creamy topping (similar to mashed potatoes), sweet apples, and crisp walnuts. Aged Duck & Scratching was next. A crisp juicy lightly fatty skin surrounded mouthwatering, tender and lightly salty duck meat. An eggroll with even more tender duck meat added more deliciousness. Before our last dish (dessert), I wanted to order one more savory item that wasn't included in the "Trust Us" offering: Venison Bresaola, Seaweed & Pistachio. The venison was tender and gamey with a sweet jam and topped with powdered pistachios. Finally we had the Honey, Brown Butter & Sage for dessert. Airy and lightly sweet and salty custard was topped with creamy sweet sage ice cream and crunchy nuts. When in Christchurch, I highly recommend Inati for a nice date night.

Fabulous!  Easily topped the small plates we've had in the USA. We shared a bottle of wine (thank you to our server for recommending something based on our preferences rather than the priciest option), the curried cauliflower, seaweed braised potatoes (our least favorite), heritage tomatoes, soft cheese with walnuts and cucumber, smoked fish, and creamed corn with salted caramel ice cream.  In hindsight, we probably should have ordered the 6 plates "Trust Us" chef's choice.  All plates were meticulously presented, service was excellent and we loved the unusual combinations that complemented each other perfectly.

A tapas style restaurant with creative takes on local materials. You can sit at bar and chat with the sous chefs. Wines were excellent choices for the dishes. Of 5 dishes and dessert 4 were excellent and the only slight disappointment was dessert.

Service was near excellent (forgot to pour the red to accompany the lamb) but made up for it with apology and a stiff pour of the red.

Highly recommended
user_address: Central Business District, New Orleans, LA

text: This is an amazing new restaurant to hit the city of Christchurch. It is Inati to share food and experience unlike any other. The food is simple and so full of flavour. It is a place to visit when you are in Christchurch and a must. Food and wine is all local fare and matches are amazing. An amazing experience to have especially if you are into food and wine- a foodies dream!!! Keep going Christchurch we need more place a like this in the city

We are definitely people who "live to eat" so finding inspiring meals is always a priority when we travel. As a result we have had the good fortune to encounter many new and memorable foods, cooking techniques, and dining experiences. Inati was a one of our most recent gems. I have sent pictures and descriptions to friends & relatives stating that the evening we spent with Simon, Lisa and their staff was easily within one of the top 20 meals we've encountered in our 68 years. To describe the food would take many pages. I'll just say that everything is prepared by very highly skilled and motivated people who clearly love what they do. This alone is ample reason for all foodies to make this restaurant a priority. However, what really sets them apart is that the entire staff goes out of their way to make you feel that you are an important part of their evening and that they want you to feel as excited about what they are doing as they are. We are so glad that we get to return to Christchurch and re-visit Inati before we head back home from our vacation. The memories will stay with us for many years to come.
Inati has amazing food ! The monk fish was spectacular ! Beets were unlike any I've ever had ! It is a little pricey but definitely worth the money for a great date night.

There's a gym in the same building as Inati, on the other side of the elevators on the ground floor. I may as well get a membership to the gym, because I will be in the building, at Inati frequent enough to want to burn that guilt off at said gym. I could go to the gym, then go to Inati... Or just skip the gym all together.

This place is incredible. World class fare, new style, eclectic takes on classic and modern cuisines. Butcher's "scrapes" honoring the whole beast. Using familiar, natural and curious (in a good way!) flavors, all rolled together and discovered in a single plate. With local organic ingredients.

Small plates concept, with a couple larger plates available - I dined alone, so I opted to stick with the smaller plates (be warned larger plates. Your time will come to be inside me, too...)

Tonight was my first time dining at Inati, and the food was very possibly the best I've had in all my years visiting Christchurch (about 9 years now). Possibly the best meal I've had in the whole of New Zealand.

Service was professional, courteous and friendly (albeit the server was a little slow - Which is fine, as I recognized that there seemed to only be 2 front of the house staff, working the room. Maybe three? There was a guy who greeted me, but I couldn't tell his actual position. Sommelier/Host maybe?) But, I was fortunate enough to sit in front of whom I presume was the Chef - Who helped with front of the house duties for his single diner guest. 

2 notes of disappointment that I experienced:
The drink selections seemed somewhat limited with only beer and wine options. I personally prefer a small, limited cocktail program as an apertif. As well as coffee and/or espresso with dessert - But the restaurant is small, so it's forgivable that they may not have the room for a bar/hot drinks area. Or I just didn't notice them on the menu, which is entirely possible, too.

Secondly, the Chef's Table/Bar seats are too high for my stubby frame and I kind of struggled to get in and out. No suggestions, just an observation. It certainly won't deter me from dining at the same seat again.

Just. Plain. Delicious.

Beautiful, modern and spacious Burmese restaurant in Christchurch.  The server was very friendly, accommodating and actually from Burma/Myanmar.  Food was very tasty with authentic flavors, but can be adjusted for Western palates (primarily by dialing down the heat). If you have spicy food lovers, be sure to ask for the chilies on the side...they pack a lot of heat!  We enjoyed the Le Pet Thoke salad, Seit Da Kin (lamb skewers) and Jetda Ono Hin curry.  Everything was delicious and goes well with their selection of beers.  Only thing that I would change is perhaps having a little more tea leaves in the Le Pet Thoke.  Overall a lovely dinner and nice change of pace from the other Asian (mostly Japanese, Chinese, Thai and Vietnamese) restaurants in town.

If I could give more stars, I would. The food is amazing. Every dish is well thought out. They use the freshest ingredients to create magnificent dishes. Please give this restaurant a try, you won't be disappointed.

Very good traditional Burmese cuisine 
Wait staff were friendly and helpful.
Try the Tea Salad

Burmese food in Christchurch? We were intrigued so we decided to check out Rangoon Ruby for our first dinner in town. It's merged with The Bodhi Tree so don't confuse the two; it's now under one roof. Mama Hooch is located right next door to them.

We dropped in for an early Monday dinner (around 5:45pm). The inside is gorgeous with two floors and a very clean, modern look. Interesting that most of the clientele was Caucasian. 

The menu is short and sweet; nibbly bits, soups, vegetable/salad, meat, seafood and desserts. The drink menu is standard but at least the bottles are reasonable. 

- Lepet thoke ($14.50 NZD) - tea leaf salad is a Burmese speciality. Pickled tea leaves mixed with lentils, nuts, sesame seeds and chili. Barely any heat nor much tea leaf flavour but still a tasty dish. Also, way too pricey for such a small appetizer. 
- 2x steamed rice ($3.00 NZD/person) - we weren't sure but turns out you can get free refills on rice. Sweet because it's steep enough for plain white rice. 
- Nga kin ($17.50 NZD) - a boneless fillet of fresh fish (grouper) baked in the oven. When this dish got dropped off, we did a double take. Smallest piece of fish I've seen on a plate. Fish was nicely cooked but plain. Luckily, the side sauce was BOMB; could have drank that on its own. It was sweet, spicy and tangy (a mix of soy sauce, fish sauce, vinegar, cilantro, chives and hot pepper).
- Seit da nut ($16.50 NZD) - lamb curry cooked with lemongrass, ginger and curry leaves. You get three pieces; again, small portion but the lamb was tender and delicious. Wish that you'd get some vegetables with this dish.

Good flavours but know coming in that portions are small. 3.5 stars.

First review! Haven't eaten yet but smells mouth watering so far 
Here in Christchurch for a night with Cheetah girls on our road trip through New Zealand.

The Terrace Tavern need to think about the help they hire out the front. Last night my glasses and my phone were broken by a bouncer. I was dragged out of the crowd after the bouncer saw me in a choke hold, and told me I was the problem. I wasn't allowed to attempt to look for my glasses and there was absolutely no convincing any member of staff to help.

Overall very rude service, with a bad atmosphere to go with it. For my own safety I will be staying far away from Terrace Tavern.

We stopped here for lunch and I orDered the Pastrami sandwich and a glass of Sauvignon blanc. My husband ordered the oysters and they were not tasty. My sandwich was great. Menu had some great items and they have free Wi-Fi

Passed through for a late morning meal and was happy to see they were still offering their breakfast menu.  I ordered the Eggs Benedict and was impressed with the entire plate.  It wasn't traditional per se given it wasn't served with an English muffin or ham but their choice of bread or grain worked paired well with the salmon.  Our server was great and attentive.  The location is only a few blocks away from the touristy hustle and bustle, and really close to the local street tram stop, so it was very convenient.

Everyone looks under 25 and hungover
No service
Staff sit at the bar after work
Will not SURVIVE 
Very very poor

Great spot to have a beer. Food looked nice but only had a beer this time. Tried the Ginger Tom beer and it was a nice alcoholic ginger beer. Nice seating watching the trams and people walk pass. Would come back :)

We ate here twice during our stay in CHC. Amazing staff! Amazing starter and mains. The green lip mussels are to die for. The lamb rump also to die for. Prices are extremely reasonable. We paid double for green lip mussels another night in Queensland. We are happy we found Terrace Tavern in CHC!

I wanted to eat somewhere this afternoon near a park and with an opportunity to enjoy the sunshine. I was not disappointed at Terrace Tavern. Menu has many options and they were serving brunch until 3 PM on Sunday. I opted for sharing the corn and and crab soup with my aunt, and having the grilled cauliflower with halpumi, couscous and arugula salad. I was very impressed by the number of vegetarian options at this Gastro pub like spot. Most of the patrons were seated near the door or outside. Many were enjoying beers and snacks that afternoon. I was also super happy that the food was not overly salted. In fact I could've used a little bit more but was glad for them to err on the side of less. Service was friendly and helpful; the only drawback was that I asked for my bill three times before it came.
Great service; really friendly and helpful. And amazing tasty food; I had the Rockin Ribeye steak with delicious garlic butter - thank you!

I love this place. The food was amazing, the service was great considering it was packed Saturday night and we didn't book ahead.  Food wasn't too late about 15mins between starter and main. Drinks were on time. Could live on the ribs so yummy, and the Cajun prawns were amazing. And i love the booth next to the kitchen, much more private which is awesome because i dont like public eating. Thank use :)

If you are tired and have hungry kids avoid this establishment. Our order came later than tables that ordered after us and the kids order came out much later. Rule 1 of any resturant always serve kids first and ASAP. We also had a drink order which was ignored, then when we re-ordered we were again left with no action, it was not until the third request we finally got our drinks. Our wait staff and manager were less than responsive and the compensation for lack of service was unsatisfactory. Perhaps the style of the food is American Western, but the service is as bad as it gets. If the owners are interested in creating an American experience then follow the cardinal rules, customers expect exceptional service not excuses for poor delivery.

The Lone Star features everything "American Western" from the photos of Willy, Cash and Waylen on the walls to Elvis and Cash bopping through the speakers on the wall. By refurbishing the Bush Inn Hotel, the Lone Star acquired a ton of spaces that makes this the perfect spot for your next group event. The food is quality, but may take some time to be delivered to your table, depending on the time of day and the size of the crowd. Spend some time checking out the artwork if you're not in a hurry, this is a definitely a step back into the true Wild West and the beginning of classic country as we know it.

Very high standard restaurant with cozy and discrete booths, really helpful staff and jazzy music.
The food is delicious ! I had a Fish & Chips and it was crispy and tender with gurnard fish. Exquisite ! My partner had the ribs and they smelt so good !!!
A really nice restaurant that we love, we will be back again !

Forever and always the best food in Christchurch! The lamb makes me drool  
I've made great friends overseas after bonding and realising we both loved Dimitris! You've got global recognition as being the best, and I'm yet to find any souvlaki that's half as good!

Food was ok. But the way, (the owner apparently) spoke to her staff was absolutely disgusting. We used to go here once a week. We will never go back
Shame.

Nobody beats Dimitris, best souvlaki I've had and probably ever will have. Highly recommended.
Delicious every time.

Perhaps the best Souvlaki I've had. Tender and delicious bite sized, tender, juicy, chunks of lamb, cushioned in warm, thick and soft pita and a tangy white sauce.

Delicious.
Quick food, but large portions and very well-made. The chicken was grilled perfectly!

Dimitri Food Truck ,
Very good souvlaki,I personally love the classic lamb one.Its situated in the container mall downtown Chch.The atmosphere is really cool there,the are lots of other food trucks.

Best food truck in town. Permanently based in the container mall. Great souvlakis, I recommend the lamb with kalamata olives. If your in the central city and looking for a light lunch you could do a lot worse.

Dimetris is a Christchurch institution, friendly service and fantastic food. But when it comes to Souvlaki there is none better than the triple lamb with extra feta. I'm so happy that they have finally move into their shop on Riccarton Road .
Solid spot for lunch. Service is friendly and quick. The portion is big for the price and it is quality. I liked the lamb. Really tasty spot I Definetly would check it out

The best restaurant in or around the container mall.  The servings are huge and the food is amazing.  You have to try the lamb/beef combo!  It is a little messy and greasy so grab some napkins and don't wear your Sunday best.

Dimitris Greek Food is a Christchurch Classic that has been in the CBD for years, their most common lunch is a thick bread souvlaki, served ready to eat with your fingers and a fork.
It's not quite like a rolled pita pocket (say from pita pit), but a Greek version of, with a much thicker bread rolled into a cone shape to hold the ingredients.

Suggest getting the standard sauces, which include a garlic yoghurt tatziki and a Greek tomato based sauce. Together with a juicy meat of your choice (chicken, lamb, beef, or mixed) and salad it's a very tasty lunch indeed.

A single is $10, double $12.50, and triple $15.50.

There can be quite a queue, but these guys are efficient and quick to have it in your hands in no time.

Hit up Monster Chicken last night. We had no reservation but snagged a table.  The place quickly filled up soon after we arrived. Having lived in Korea for 6 years and visiting many a Chicken Hof I know what good Chicken is, but didn't really expect t it to stand up to the real deal.  Got the Monster Platter, Aracini Kimchi balls and a serving of chicken tenders.  Cost was just over $90 for three people.   This was no Korean Chicken hof , but still enjoyed it. The place needed cold kegs of cass and 1 litre steins to make it really special

Such slow service ( 40 minutes) then food very average. Over cooked greasy chips. Salad was lettuce mix with tomato drowned in balsamic, teriyaki wings nice. Classic chicken had an odd taste like the oil was odd.

Had the garlic chicken and the soy ginger chicken. It wasn't good. The chicken was soggy and super fatty. The sauces were basically the same except one had pickled ginger the other had garlic chips and cloves. This restaurant really needs to learn how to fry chicken so that it is crispy!
The salad dressing was tasty but they put so much on there it was over whelming!

Back to back fried chicken reviews to start 2019.. I think we can agree fried chicken is great, and when it's Korean style well damn Jackie! But if we're talking best it wasn't quite there.

It's a smallish place but still has about 8 - 10 tables. Dark interior. My favorite part of the decor was the trip advisor awards they had all over their restaurant walls. There were I think 4. And they only had a 4.2, so they really were proud of that low 4. And I love that they maybe thought that would be the deciding factor for someone to eat there. "Well I'm not sure if I want anything but I'm already here in the restaurant. man... That 4.2 on trip advisor really sold me. I'll stay!"

Ok anyways.. Chicken was pretty good. A bit dry. They put sauces on top so the chicken soaks it up if you don't eat quick. But a nice addition. You can choose from like 8 flavors. Photo will be listed. I tried Sweet Chili. Just enough kick to make it taste good. They also have a chili bang bang flavor which is about as hot as you wound expect. Sampled it and I felt like I was shot in the mouth. Pun intended. $18nzd for a portion. The portion size is really big too, enough for 2 people easily.

They serve alcohol too fyi. Something about fried chicken and beer drives Koreans crazy. I dig it too. 

Next time I think I'll carry out. And try a new flavor. But I'm no hurry.

Freshest salmon I have ever encountered. The dumplings (we had chicken) were good as well. Best of all, the service is so wonderful: staff were kind and helpful and made us feel so welcome. Highly recommend for a meal or quick snack :)
This restaurant offers some of the best sushi and sashimi I have ever eaten. They serve the freshest salmon ever.

This is a vegetarian's perspective. Went in craving some hot soup or curry, but we were told that all their curries, even the vegetarian options, come with shrimp paste. To me shrimp paste is not vegetarian, so curry was not an option for us. So we ordered pad thai instead, along with pad puk, a vegetable stir fry in vegan sauce. Instead of a side of rice, I ordered roti for the stir fry, but the roti was way too oily; after the first bite I couldn't have any more of it. The pad thai was good, and the stir fry was good as well. Too bad they didn't have any soups or curries that could be made vegan, since that's what we were craving in the first place. The place is quite cozy with small tables for two, and service was good.

Tucked neatly between the colourful buildings of New Regent Street, this small restaurant owns a rather apt name. The interior was fairly dark, but cozy. My companion and I ordered a lunch menu curry each (mine costing $15), additional options being red meats, chicken, or vegetables, we asked if we could substitute prawns instead. They did provide our seafood alternative, however did not mention any additional fees. I ordered a Panang Curry, it was quite rich but still tasty and satisfying. The prawns however hadn't been correctly prepared, some still with scales. I ordered a beverage with my meal which was listed at $8.
When I paid, I requested a receipt. I was charged an additional $2 for my curry, and was charged $9 for my drink. I couldn't help but mention the extra charge for my curry, as the person who served me did not care to bring it up when I ordered. I was refunded the additional fee, and refunded the extra paid for the beverage. 
Overall, the food was good enough, and the service had issues but managed to make up for them.

We ate dinner there, I had lamb shank massaman, with a side of rice, my wife had shrimp pad Thai. I would rate my Massaman 3/5, the pad Thai had an off taste like stale peanuts. Service was friendly and prompt., 4/5. 0verall food below average, service above average.

We ate here for dinner one night after we couldn't get a table at Francesca's around the corner.  The restaurant was quaint, quiet and intimate.  I liked how it was decorated.  We were seated by the front window.  Our table was very small, just barely big enough for the two of us.  We both had the Pad Thai, and we both liked it.
