Pad Thai is my wife's go-to dish at Thai restaurants and we agreed that theirs was above average.  Overall, we had a good experience here and I would eat here again.
A really nice place, quality food and even better staff. The manager is lovely and makes a great coffee.

Excellent little cafe the in middle of New Regent Street. Varied menu, good coffee and friendly staff. My meal was out in no time! Highly recommend the fish and chips. It's a very small space with a number of tables outside. 
No wifi though :(

Had a wonderful meal here . We had the tagliatelle in seafood sauce , fried calamari and the Tiramisu for dessert.
We were visiting Christchurch would recommend this restaurant. Would recommend making reservations we had to wait inspite of reservations this place is busy Thursday nights too .
Lovely little Italian triattoria.  We were in Italy last year and the food here reminds us of what we had in Italy.  Molto Bene!!

A bustling little spot with solid food! We went during peak dinner hours on a Tuesday, so street parking was a bit tight and we ended up having to park down a side street and walk a bit, but not too much of a problem. We didn't have a reservation so we were seated at a counter and then later moved to a table. 

The highlight was definitely the tiramisu --delicious and served with a little scoop of gelato as well. The penne carbonara was also cooked well and tasty. The cannelloni was decent but really packed with spinach --could've used a bit more of the cheese mixed in to balance out the flavor. The burrata appetizer was not my favorite as the inside of the cheese was not very soft and runny. 

The service was decent throughout and the prices were about what I would expect for the area.
Food service very slow. It was explained to me as I ordered an entree you have to wait extra long for your main. Food didn't have a very authentic Italian taste. Won't be going back.

We visited on a Monday night and the restaurant was packed! Smelled great as soon as we walked in. I ordered the spaghetti Roberto (spicy Italian sausage, chicken meatballs, and red sauce) and my boyfriend ordered the beef cheek gnocchi. Both were delicious, probably one of the best meals we ate during our two week trip around the South Island.  Service was relatively quick as well. It was so good that we ordered the pizza bread appetizer after our meal. Highly recommend to anyone visiting Christchurch!

We requested a table for 20 - were seated in three sets of 6/7, 30 minutes late

One waiter (with glasses) was rude and condescending towards guests upon requesting menu alterations. Then continued to act in a rude, unenthused and to be honest, a can't be f***ed attitude.

Then finally upon requesting a take away box, the waiter returned and poked me with the box.. grow up mate.

Tutto Bene is located in a suburb of Christchurch called Merivale. We searched the neighbourhood and found only pubs and one expensive restaurant. At Tutto Bene we were greeted warmly. The menu is typical Italian (more than adequate for us) as well as lamb, beef and fish. The food was delicious and presented elegantly. Service was superb. Ambiance 5 out of 5. Affordable prices. Their BYO policy contributed to a very nice evening.

Waited 55 minutes for my mains to be served. Other tables that came and ordered after my table had been served and left. I feel very disappointed. Made a booking for 7.45pm. Only ended up getting our meals at 8.30 or so. Would probably never go back there.

This used to be our go to Italian restaurant in ChCh. Unfortunately the meal service left a lot to be desired. The service was not good. Drinks service was slow. People did not arrive together and people were left waiting forever for drinks service. There were 9 at the table, food was ordered including starters. Only 1 garlic bread was delivered, 1 was missing. After reminding the server that 2 breads had been ordered the 2nd was delivered at the same time as 2 of the mains. Where are the rest of the mains? We start eating the 2 mains then woops! Those meals were meant for another table. The meals were taken away and we were promised 2 fresh meals would come out with this rest of the mains. The meals came out but the 2 meals were returned same as they departed. The tail of a prawn that had been eaten was still on the plate, and the scallops had not been reinstated. What a disaster.
Fun, busy Italian place. Nice outdoor patio. Attentive owner was helpful and accommodating. Great selection of pizzas. Nice pastas with local seafood as well.

Wanted a quick but great meal and definitely delivered. We had veal, fish and venison. We were impressed! The meals were rich, tasteful and unique. The NZ Chardonnay were definitely worth the $$$. We decided to buy as the corkage was $10.50 per person which was a bit rich.

We were traveling thru Christchurch for 2 days, and on our first evening in town, we discovered Tutto Bene. We had never been before, and it was fantastic. I had the pasta special, which was "homemade fettuccine verde with braised octopus in a chilli, garlic and tomato sauce."  The noodles were excellent and the flavor in the sauce was incredible. You could tell that all of it was homemade from someone who knew what they were doing. The octopus paired well with the sauce; it was like they were meant to be together. If I ever pass thru Christchurch again, I would visit this spot again. 

We didn't get the pizza, but we saw some at the tables around us and they looked amazing too.

Tutto is not Bene, unfortunately. I was here with my wife for Christmas Day dinner. Our shrimp appetizer was okay but overcooked. My wife had rack of lamb as main and it was overcooked. Nothing on my venison dish was properly cooked. Meatballs, venison horribly overcooked. Beans on the side - undercooked. Tiramisu was great, fortunately! 

If you want to come here it might be best to stock to pasta and pizza and not feel too adventurous.

What can I say,all I heard was good things about this restaurant so I decided to try it.
The first thing is the place,I loved it,it really looked like an Italian trattoria,it also has a great atmosphere.
The food was very bad,hubby and I had a pasta  arrabiata and a it was very bad,it was extremely over cooked.
I had a pizza Margerita,which did not taste of anything.It was very bland.

I would arguably say this is the best pizza joint in all of Christchurch. The place is always hopping come dinner time, so I definitely recommend a booking. In the summer months they have "dining al Fresco" in their back courtyard. Though it is tucked under umbrellas and right along a little creek, it is patio seating in a parking lot by dumpsters. Not totally my thing. However, the rest of the restaurant has plenty of seating for groups or intimate date settings as well as casual tables up front. 

The pizza is FANTASTIC. The Cantadina, Margherita, Pollo Pesto and Quattro Formaggi are among my favorites. Di Carne and Umbria are my partner's. He prefers bold flavors like black olives and meat while I am after the cheese and basil. My dad has ordered the traditional spaghetti (bolognese) and our whole family had to dig in and eat some of it. The Della Casa salad is a great salad to split to add some more greens to the meal. The waiters will gladly help you pair a great wine with your meal if you ask.

The service is efficient as they need to keep the tables turning over and if you call for takeaway, as I do frequently, the order will be ready in 20 minutes. Though the price is a bit steep for a pizza, you have to remember that you're paying for the best (and the cost of overhead in Merivale). This is a great date night spot or a great place to order takeaway for your family on a weekday night. The food is quality every single time and made with love, the true Italian way.

I've eaten here a number of times. It can be busy and noisy but the food is always good. Serving sizes are generous. I particularly like the Funghi Ripieni (appetiser) and the salmon pizza. The menu is varied and extensive and you are sure to find something that appeals.  
Service can be a little hit and miss when the place is crowded. A booking is strongly recommended. There is good wine list but they do BYO as well so be sure to hit up the Fresh Choice across the road at Merivale Mall which has a decent wine selection.

This was a great little spot for our Christmas Eve in Christchurch. The wines and meals were wonderfully. I had a salmon chowder and lamb shanks for dinner. Both were made deliciously. 

Service was great as well.

I have been looking for slow cooked lamb shank for several days and now I found it. Very tender as should be expected from a slow braise. The blueberries in the lemon posset pudding dessert tasted awful as if dehydrated. Service ok but could use some polish

Whilst the ambiance was excellent the oysters were fresh and delicious.
The mussels were overcooked and the calamari was as well looked like it was fried in stale oil. A disappointing experience in Queenstown .

It's an interesting name for a restaurant since 'Fisherman's Wharf' brings ideas of a water-place community where fisherman come in from the sea with the freshest products from the sea.  There might be a variety of seafood restaurants at a fisherman's wharf, but the singularity of naming a restaurant that, confused me for a bit.  But I realized it was a single restaurant, located between the cruise port of Lyttelton and its town center.  It did have a variety of seafood, and much of it was excellent.

We didn't have a reservation, but were seated right away.  There are choices of both outdoor and indoor dining, and the back outdoor patio was available (though it filled up by the time we left).  It had a great view of the port, with the ship that we came in on, prominently visible on the skyline.  A bottle of tap water was provided so we could fill our own glass...the water is very good here. 

Dozen Bluff oysters:  6 of them raw, 6 battered and fried. NZ$72
We came for the Bluff oysters, which are currently in season.  It was the first time I had them, and they were superb, unlike other oysters I've had.  They are decent in size, but the difference is the texture, meaty instead of slippery.  It's not as briny as other oysters, and didn't come with any vinegar but instead a shareable green salad.  They are big enough to deep fry, which were fine.  But the best way is to eat them raw, to appreciate the taste and texture.

Fresh NZ Green lipped mussels. NZ$25.5 - probably 8 large full shell mussels, swimming in a light creamy tomato broth.   Frozen NZ half shelf mussels are available around the world, being very meaty.  These tasted similar, but were quite a bit larger in size which added to enjoyment.  This dish would be excellent served on top of fresh pasta.

Seafood Sizzle Plate (NZ$46.5) - portrayed as their most popular dish, it combines a variety of popular shellfish, served on a sizzling plate.  All the seafood was good.

Fisherman's Seafood Chowder (NZ$30.5) - a volute (basic french white sauce, no cream but uses butter) based soup, full of quality seafood.   This was the dish I thought I wouldn't be able to help finish, but ended up being the one where I ate the most of.  It came with a very good garlic bread, great to dip in the soup.

Blue Cod Fish Fry (NZ$40) - a large beer battered filet of cod, served with good chips (fries). 

They had four beers on tap, so got a pint (NZ$14) of Montheiths Golden Lager, which was a good beer to drink with the seafood. 

Service was prompt and friendly throughout, and the food didn't take very long to come out.  Of course, the beautiful weather and nice seaside views certainly didn't hurt the vibe.  It was a really nice lunch.

Fisherman's Wharf in Christchurch is out on Lyttelton Harbor but we made the trek anyway. It was rainy and chilly the day we went so I opted for a hearty meal, the seafood chowder. It was rich and creamy and was complemented perfectly by crisp fries with aioli. Add the stunning bay views, and this spot was a good pick. Everyone enjoyed their meal despite the gloomy weather.

It was busy, and seemed unexpectedly so.  
It opened before noon, but only one person was serving multiple tables.  Anna did a great job.  Workers came in at noon.  I do think servers need to be dressed better. 
The food was good.  Very fresh.  I did not like the dressing in the salad.  Too sweet. 
The sr key date pudding and Kahula coffee are to die for!   
Overall the food and service is worth the stop.
Great daily special of salmon risotto was outstanding. I would highly recommend this restaurant. Great view and outstanding service.

The biggest downside of this place was the wait, from order to food was 40-50 minutes. I was hoping the taste of the food would redeem the waiting time but it was pretty plain. I ordered the chowder and fisherman's pie. The chowder had an awesome variety of seafood and came out promptly but the pie left something to be desired. The seafood was fresh but lacked the flavor depth I was hoping for.
Because there is ample seating but most customers stop in for coffe-on-the-go, this cafe is the perfect place for tea, elevensies, and a quiet conversation or work hour. Pleasant staff.
Great service, lovely atmosphere, AMAZING fresh food, and very kind staff. I love this restaurant! Many vegan / vegetarian options. Best vegan place in town :)

What a wonderful place for vegan food with plenty of gluten-free options. The wait staff are so friendly and welcoming. Due to the earthquake in Christchurch, their location is a bit off the beaten path but well worth the effort to get there.

Ten stars if I could!! Awesome venue, friendly staff and the food was incredible!!! Generous portion sizes, well priced and soooo tasty!! Beautiful building as well. Four of us went, we all loved our dishes. Would live off their food if I could @sophiewelco

This is a truly beautiful find! Not only a restaurant but a music store and unique gift shop. I really enjoyed the nori roll and soup of the day. They make their own kombucha and raw desserts from scratch. Just an enjoyable experience all the way around.

A Vegan/Vegetarian heaven and a great place all together. The dishes are simply wonderful and rich, the decor and service are impeccable. It's all good, really.
Very welcoming to any other dietary needs.
Best place by far @ Christchurch.
The best restaurant in South Island for Indian Vegetarian food. I wouldn't dare to try any other restaurants for Indian food.

I almost want to cry when I enter The Lotus Heart in Christchurch. Why? Well,a couple of reasons but the main one is how to choose from such an awesome menu. Everything is made with love and the finest of ingredients in the spotless kitchen. I did struggle with not ordering the curry dosa -  again. This time I had the dhal which comes in vegetarian or vegan options. I had the vege option. The Lotus Heart makes the best dhal ever. Simmered to perfection. They make their own kombucha and kefir on the premises as well. Afterwards I could not go past a slice of raw chocolate cake. Best raw desserts I've had. There is a terrific atmosphere in the restaurant and if you want to guarantee you leave somewhere with a smile, eat there. Afterwards you can wander into their music shop and bang a drum or two.

Five star service, food, decor, the lot! We had lunch here recently with a large group, our friends booked ahead and the staff created a beautifully decorated table with so much colour and attention to detail I complimented it twice!

The service was prompt, friendly and understanding. And the food? - Amazing! I had a rice pancake (dosa?), with curry;  doesn't sound like much I know, but it was very large and very, very tasty. Full of flavour and served with 2 type's of relish. 

They offer a range of unique and equally amazing smoothies, I had a coconut kefir smoothie that I would gladly drink daily if I had the means. I tried 2 other's that friend's ordered which were equally delicious, unique and healthy.

The place is decorated and designed with opulence - a gallery in itself. Plus, they have a music store, book shop, gift shop and produce for purchase.

Hand's down the best restuarant I have been to when visiting Christchurch on several occasions over the past few years.

If you are wanting the MOST DIVINE experience then this is the place to eat. What joy and delight this whole building is. The food has been prepared with such care and precision and looks so amazing it is hard to believe it comes from quite a small kitchen. The entire atmosphere is wonderful, the staff very professional and you just want to order everything off the menu which is why people just keep going back day after day. The research and time spent in getting each dish just right goes on behind the scenes and certainly shows in their presentation. Coming here is like entering a wonderful world of sheer bliss. Run by the Sri Chinmoy meditation centre, this restaurant certainly deserves high class credit for all their work they have put into their beautiful building, the small shops hiding away that bring dazzle and fun to the whole experience. Such well earnt beauty, may they succeed for many more years to come and leave such lasting memories to those who visit.

I can't believe how long it took me to come to this place. Having a number of food allergies and preferring to eat paleo, I saw on their website they had a selection of raw, vegetarian, gluten free and onion free foods. I thought it'd be worth a try. I took my sister and my boyfriend with me, both big meat eaters and my man is never keen for vegetarian food. It took us ages to order because there were so many options. Even I wasn't sure whether to try the superfood smoothie or the dosa with curry. I went with the dosa. It was so delicious. My sister had the nacho's and my man had the burger with vegenut pattie, he really loved it! We finished off with a raw cheesecake - yum! I loved it so much I took my niece and mum back a week later. I would recommend this place to everyone. Not only is the food great but you're surrounded by a great sense of calm as soon as you walk through the doors.

The food is okay -  very American "Taco Tuesday" style meals as opposed to TexMex or Mexican cuisine. Its a good value if you are in a rush. Having said that - this places is heaps better than the fancy Mexican place I ate at on the waterfront at St. Heliers Bay.

Do they have Chipotle in New Zealand?  I don't remember seeing any, so this might be the closest thing.  Not too far from the Christchurch airport and just what I wanted after a long day (or more?) of travel: chicken, rice, veggies, and some heat.

Tasty and good quality Fresh-Mex at a good price.  They even have those Yucatecan pink onions.  More legit than a lot of what you might find in California.
Fresh Mexican food here. Very close to the airport and Antarctic center. regular Mexican fate of burritos and tacos tasted fresh and good. Recommended

Great Find!  I am down from Texas and this is some great TexMex food.  I had the Jalapeño Chicken Quesadilla and it was outstanding. The Chicken meat is seasoned well and the garlic and lime help make this multi layer flavor. You can get the same in a Burrito (something I will try in the next couple days). All very fresh!

TL - Dallas, Tx
The food is insanely good. The nachos were superb and huge for 2 people. The lamb tacos were very good. A little dry on the lamb though. But very favorable. They still deserve 5 star rating.

We were visiting and this place is so cute and right along the river bank. Good vibes, music playing, nice ambiance. It was fairly busy around 5pm on a weekday but thankfully no wait. We ordered just apps but was happy with everything we got. Nachos were truly loaded, and the kabobs weren't dry at all. Definitely a cute place to try out!

I really enjoyed my dinner at Chiwahwah Mexican Cantina.

I was lucky to get a table without a booking, even for just a party of one.  So I recommend making a booking if you plan on dining here.

I ordered the roasted cauliflower, that came with a romesco sauce, a fish taco, and one of their sangrias.  Everything was delicious!  I love roasted cauliflower and theirs definitely ticks all the boxes.  It was perfectly charred on the outside and soft on the inside.  The romesco sauce was bright flavors from the acidity of the tomato, which paired well with the smokiness of the cauliflower.

The fish taco was good too!  It wasn't greasy despite it being fried. It came with capers, which I don't actually like, but in this taco it was yummy and needed with the fish.  The sangria was comprised of rosé, mint, and strawberries.  It was light and fruity.

Service was excellent!  The staff made sure I was doing fine throughout my meal.  The atmosphere is vibrant and loud.

Chiwahwah's seems to be more of a fusion restaurant, but I don't think they advertised themselves as a traditional Mexican restaurant anyway.  If you want good food with Mexican-inspired flavors, definitely check them out.

Had dinner here the day before leaving to return home from our holiday in New Zealand.  Got to a table quickly but it was excruciatingly slow the rest of the night.  Server forgot drink orders and we had to remind her several times before they were brought to us.  The establishment is on the louder side when it comes to voices from nearby tables and the music playing through their sound system. Their only saving grace was the food.  It was great.  It was definitely not Mexican though.  I would categorize it more as a fusion between New Zealand and Mexican, so Kiwi-Mexican.  Although the food tasted great it is a little misleading to brand themselves as a Mexican Cantina.  Would recommend giving it a try and take a gamble on the possibility of getting better service.
Food is good. A place for dating and family. And the waitresses and the owner are super nice to me.

We sat near the front window in the corner so we had area where it was not so loud. The main area I could see where it could get noisy. The service was spot on amazing which paired well with dinner. I would definitely go back here. 
I had the Fettuccine with smoked chicken and mushrooms which was delicious, my husband had the lasagna and was good, plenty of sauce and not dry.
Enjoy!

Wow. Yum. Allow a bit of time as everything seems to be prepared fresh. The pastas and sauces are not just sitting in pots in the back ready to be served. You can watch them prepare the meals as ordered and it is DEFINITELY worth the short wait. Lovely place, atmosphere is Nice but also family friendly; fancy but not overpriced. I would come here with a group or on a date, this places caters to all customers. I am going to make a point to come back here for dinner.
user_address: Nob Hill Alphabet District, Portland, OR

text: We were visiting in town for just a few days and were tired after a long day of exploring. We wanted to eat somewhere with a nice atmosphere and fresh ingredients - Valentino delivered! We walked in and the waitress was very nice; the polenta fries and wine was exactly what we needed! The pastas were flavorful but my mom loved the lamb. If you need to take a break and appreciate the Italian ambiance, the food here is perfect for you.

The staff was very nice and the atmosphere was pretty neat; food just left us feeling meh. My daughter just wanted noodles with butter and Parmesan and I think they must've thought she wanted that on top of her spaghetti because she got normal spaghetti with parm on top. We are assuming they added butter too and melted it in. Strange. 

I ordered spaghetti bolognese and I got a bowl of sauce with a few noodles. My daughter honestly got double the noodles I received. I was done in about 5 bites. Very disappointed. 

I also got the Kiwi Summer drink - it's quite different - if you're not used to feijoa I wouldn't order it - I think it's an acquired taste.

This is an favourite of my and my partner for good reason. The food is always excellent and hasn't let us down yet, the service is always prompt and well timed. There is just no enough I can say to explain why we always go back

Fantastic place.  The atmosphere is good, comfortable.  I had the ravioli of the day (happened to be pumpkin with chorizo) which was simply amazing.  My wife had the Mediterranean salad and felt the same.  I could go on for  a couple of paragraphs about each, but suffice it to say that both dishes were amazing.  We have some very good Italian restaurants in our area in the States, but after tasting from each other's plates we agreed that this was better than any we could remember.

Our waitress Kate was absolutely charming. She made us feel very welcome, was helpful with questions about the menu, and was great to chat with.  We felt right at home.

We liked the place so much that we made a reservation for the Friday we'll be arriving back in Christchurch.

Our only regret is that we didn't save room for dessert.  Next time!

We had our first dinner in New Zealand at Cafe Valentino, recommended by our Cottage host. It was a nice restaurant! Very good environment, very good service and very delicious food! We ordered a lamb shank, a veal and an entry size mussels. The lamb was tender and juicy, veal was deep fried I think and it was tasted. Mussels should be a must have dish! There are 14 mussels in an entry size dish, enough for 2 girls to share. The tomato sauce balanced the taste of seafood and they were mixed well. Will recommend to other friends who come to Christchurch!

It's a really quaint place that gets very popular on weekends. The place takes reservations, so make sure to book well in advance so that you don't have to wait. Walking in, the hostess was very polite and accommodated us for exactly where we wanted to sit. The wine, you need to figure out for yourself. The beer, I'd say you can't go wrong with the Three Boys craft brew. I loved the lamb shanks and my friend had the pizza which he finished entirely (make what you will of that). The fish was very soft and delicious but it did not take up any flavoring, rather it tasted like the fish itself. I ate too much for dessert, so maybe next time I can tell you about that.
Mains are very disappointing. Particularly the veal, salmon, and duck. Sent the duck back as was terrible. Pizzas ok.

A classic Mexican food truck (caravan really). Fast and delicious, it's everything it looks like it should be. I had the chicken Burrito with added guacamole and it brought me right back to the Mission in San Fran or my favourite Burrito places in Dublin. At $10 a burrito it's pretty good value too.

I think I might know why they've got a burger named the Bastard here. I might have called it a few names myself due to its propensity to slide apart. But what would one expect from a bacon cheeseburger that adds pineapple, avocado and beetroot to its content? Aside from the cheese, every topping and condiment on that sandwich is slippery. The combination isn't one I'd experienced before, but I found it all well matched. And I was surprised to find all that content didn't overwhelm the flavor of the beef (though not by much).

I might give even greater props, though, to the fries. Remember the perfect crispness of McDonald's fries when they were at their best? Take that fry quality but apply it to a chunkier, thicker cut of potato, and that's what you'll get at BurgerFuel. Delicious. 

I enjoyed this meal after some lengthy travels, and the restaurant is positioned well for air and road travelers, being just off State Highway 1 and only a short distance from CHC.

Getting back to the sloppiness, it was only in the finishing bites of my meal that I realized the staff had provided me with a tool to help keep my burger together -- the nifty little Doofer, a pop-together burger keeper that my ignorance kept me from testing when I needed it most. Guess I'll have to stop in again and see how well it actually works.

Big portions and a pretty good burger, however the portion was a bit to big for my liking, and I've got to be honest, it's a bit spendy for a burger joint. I would recommend at least checking it out once!

Was absolutely hanging for a burger on this night, so ended up giving it a bash due to the wide variety of burgers available. 

Front counter staff were nice & delivered the burgers to our table. The wait time for our meal was a little bit slow, however the flavour of the burger quickly let me forget about the delay. 

The burgers are a little but pricey which I believe may turn a few customers away - especially international travellers. I honestly believe that they were get a higher turnover if they bought down the prices a little to stimulate higher patronage. 

But the burgers were great. Plenty of flavour. Nice and juicy and would most likely return if I was in the area again.

Best burger place, hands down! 
If you are a vegetarian or vegan and you like burgers-- you must go here. It's delicious!

Their slogan says it all ... Sit long, Talk much, Laugh often ... what a delightfully relaxed place this is. I dropped in and enjoyed lunch here. It wasn't very busy but I was intrigued by the fabulous collection of china cups and other pieces. My lunch was fine (poached eggs, salad and cheese) but the atmosphere wins the day. There's no sense of hurry here. People come in and enjoy a leisurely visit. I hadn't planned to stay long, but I did. It was so enjoyable. Coffee is good. There's parking at the rear too. Thank you.

This gorgoeus little vintage Cafe serves freshly baked cakes and scones, breakfasts etc but it's the surroundings that make it special.  You are surrounded by vintage china and artefacts, some for sale, as you sit and enjoy a good coffee or tea. Friendly, helpful staff, well worth a visit.

We came on a busy Saturday evening - the staff very kindly opened 15 minutes early for us as we came from a marriage ceremony. We all went for the surprise 5 course menu which was great. Everything was very fresh (especially scallops and gropher fish), and tasty. The better French food I have ever tried, that's for sure. The dessert was the star, poached pear, blue cheese ice cream and red wine reduction. Amazing!!!!!! Not too sweet, and just a little pungent from the cheesy ice cream. My one frustration was that our wine was constantly filled up, and we felt compelled to drink more than we usually would. I ended up with 6 drinks poured - I would usually only have 3 so felt unwell after - but didn't want to waste good French wine. Please ask your customers before refilling. Other than that, it was a great experience.

This is one of my most favourite "special" restaurants in Christchurch. The staff are knowledgable and attentive without being annoying,the ambience is perfect, and the food makes for a wonderfully memorable experience. I can recommend the wine matching degustation menu which was stunning.

Came here with a friend one night just because I had been craving some french food. I found the restaurant difficult to find and managed to drive past it twice! In all fairness though, that may just be my own poor sense of direction. Park in the hotel right next door. 
This is a very elegant restaurant with a classic and restrained decor. Tables are beautifully laid out with white tablecloths and the chairs are comfortable but of a solid quality (my favourite type). We went on a random wednesday night so it was fairly quiet. Service was excellent - a french waiter which certainly adds to the ambience!

As for food, I was a little disappointed. Maybe my expectations were to high. I ordered the escargot (entree) and the cassoulet (main). Both were good but didn't wow me. The duck in the cassoulet was actually a little dry. My friend picked much better than me and next time I would probably order what she had. She had the foie gras for entree and the steak for main and both were absolutely excellent. Perfectly cooked, lovely well balanced flavours. 
Dessert was delicious, I can never go past a perfectly cooked chocolate fondant. 
Good wine menu, and served in nice big glasses which I like. 

Next time I would probably choose the surprise menu, the only reason I didn't this time is that I had a major craving for some cassoulet and some escargot and didn't want to take the risk that they might not be included! 

Price wise this is at the top end of the scale for Christchurch but food and ambience are of a high quality. That said $90 each for a three course meal and a glass of wine is not unreasonable. 

Bottom line: great for a fancy date night, or just randomly treating yourself (like we chose to do!)

Never thought I would find so much foreign food in New Zealand. I don't really know what I was expecting. I guess I assumed it would be burgers, fish and chips, seafood and lamb. With the occasional Chinese restaurant sprinkled in. Because they're in every country. But Thai? From New Zealand? And pretty much the entire crew are Kiwis?? No fruit isn't running this restaurant that's what they call themselves here. This place though.. It was good. Really good!

The inside has an upscale look but you don't need to dress classy to eat here. They don't overdo the fact that they are an Asian restaurant. You know how some places can be.. Oooh let's put a tiger in that corner, and oh a Buddha in that corner, maybe a temple print wallpaper.. No no. This place keeps it simple. 

Staff was great. They don't work for tips in New Zealand but still cared about me just as much.

Let's talk food!! The menu runs deep. Like 50 numbers deep. We ordered 3 items. 38-Black Pepper Stir Fry, 20-Pad Thai, 12-Tom Kar which is a soup. Everything had such great flavor. Lots of meat in our dishes to. 3 items and it was plenty for 3 of us. And they make sure to label the menu to let you know what is spicy, and extra spicy. So no surprises here!

Oh they also have a small section for Vietnamese food. Shutout to my Viet friends. But.. We didn't order any of that.

5 stars for great food and service!

We stopped here for lunch on a day trip to Christchurch. The staff were very friendly and polite, and the food was delicious. We got the fresh spring rolls (reasonably good; like a salad in a spring roll wrap), the green curry with tofu (excellent), and the spicy noodles with tofu (also delicious). Lunch prices were very reasonable. So glad we stopped here!

Had a recommendation to come here from our air bnb host and boy it didn't disappoint. 
The satay is amazing! The laksa has vegetables in it - odd but nice enough.
They forgot our pork balls, then we reminded them, they brought them out but still it wasn't great... they were very plain balls with a sweet pineapple sauce... 
The pepper beef was nice but I would've enjoyed it more if it had more pepper. 
Overall though, this place is nice. Service is great - they check how the meal is going etc and cater to ANY allergies. 
Go there - you won't regret it.

We were lucky to get a last minute same day reservation for Kinji.  Small, unassuming restaurant.  Friendly service.  Incredible food.  Sashimi was very fresh.  Umeshu was refreshing after a long day of driving.  We left very happy.

Service was stellar at this establishment. Everyone was very friendly and helpful and made our visit very enjoyable. Based on atmosphere and service I'd give this place 5 stars.

Based on food I'd say 3-4 stars. We ordered a salmon avocado roll which was delicious and I recommend ordering. I also ordered udon which was good but I don't fancy shiitake mushrooms which made the broth less desirable. The noodles are thinner than normal and the portion is pretty small so I'd recommend complimenting it with a roll. The fried tuna roll was my least favorite order because it was hard to chew and mostly rice. My favorite was the kfc chicken. It was hot, moist, and crispy and all it needed was a little salt. 

Overall, I thought this place was satisfying and enjoyed my experience here. If you're looking for excellent service, decent sushi, and decent prices I'd have a seat.

Visited Kinji with my partner and absolutely loved it. For a little restaurant it was really busy. The service was spot on and checked on us often. And the food, delicious I. We ordered the 10 piece nigiri set, deep fried soft shelled crab, octopus and venison tataki. We were satisfied with every dish. Highly recommend to anyone looking for top grade Japanese food in Christchurch.

Not sure if people in New Zealand are able to fully enjoy sushi at it's best due to lack of locations but this place was just ok.  The sashimi is actually great but the rolls are awfully made.  There is a lot of rice and very little fish in the rolls.  They did not offer much variety in rolls and when we asked for a spicy tuna roll, which is fairly common, we had to tell them what was in it.  If you are really in the mood for sushi, I would stick with mostly sashimi in this place, but if you're leaving in a few days for a trip to Australia, just wait out the cravings.

I came here with three friends on a recent saturday night. They get very busy so I recommend booking well in advance. 
Decor is nice and understated, didn't stand out particularly. What you are here for is the food which is amazing. 
We ordered a lot of food with the plan to place it in the middle and share it, allowing us to sample a good range. Our waitress seemed a bit shocked by how much we ordered and actually advised us to order less but we plowed ahead (in retrospect she was probably right..) Food comes out fresh as it is prepared and as such is always hot and perfectly cooked. It was all timed perfectly so that as one plate was finished, the next one was coming out. 
We started with edamame which is a classic we all enjoy. Highly recommend the deep fried takoyaki (octopus ball) which was incredible. I'd never had them before and we ordered it on the recommendation of my asian companions but would definitely get it again. The spider rolls (soft shell crab sushi) were another standout. Amazing taste and presentation. For mains the particular highlights were the K.F.C (we ordered a second plate of this), and the specials menu and sizzling dishes are well worth a look. The only dish we didn't enjoy was the eggplant gratin. 
We finished this meal extremely full and contented. Didn't look at the desert menu. 

Service is good and attentive but our waitress did forget to bring us any water during our meal. It can be expensive if you order a lot of dishes but well worth it for a special night out. I think we spent about $80 each, without alcoholic drinks included. 

Bottom line: for interesting, unique, and delicious Japanese food in Christchurch this is the place to come.

Best sushi I had a New Zealand. Very fresh and good quality product. Unfortunately we didn't have a reservation but manage to have take away. It was great! Highly recommend if you are in town and would like to try best sushi New Zealand has to offer. The Tuna sashimi just melt in your mouth!

First time visiting New Zealand -and walked a few blocks to get this in the cold.  No line and about a 10 minutes or less wait for the food.  The place is like a food truck with picnic tables to sit, which is probably used more during the day and not at night because it is freezing at night.  The chicken pad Thai was so good!   So glad that I decided to venture out to get take out.
Delicious meals and good price! We ordered Panang Curry and Pad See Ew noodles. No complaints about either one. Would definitely return again.

Stopped in Christchurch for a couple of days before my return flight back to the states and was told to check Thai Container out. Had the veggie spring rolls and Panang Curry and it did not disappoint! The spring rolls were really fresh and I loved the basil they added in. The Panang was sweet and creamy just as it should be. Service was quick and I had my food within minutes. If I am ever in Christchurch I will plan on stopping here again!
I'm so in love with this place ..it's maybe because of my passion for Thai but anyway as a takeaway it's on a high level and it od necessary at least to taste once

A pretty popular takeaway place but food is far from authentic Thai. To be fair, being 1/3 Thai, I might have too high expectations when it comes to Thai food. The phad tai were pretty bland in taste and nothing like the dish. Tom yum ghong soup lacked the authenticity and was just overly tasty with msg. Satay chicken skewers, though not exactly Thai, was surprisingly good. The Larb salad was OK but to be fair its a pretty process nased salad to get right. Overall the experience of buying from a container kitchen outweighs the actual food.
Great curries, the fresh spring rolls are good too, affordable. Just a shame the seating is outdoors in winter!
Good Thai food at the container mall. Had the Tom yum and egg noodles. Excellent flavor and quality. Yum!

It was just okay... The veggie stir fry wasn't bad, the tofu sweet & sour needs help! It's like cooked tofu with sauce that was frozen mixed into it! I'm sorry don't leave your spring rolls sitting on counter not refrigerated and try and sell them to me.... Ugh!!!

The meal we had last night was some of the very best Thai food I've ever had. The lamb in the masa man curry was so tender and delicious- I highly recommend this dish! Pad Thai also perfect - not too sweet just like I like it. 4 of us had 4 dishes which came to under $60. We all felt this was great value for the amount of food and the high quality of it. Thanks for a wonderful meal!

This place gets five stars not because it is the best Thai food in the world (it is good but not great) or because of service (it is basically a stationary food truck so how good can the service be?) or because of the beauty of the location (it is on a fairly busy street in what can only be described as the "motel district" of Christchurch). No, the 5 stars are for a combination of price/value efficiency and intangibles. There is something about Thai container that is really appealing. I went there three times in almost as many days and thought about going even more. The food is good. They thought I had an Australian accent, which is hilarious (I am an american) and like all Thai restaurants in the world, as far as I can tell, they seemed worried about me trying anything too spicy. The spicy noodles are not that spicy, but hey are good, as was everything else I tried.

Excellent food, lovely atmosphere but no COFFEE.  Grrrrr.
Been here many times and they  say machine not working?
Could you please get me a coffee from next door. No.
Disappointing if you want a nice lunch and coffee.
Food is top rate

Amaterrace is a Japanese teppan or hibachi in the heart of the bustling city of Christchurch, we had trouble finding the exact location since it was on the second floor of Oxford terrace or simply called "The Terrace".

All dining guests are seated facing around the master chef, we found it enjoyable and had an intimate conversation while eating even with company of strangers, we both decided to order the Amaterrace special which is NZ 49$ that included an appetizer, soup, 5 hibachi entrees and dessert.

We started off with cold bottle of sake, miso soup and has started making stir fried mix veggies, he then followed it with tiger prawns glazed with butter, Akaroa salmon with scallops, teppanyaki fried rice together with NZ premium eye fillet served with garlic mushrooms and marinated grilled chicken, we found it overwhelming but managed to finish all the dishes as they were cooked and served right before our very eyes. We then capped our dinner with a delicious ice cream with chocolate syrup.

I considered our dining experience here as one of our best dinners while vacationing in New Zealand,
The customer service was awesome, dishes were served in timely fashion in this pristine restaurant with a view. This place is a must try when in Christchurch city Centre!
Great spot for lunch. Had a nice selection of menu items. We had the Panang curry and pad Thai, each for $12.

Excellent, classic Thai.  Good lunch options! My friends and I had the yellow and panang curry and sizzling beef platters. The beef was really tender and the curries were sliced well. Great friendly service!  It was close to our hotel across from a casino. Good central location in Christchurch.

Worst service I've ever had. The food was amazing, but our waitress never came to us and we had to ask to be served. Then we filled our own water up and they didn't give us one of our meals. The server then left for over 10 min and we couldn't ask where are food was. If it weren't for the shitty service this place would get 5 stars because the food was very tasty. If you don't care about bad service I would recommend
The meal was pretty good but the flavors could have been more intense.  My favorite was the spinach leaf Thai salad bite.  The service was friendly, but it took a while to get our wine.

Hidden local gem, we passed by the bar and decided to have a drink to kill time while waiting for the other restaurant's reservation. We ordered a beer and an appetizer.  After we tried the appetizer, we cancelled the other high-end restaurant's reservation and decided to stay in this restaurant to have dinner. The food really impressed us and they served the food so fast (very important as starving tourist) so we visited this place twice within 2 weeks (in each visit of Christchurch, based on our itinerary of traveling in South Island) 
Great food, great service, spacious dining area. (also tax included, no tips)
This place should have more reviews! (or maybe yelp is not popular in NZ?) 
Must try the shakling beef (slowly cooked beef cheek)!

We arrived on the train on Christmas was delayed & it was 8pm by the time we checked in. Not many places were open & we stumbled in to what turned out to be a great authentic Thai restaurant. The slow cooked beef rib was simply fabulous!

Meal was delicious but unfortunately we had a set menu for a reserved early seating for a large group. Food for the price was expensive and sparse for the total number seated at our tables also rushed through so fast that people ordering desserts had to eat at the bar.Would not recommend for a big group.

We recently went to this restaurant with a group of friends, had a great night, we thought the food would be too spicy for our American friend, but it wasnt and she liked it. Every one had a wonderful time, had kababs, rices, rotis, Chicken curry (the best), Doogh - this reminded me of sour buttermilk my mom used to make. It was great!

Pros:
Great food in great quantity, price - reasonable, good staff, clean place, fantastic location.

Cons:
Heating - we had to put our jackets throughout the dinner.
Fantastic!  Great location and the date Scones  were exceptional. Love how it is right next to the river. Highly recommended

This place was so good we kept coming back! Staff was efficient, kind, and accommodating. If you're in the area and don't know what to do about breakfast/brunch, immediately stop pondering and come here! The food is SO delicious. I had their shakshuka (without meat), chillis scrambled eggs with lemon ricotta, which was such a unique and delicious blend of flavors, and their green smoothie. All were super tasty and I thought the prices were reasonable. Their plating is also top-notch and the interior is super cute and instagramable. Went here 3 times and never regretted it!

Just passing through Christchurch and found this gem. Delicious food and great service. We shared the porridge and eggs Benedict they call Little Benny. Both were excellent. I was worried the chipotle hollandaise might be too spicy but it was perfect. You won't regret eating here.
Outstanding breakfast for such a small out of the way place.  Put it on your list when traveling to Christchurch.

Tasty brunch. I went solo so only took about 15m to get a table. The grilled halloumi is salty, delicious and accompanied by great veggies. A little pricey and service is on the slower side but had a great time.

We went to Little Pom's as part of our brekkie from the B&B next door and what a delight it was from fresh flowers on the table to the bright and airy space and the open kitchen to watch the chefs prepare your breakfast. The eggs done perfectly and coffee brewed hot was just what we needed to start our day. Servers were friendly and as we were from out of country they spent some extra time giving us some history of Christchurch and things to do and see. Loved it!

I had high hopes after hearing recommendations from friends. The service was slow, the kitchen had run out of the ingredients for the haloumi dish, and my coffee order was lukewarm. Nevertheless, there's plenty of parking on site and Pomeroys is next door if beer is more your thing

A place where you eat upstairs and with a very limited view of the street. Simple room with cheap posters on the wall. Nice waiter but he seemed to be doing everything as there was no other staff around.  Meal took a while to turn up and only one dish at a time. 
Has a wide selection of Chinese meals listed on the shop front. Regular Chinese dishes available plus unusual such as stir fried sea cucumber. Some items are only written in Chinese! 
I ordered the fried combination noodles which did not look like the picture (lacked vegetables), was cold and some of the chicken was raw, so I did not eat the meal ( photo available), I shared others meals of the sizzling beef and beef noodles which were ok. Entrees $5 to $22. Meals mostly $22.
Good selection of regular alcohol.  Fresh juices only available in litre jugs. Ok selection of fizzy drinks. Take away menu available.
Free WiFi. Toilet just outside the restaurant is available on request of key on a string.
Overall just a place to go if you are hungry.

When I'm in New Zealand I love to go to Chongs. It's right across the street from my hotel and the food is excellent. I get the Diced Chicken and Peanuts - sans the peanuts! The skewers are great and so are the dumplings. Totally worth it.

It's decent if you are craving Chinese food. Not necessarily a place I would recommend for eating in Christchurch. We ordered the veggie fried rice and the stirfried eggplant and subbed the potato for tofu. We also got the potstickers. My aunt said the potstickers were just OK - the dumpling wrappers was way too thick. I thought they fried rice is actually very good. It had that wok/stirfried flavor that is so delicious. We did send back the vegetable dish because it was made with tofu that was tasting a little off. We brought it to the attention of the waitress and she promptly had it remade and provided her apologies. Service was good, and they have free Wi-Fi there as well. I wouldn't say this is the best Chinese food ever but it worked and satisfied my aunt's cravings.
Honestly the place is very simple decorated. We ordered lunch special mixed veg and fried rice. Very greasy and small potion. Won't go twice. Soup was OK....
The lamb is definitely over priced and not traditional at all, 18 NZ dollar, not recommended. Shrimp sashimi is 28 NZ dollar per shrimp, not live shrimp. Serving slow.

Cheap and convenient Chinese food in Christchurch.

It was late Sunday evening (close to 9 PM), and the Japanese restaurant Sakimoto was closed. My boyfriend was on the hunt for roast duck, but the nearby Thai restaurant, Sampan House Restaurant, didn't have great reviews. We set our eyes on Chong's, which was located very close to our hotel and had an expansive takeaway menu that included smoked duck, $24 for half, $46 for whole. We also got a small bowl of sour and spicy soup ($5 for small, $18 for large) and a small portion of steamed white rice ($2). The waitress quoted us 10-15 minutes, so we took a short walk around (the rather desolate) town before coming back to grab our food. The duck was pre-packaged in a vacuum-sealed bag (valid until Feb 5, 2018, so more than 2 weeks from today) and lukewarmly heated. Flavor wasn't bad, though it was too salty for my taste, so make sure you get some carbs to pair with the duck. The sour and spicy soup was indeed sour and mildly spicy, just like any ol' sweet and sour soup.

Overall, not a bad choice for Chinese food that won't break your wallet.

Excellent pizza and arugula salad.  Service was fast. Nice location. 
Enjoyed our lunch in Christchurch.

The cocktails, the appetizers/starters and the Italian fare are outstanding.  I have visited this corner restaurant right on the River Avon in beautiful Christchurch 3 or 4 times.  My last visit Christmas week of 2024, I was very hungry and ordered the steak. I was not thrilled at how it was cooked or all the sauce they pour on it. Next time I'll ask for well-done and no sauces.  But service, location, atmosphere and most everything else is worth a visit. It won't disappoint!

Starters were great service was great! However the mains were terrible.

The Pork in the Carbonara and Caesar salad were both horrible cubed over salted and seemingly from a can. The croutons in the salad were crazy large dry and hard. I don't understand how a restaurant thinks cubed pork is a valid substitute for guanciale in a carbonara.

Does it get any better?
Beautiful and authentic Italian food in a size I, for once, couldn't finish.

We stopped in on a Wednesday night, quite late and they were able to take our last minute booking before the kitchen closed.

Fluffy gnocchi in a tomato and Basil sauce scattered with Parmesan.

Tender slices of veal on seasonal vegetables

Rolled pork loin, the star of the night.  A truly giant but very tender and tasty piece.

The staff were friendly and efficient and quite lovely with our group of five.

The atmosphere is cozy and family friendly but quite large.

Fabulous race of wind of wine and spirits.

Even if you just want to pop in and out, call for a a booking and try Casa Nostro, I know I'm going back.

This restaurant was highly enjoyable but the price to taste ratio was simply not balanced. A small average bowl of fries was definitely not worth $10. But the taste was great and recommend the pizzas. Also filling portion sizes which is always a bonus!
Best burritos and tacos in NZ. I have never been disappointed with the service and food. Fine dining without the price tag. If only I still lived in chch but I go whenever I'm back.

The elusive Mamacita's food truck must be found! I had their $5 tacos at the A&P Show and they were amazing. I tried the pulled pork taco with their achiote garlic tequila sauce. They also offer chicken, beef, steak, chorizo & potatoes, burritos and nachos. Definitely the best tacos in the city, but I cannot find the food truck during the week days. Their hours are very infrequent and, sadly, most of the days Mamacita's is actually not operating. Use their website: http://www.mamacitas.co.nz/find.html to see where and when they'll be open to try and catch them, because if you can, it's totally worth it!

This place is a hidden treasure! It's located in the airport business park so you could easily miss it!!!
Great... Did I say great? food!!!!! Very friendly and efficient staff. The restaurant is well laid out and inviting. 
A memorable time to be sure!
Great casual spot in the central city for a Bibimbap fix. Fast affordable menu with friendly faces.

We chose this restaurant as it was recommended and we were craving Asian towards the end of our NZ trip. It seems promising as the waiter attending to us was Korean. However, they weren't particularly friendly, and seemed curt at times. But the restaurant is very spacious and great for groups. 

Banchan in comparison to what I am used to is sorely lacking. The dishes we ordered were not bad, but I have had better versions in other Korean restaurants, even all the way in Lake Tekapo. 

Another thing I found a bit surprising was this restaurant serving both Japanese and Korean cuisine when the two are quite distinctively different. We did not try any Japanese food though so this review is based solely on the Korean dishes we had.
I had bibimbob and my hubby got spicy seafood soup. Both dishes were delicious!  The restaurant was very clean and spacious. I want to try other dishes next time.

Great Korean food in Christchurch!

We got the spicy squid which was perfectly spicy and the lamb BBQ because that seemed like the appropriately New Zealand thing to do. The lamb flavor pairs surprisingly well with the Korean BBQ flavors, I would've never thought.

We we're excited to see a Korean restaurant recommended by Lonely Planet so we decided to try this place out. First off, it seems like a happening place because it's open 24 hours and they allow you to BYO drinks so everyone was walking in with bottles of beer and wine!

I noticed that all the wait staff was Korean so perhaps my expectations were a bit high.  We ordered the lamb BBQ (since this is something I've never had at a Korean restaurant), the soon tofu soup, and the beef wraps.

The lamb BBQ was the best thing we had, it had pretty good flavor.  Unfortunately, the soon tofu soup was a disappointment, it was spicy but watery at the same time.  Beef wraps were essentially bulgogi wrapped in rice paper.  The banchan (side dishes) were a bit lackluster.

I was glad to try a Korean restaurant in New Zealand, but unfortunately, my mum's Korean cooking is better.  :)

Had dinner which was reasonably priced with a good blend of Japanese and korean. Despite two other large parties we didn't have to wait long for our meals. Host was incredibly friendly and polite. Good atmosphere and would go again.

Great little place.  Has a nice lunch menu and is reasonably priced. 
Staff are also very helpful and inviting.

Interesting that this place is called Pier Side Cafe. It is beside the Brighton Pier, but it isn't really a cafe. It's more a pub/bar that does coffee and meals. The bar dominates the eating area, along with a pool table and juke box. There's 1980's rock music playing and most people come in for a drink. There's an outdoor area too. Having said that though, I enjoyed my omelette for lunch. It was served "pub style" on a board with a salad and wedges (which I omitted). All in all it was fine.

A fine cafe, nothing major to note. I'm just here to address the lack of bins in the toilet, weird right? Please add a change table for babies at toddlers, you have a great high chair service. A change table and bins would make this a fantastic cafes for young families.

One of the best egg Benedict's I've ever had. Taste very distinct and I choose pulled pork and it paired very well. Great coffee and the smoothies are very good. Went with a mango passion fruit smoothie

Dose is certainty my favorite cafe at the moment. Great coffee and service and the Eggs Benedict on home made Rosemary hash browns is the best in town. They have a nice selection of counter food along with bread and pastries from their own bakery.
Great food, great coffee, great yard in the sun at the back, excellent service. My chosen regular lunch venue.

LOVE Dose and visit often. Their new location is going through some growing pains, but their coffee is the best we've had in Chch and their brunch items are quite delish (would recommend eggs Benedict and salmon bagel).  Only thing lacking is free wifi which we feel is a must-have for café atmospheres
Awesome coffee, food and service. Highly recommended.

Velvet burger is a good burger place with a decent menu. I ordered the luxe bird which had good flavor and a bit of a spicy kick. My table also ordered the fried pickle chips, which might've been the best part of the meal. Overall, everyone enjoyed their burgers and were happy with their orders.

Great generously sized and delicious burgers, with tons of chips in various sizes as well as a nice selection of beers. Awesome place. I found the guys there really friendly and helpful - just stumbled on the place after landing in Christchurch with terrible jet lag.

It's not the fault of the burger itself. All wrong is the staff. When I entered, three of them were in the kitchen being not that friendly. One male staff came over to speak to me. I am a foreigner visiting here could hardly understand what he said especially he spoke so fast. He spoke to me with food in his mouth, and the more terrible thing is that he almost "forced" me to order chips even drink, apologised to me after I asked if the price for the big  bro concludes the chips(absolutely not) but the way he speaks is "do you like skinnies or fatties".. well this meal is the first meal I have in Christchurch after I landed. Perhaps I got this experience just because I am Chinese.
There was lots of food near Westfield.The crew was friendly and helpful. The homegrown burger was yummy and the vegetables were fresh.

I'm not a big fan of burgers, but my friends from Dunedin were ecstatic when this opened up in Christchurch! I love their deals from their Facebook and their burgers are yummy. They have cool combinations and they have a couple different meat options like chicken, beef and I believe there might be lamb, venison and vegetarian as well. (Depending on location and specials I believe). I always end up getting a burger here when I'm in Christchurch.

Avoiding Asian food due to visiting there the next week, I found this restaurant within walking distance of my hotel. Inside was cozy, as the fireplace was decorated for Christmas. How pretty! 

I told the waitress to "bring me something sweet and white," for a wine, and that she did. There are two sizes of wine offered (see lines on your glass), and I chose the smaller one. I was brought riesling (see photo), which was light, sweet, and had a clean finish. It was just what I wanted! 

I give 3 stars because of the spaghetti carbonara. It was quite oily, and the balance of pasta vs the mushrooms and bacon was not correct. My bowl was still 1/3 full of the other stuff even though I'd finished the pasta. Furthermore, the top layer of parmesan melted and hardened, to the point of being inedible. If you're Italian, you may want to ask for no cheese on top since this isn't done in Italy (at least where I was in Rome, Florence, etc).

I also ordered the side of salad greens. I wasn't told it came with dressing or what kind (normally don't eat dressing), so I was surprised to see a brown gravy-like substance on top. It turned out to be a balsamic vinegar based dressing, but be sure to specify if you're particular about dressing. 

I wouldn't mind coming here again but also wouldn't mind skipping this place next time. My whole meal cost $42, including the wine. On to the next!

We had a very good experience enjoying the food, atmosphere and service equally.  The staff was welcoming, friendly and provided excellent and timely service with a smile. The food, from starter thru main dish, was well prepared, quite tasty and nicely presented. Will recommend.
Good selection of Sauvignon Blancs. Enjoyed two choices. Bluff oysters were on special when I was there, and these were also good. Lots of menus options to choose from.

Got off train in Christchurch at just after 7pm, Saturday evening.  This place had high reviews on Trip Advisor. 
We were not impressed. The service eh, we have had better. Trust me we have eaten at quite a few places since we have been traveling. We ate outside and the manager couldn't get the heater to work so no heat. The Long Island Ice Tea didn't do the trick either!! I mean so people get heated up when drinking. It didn't happen for me at all. We were served our food and the waitstaff person did not even check on us. We had to chase her down for our dinner tab. My husband had the spaghetti and I had the ribs.

Trevinos is a great place for a night out or dinner. 
Despite the wonky floor that makes you feel like you've had a few too many. The atmosphere is brilliant especially on a Friday or Saturday night. The menu has an excellent variety of dishes with daily specials too. 
Gambas al ajillio.(Spanish style Gallic shrimp) for starter, a personal favourite of mine, took me back to Spain it was exquisite. The beef cheeks for main were cooked to perfection. Everyone at are table couldn't fault the food. Service was also excellent extremely attentive some might think too much so but enjoyed it. Wine menu could have been better but that's my only complaint and not a big one.

Came for a drink with a friend and then got tempted by the dessert menu. Was a decision I was happy with as their sticky date pudding with caramel sauce is Delicious! We both agreed our next dinner out will be here as everyone's meals around us looked amazing

Very cool spot, great fixed price lunch on Saturday. Lovely ambiance, friendly staff, attentive service. Delicious oysters appetizer, monkfish burger and salad, pair with a tasty white wine. Finished with a Campari Parfait. A real gem. Don't miss out!
I came back for dinner. WOW!!!
One the two best restaurants in the city.
...extraordinary culinary delight...what a supreme surprise this small gem was just steps away from the Mayfair Hotel...

We only learned of the restaurant because we had a tour of Christchurch and our guide was familiar with it.  After visiting, I had to add it to Yelp.  It can be very difficult to accommodate a gluten-free-vegan for a digestive menu, but they did.  We each had a tasting menu that suited us, a vegan-gluten-free, a vegetarian and one with seafood. I also recommend the wine pairing as they have a very unique collection.

A five star cheap eat. I found it on a cheap eats list - read the reviews and decided to visit after a long day on the road. Service was super quick (though we were one of two tables on a Monday night and close to closing time) and they over-delivered on flavour. 

The chef wasn't just going through the motions, he was lovingly preparing our order. Attention to detail and care were evident. 

I've had top notch Vietnamese and paid top $ for it. It was next level. This by contrast is humble food done brilliantly.

I would totally recommend it.

What's not to love about this coffeeshop? Fantastic coffee, nice selection of food, friendly staff, and a great view of Lyttelton port. Well worth the drive from Christchurch for a casual breakfast.

I ordered a flat white and a savory corn muffin, which was a surprisingly filling but delicious little pastry for breakfast. If you're eating outside, just watch out for any seagulls eyeing your food. They don't bother you, but will certainly swoop in if you step away. Also note that there are no takeout coffee cups here, so be sure to bring your own for takeaway.

Funky cafe with a hip alternative vibe. Clearly a popular spot with the locals as the busiest cafe in town. 
Good food at the counter and the meals heading out looked good too. 
Ordered a skim milk latte and a decaf- told they had neither skim milk or decaf. No apology or explanation that they had run out. The way it was said made me think they never do, by choice. If that's the case, next time I might choose not to go there.

Some of the best coffee and breakfast in Christchurch. 

DJs and cool musical vibe on weekends I believe. 

Can't recommend enough. 

Staff and patrons are uniquely Lyttleton  

As an aging tired old hippie I don't understand what's happened to "progressive liberals" these days, but that's a conversation I must have with one pink-haired stranger at a time. Sigh. 

I digress!  

You can't go wrong, give this place a try when you're in the neighborhood.
Great stay and great food. Ordered the eggs bacon and gluten free toast. They must have drizzled basil olive oil on the toast, delicious. Great atmosphere, cool building.
Wonderful spot with outdoor area. Awesome local staff serving good food and house roasted coffee.
Simply an incredible spot for a coffee, bite to eat, and gaze out the window at the beautiful harbour. Even more of a treat in winter when the fire is going. A family favourite!

Nice setting, but very poor service. For the number of people working, they couldn't take orders efficiently, the food was slow coming out, and the staff looked vacant.
Would not go back.

Very cool cafe in the heart of Lyttleton. Great coffee, quick service, serves breakfast until 2.30pm. Good range of breakfast options, plus baked goods and sandwiches. Quick and friendly service, we'd return if we were locals!

Really good coffee, a big selection of healthy-style cabinet food, and a decent and well-executed menu of the usual cafe offerings. 

Great atmosphere in the converted warehouse, with plenty of exposed brick and sturdy girders. 

Spectacular view over the port. Good music, a tad loud while we were there.

What a great local coffee shop/cafe where lumber sexual barista your beans and grinds. Amazing case of muffins and savories. Your bacon and orange yoke eggs are as free range as the staff. The full breaky will hold you for a 1/2 day. Get something from the case for "take away." Cash only
Didn't expect much from such a simple place but the food was unreal! The pricing is very generous, so cannot complain! If you love Japanese, this place is a must go.

I think this a a Japanese ramen chain. They sell frozen ramen packages in the restaurant. The noodles were a bit too soft and the broth was both a bit salty and scarce. It's decent enough to scratch your ramen itch but it's not special enough to make a dedicated visit.
Great place for a weekday lunch but just as good for dinner - many a meal had at the Samurai and never fails to deliver! Very fast delivery after ordering is a plus
Delicious. Cheap. Consistent. They scream your order over  their shoulder in Japanese. Spicy miso ramen is a must.... and dont forget to add an egg.
A load of ramen and rice dishes not typically seen in expensive Japanese restaurants.    Chow down!

Maybe coming from Auckland where there's an array of Ramen, Samurai Bowl didn't seem to impress me that much. It was super packed on the night we went and you have to order at the counter. Meaning there's a really long queue of people right through the middle of the already tightly packed restaurant.

The food itself wasn't bad. But wasn't mind-blowing. And the prices, I suppose, are reasonable.
Really good pizza's, great environment to hang out and eat some really good food.... Craig Owen

Bad service! In fact NO service! We waited over 20 minutes for someone to take our order but were ignored by all wait staff. We left!
Don't waste your time or money!
Went here for a late dinner. The service was good and the pizzas were amazing. We also had a Greek salad to share. Highly recommend.

This is a great spot to gather with friends and family. This space is large, the atmosphere is loud and the pizza is de-licious! I definitely recommend a booking, especially if you plan to eat around dinner time on a Friday. There is covered outdoor seating, a more "intimate" seating area (2-4 tops) off of the bar and large family style seating in the main dining room. The service is quick, the staff is helpful and friendly. We ordered a half and half pizza: The Italian and the Chicken, brie and cranberry (a Winnie Bagoes favorite). Seriously, that was the best pizza I have had in Christchurch! It even tastes great as leftovers. We also tried the jalapeno bites which was basically a fried ball filled with a chipotle mayo/jalapeno mix. It's pretty hot, my mouth was definitely sweating, but their sauce on the plate and a beer helps to ease the burn. Cheap prices, great food, definitely worth a repeat visit!

Great place for a beer and pizza.
The pizza are among the best in Christchurch and the venue is also rather nice with indoor and outdoor seating.

Tonight I ate at Winebagoes Christchurch. I must say I had a bad time. Bad enough to make me want to write a negative review. It took 30 minutes for 2 cokes to be delivered to the table despite the bar and wait staff standing around doing nothing. Once we ordered our food it took a further 45 minutes for the food to arrive, after it took them 30 minutes to tell us that they were out of fries. 
Once the food arrived it was excessively average, not something I would pay $33 dollars for again.
Will not be eating here again.

This restaurant is AMAZING!! Tried many different dishes, the takoyaki was the BEST I've ever tried, sushi was amazing, fast and friendly service too. It's just as well I don't live in Christchurch or I would spend all of my money here  will most definitely be back again!

I recently went here for a meal with my family.
The food was excellent, the plates had plenty of food on them.
Staff were friendly and very efficient.
The price for 7 adults was really great.
I can really recommend thus restaurant.

This is a very calm, nice South Asian restaurant. There's a good range of Thai, Vietnamese, Chinese, Malaysian and Burmese food. I had lunch here with friends. I enjoyed a Thai Tom-Sam Prawn Salad which was beautifully made, fresh and colourful. My companions had a Massuman and Vietnamese Stir Fried Noodles. Everything was lovely, so delicious and enjoyable. Service is respectful and very professional. Meals don't take long to come. I'd definitely come back, thank you.
Attempted to eat here but kitchen was closed 45 minutes before closing time. Looked really good but disappointing for sure.
Fresh handmade pasta and sauces. Visiting from USA and we had an excellent dinner. Service was helpful and cheerful. Chicken Rose Pasta was fabulous.
Probably the best pasta I've ever had. Handmade with locally sourced ingredients. Casual but chic ambience. Delicious wine and cold beer.
Fabulous Italian.  Home made pasta.  Our best meal in New Zealand. Behind some other restaurants in a container village so don't be put off if you don't see it from the street.
Brilliant staff and food! The oyster dish would be my all time favourite meal. Wonderful and posh ambience. Definitely a degistation venue you do not want to miss!

why why why?? i was SO close to giving a GLOWING review....and then their restaurant manager ruined the deal...to be covered in the service portion

ambiance//*****
the restaurant's ambiance is modernly upscale without pomp or circumstance
when you step through the quilted doors, the reception area's chandelier provides a hint of the glamour that awaits!
the coolest thing is the wall decor made of burnt zip ties.....who knew something so ordinary could be elevated exponentially??

service//**
the waitstaff, and especially hostess eiko was pleasant for the most part
halfway through, i discovered an EARWIG in my water O_O EWWWW!
the waiter took my glass away without an apology...and we had to ask for new glasses
it was extremely disconcerting...and my cousin was upset enough to mention it to eiko when she was taking care of our bill....she was equally horrified and apologized quickly moving to inform her manager

the manager merely said they would write a report so the entire staff would know....uh...WHAT?
they didn't even have the decency to comp us for our drinks...HOW RUDE

food//*****
there are 3 dining options...the 12 dish pre-fixe . 5 dish middle menu . or a la carte

we decided to go with the 5 dish and ordered each of the available choices...so we really had 10 dishes and a few extras like the amuse bouche kickoff

their dishes were delightfully plated and tasted exquisitely delicate...favourites of ours include the fried oyster . smoked eggplant . cured venison
with a name like pescatore, it's a given their seafood would be delightful....but their meats were also prepared with elegance
the 8 textures of white was the only disappoint, but the milk & honey was lovely
the paper thing dessert crisps were the lovely end
~*~
how i would have liked to recommend you highly....but all i can say is check your water!!
i know for years to come, pescatore will be remembered as our weird earwig experience.....can't say you didn't make it a memorable night

Good service decent prices, food is just okay.
We had Massaman curry beef
Pad Thai seafood (really fishy tasting... I mean really strong, and I like fish, and fish sauce. Usually.

Tom Kha soup (one of my favorites) was very bland.

Money Bags were good.

Others have given this place good reviews and it's probably worth another try.

After a two week long vacation in New Zealand, we had the good fortune to find this restaurant on our last night in New Zealand.  Excellent menu choices, very friendly staff, and good food!  My wife said it was the best meal she'd had in New Zealand.  We had walked about 2 miles from our hotel to get there, so when we finished dinner, we asked them to call a taxi for us...Five minutes later, the owner of the restaurant drove up and took us back to the hotel (couldn't have been more friendly).  Where else in the world do you get this type of service?  The restaurant is tucked back in a little strip mall, but do yourself a favor and take the time to look for it!
Prompt service, great food and BYO. Very friendly staff. Set menu was great. Good selection and very tasty. Also in the Entertainment book if you have one! Busy but great atmosphere.
Very good Thai food at reasonable prices. The sizzling hot plate meals are excellent, particularly the award winning Lamb. Worth a visit.

I like this place. It's a very nice cafe, with the added bonus of Keto offerings. The staff are professional, responsive and flexible to customers' needs. My companions and I enjoyed their Frittata, a Sandwich and an Omelette. On the day I visited, I had to take a business call in the midst of my lunch - the proprietor very helpfully took my meal and kept it warm while I was on my call. It was fabulous service. Coffee is good. I'll be back, thank you.

While on a recent stay in Christchurch, we asked our friends to suggest the best pizza they could think of. When they suggested Hells, we were intrigued. We ordered a few different pizzas to share. All of them great. Their thin crust is great and they are not shy on toppings. We appreciated that they had a lot of specialty vegetarian and vegan options to choose from. And we found the different levels of hell (spiciness) a fun twist. The pizzas were, in fact, spicy!
They've always delivered on the predicted time and also have never messed up on special requests notes for specific food items. Will always order from this place.
I think it is a great place to get pizza they degrees price but definitely not quality I really like the grimestone it is very delicious.

I love the whole concept of Hell's Pizza.They have great tasting pizza with a ton of options. The Hell theme is awesome and they really stay true to brand. This location used to be just around the corner from my flat and I used to splurge on it! Yum! When I'm back in NZ I'll definitely come back!

Use to go here weekly but service has diminished. Very disappointing experience tonight. Booked for 6 people, it took 75 minutes before our mains arrived and only because we chased them up. People who arrived later than us were served before our group etc. Poor service attention, no replenished water and a token apology. Very good food though. Fortunately there are plenty of good restaurants around Christchurch with great service so will go elsewhere from now on.

I have been to the Buddha six once,and it's not one of my favourite restaurants.In chch there are lots of Thai restaurants and most of them mediocre.The place is rather nicely decorated ,the service is o.k it's just the food does not taste like the food in Thailand.
I had Thai meatballs and hubby had green curry.
