As far as Thai food goes in Christchurch, this is among the best we've found. I definitely recommend a booking for the weekend (bookings can be made online or over the phone). Despite being located off busy Riccarton Road, Buddha Stix is tucked back in its own private lot and the massive Buddha head statue and greenery that greets you almost makes you forget you're in New Zealand. The restaurant has a modern feel with a very small bar/tall table seating area and a larger room with a mix of seating arrangements for large groups or intimate seating. We were seated along the wall where one side is booth seating and the other is a hard back chair. The room is bright with lots of windows, an ornate red mosaic and multi-colored patterned wall paper above the booth seats. The two-seater tables are small, so I am glad it wasn't cluttered with any decor or condiments. We were greeted immediately upon walking in the door and seated just as quickly. The service from drink orders to dinner orders was also just as efficient.

The menu is very intricate with options to please anyone. For starters we had the Spring Rolls (6 for $8.50) which came out quick, were crispy on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside. The rolls were served with two sauces: a sweet sauce and a soy based sauce. I highly recommend this. Not your bag, baby? They have plenty of other options from chicken wings and guri puffs to fried pork balls and marinated spare rib. If you're a soup person, you'll have plenty of options, we personally opted to stick with a main as we wanted to order dessert. The dinner menu is jam packed with your asian favorites from fried rice to noodle dishes, but what makes Buddha Stix stand out are its curry options and stir-fry/hot plate dishes. I ordered the Garlic Chicken on a hot plate which was chicken and various vegetables cooked in a wok with garlic (frankly, I could have been hit harder with the garlic as they say it's a "must" for garlic lovers). This dish was served with white rice and has great flavor.  My husband had the Fresh Chili and Basil stirfry which he devoured. If you're a spice lover, you can request that the chef add some more heat, which he will gladly do. The mains are big portions and would be perfect split for two dinners. We took half of each of our dinners as takeaway.

For dessert, you must save room for the chocolate brownie. It is a slightly larger than normal brownie cut in half diagonally and served with chocolate sauce, vanilla ice cream and lychee sauce. This is one of the best desserts I've had in a while - if you're in a chocolate mood, this is for you! Overall, the entire meal was under $80 (including two drinks, a beer and a glass of wine). What a deal! With food this good and prices this cheap, we will be back again and again.
Good variety of curries in a contemporary ambience, rather than the usual Indian restaurant decor cliches. Attentive and efficient staff.

Best curry in town hotter than a few Indians can eat they know how to please a kiwi that can handle tye heat

Great customer service 

Great atmosphere 
Smiles always there even when busy with a full dinner service

What you get here with your char kuey teow is pretty much the flavor you'd get at a Malaysian stall - great wok hei and pleasantly charred chewy noodles. What's missing is the extras - cockles, anyone? More than 2 shrimp, maybe? There were a few fish cakes tossed here and there.

A plate of tasty noodles is always satisfying, but it won't be a meal - you'll have to supplement.

Oh, and do say yes to his offer of spicy sauce.

Went to dinner with my boyfriend and the place didn't look so flash from the outside but when we went in, it had a great set up! Waiter was lovely and food was good and well priced. Recommend as a good spot to eat as a local

Four of us just had a great meal here.   All the dishes were good and were generous sizes.  The seafood pasta was ordered by two of us and we could have easily shared one.  There was so much seafood in it.  Really tasty.  One had a pizza that had a ton of meat on it and the other had the lamb gnocci which was also tasty.

We all enjoyed our meal.  Prices were reasonable.
We would go again for sure.

Good food. Had fried squid, fried chicken and poke bowl which was a lot of food for two. All delicious! Building says open until 1am on Fri but they started cleaning up at least an hour early like all the places in there.
This is a must go place! Awesome food with friendly staff. We went there 2 times during our 2 day stay at the town.

This is one of the most popular eateries in the Little High complex so be prepared to wait.  I  ordered a hot and spicy ramen - it was very good with delicious melt in your mouth roast pork belly, chewy al dente ramen and rich broth.  Unfortunately the broth was lukewarm which spoiled it.

Decent food, good beer.

We were actually aiming for another BBQ place for dinner, but this was on the way and we decided to be adventurous and give it a try.

I had the pulled pork plate, Mister S had the brisket burger, and we were intrigued by the spiced cauliflower so we shared it.

The pork was fine. A little fatty (to be expected with pork shoulder) and not quite as flavorful as I've had elsehwere. Comes with pickles, a creamy slaw, crisps, and a whole grain mustard sauce that was absolutely inedible. I don't know if it was off or whether that was how it was supposed to taste, but yikes. The spiced cauliflower (spiced, not spicy) was so interesting - lots of flavor from the spices juicy-tart pomegranate arils.

They have a kid's menu, but we figured our little guy would just eat off ours and we weren't wrong. (He's still in that phase where he loves something one day and won't touch it the next - a pain when you're spending good money on food!) Case in point, the macaroni and cheese. He usually eats his body weight in noodles, but barely touched the side we ordered to share. It tasted great, so don't trust his review! There was plenty of food in our own meals for us to share with him, too.

Lots of choices for drinks. I was trying to decide between two different choices and the server offered to bring me a sample of both so I could taste.  

Good service. Upstairs seating with some outside chairs, too. We ate early on a weekday and it wasn't very rowdy or noisy. Some larger tables upstairs were reserved, so they do take reservations.

Stunning architecture in the Art Gallery building. Contoured glass floods the cafe with light and gives great outlook. 

Good coffee and a delicious savoury muffin. Friendly staff. 

Would have been four stars but had to send coffee back as lipstick still on the cup from previous user.

Universo is a modern bar and grill, in a perfect city location. The property is spacious with clean chic decor, mingling perfectly alongside the Christchurch Art Gallery next door. Kind staff, excellent food quality and their signature fries make the experience unforgettable. The house cocktails are very unique and fresh, accommodating plenty of tastes. I will definitely eat at Universo in the future, as it's the perfect scene for day or night.

This is a lovely place to sit and enjoy the world passing by. Situated in the Christchurch Art Gallery it has a fabulous relaxed vibe and is a great, airy space. The atrium ceiling is particularly nice. I enjoyed a good coffee here in the cafe and the restaurant looks great too. Service is professional, quick and very good. I'll definitely be back. Thank you.

Beautiful room with a varied menu. We shared the Beast Board. If you're a meat lover, this is for you. This can easily feed 3 people -- pate on toast, grilled steak, wagyu patties, Yorkshire puddings with lamb, hand cut chops, pickles, coleslaw, and bread rolls. C4 coffee is perfect.

If you're interested in a great lunch for a good price, come here. 
Clean restaurant. Service is good. 
Food is very good!
Great Indian food, good staff and a wonderful service. It would be hard to find better in Christchurch.

Excellent Indian food in the strip mall by the airport. Seriously enjoyed lunch here. Got the vegetarian Thali and it was rich with flavor and ingredients tasted fresh. We got boomeranged back to Christchurch on our flight to McMurdo, so heading back for dinner tonight.

Eat here!  I tried the Onion Bhaji as a Starter, I was not sure what to expect and they were delicious!  It was like an onion potato pancake but better.  Portions for take away are great. It's a lovely place to dine in as well.  I eat here every time I come through Christchurch and I have never been disappointed.  If you enjoy Indian food and a good atmosphere this is your place.  There is usually a lunch special as well!
Great service, everyone was super friendly and helpful. Service is fast and coping and very great. The food taste was also so good.
Great food, great price! I've been once so far on my trip to Christchurch, and I have to go again before I leave. It's wonderful!

The food is terrible. I had a butter chicken and it did not taste anything like a butter chicken. 
I threw away most of the meal. I will certainly not be eating here again.

This place has undergone multiple change in management over the years. It's gotten much cleaner, more modern, but the food is not the same as it used to be. I remember the days of picking out metal bits from the Szechuan sticky chicken.

The place- spacious, mixture of 4 sweaters and large Chinese round table. Ample parking outside. 

The food- the main selling dishes are those that serve in a stone pot. Has a curry based flavor. You can pick your meat of preference. Very filling and not too spicy. Recommend not to order too many other dishes of you are getting this one. The Szechuan spicy chicken is juicer now, and not over powered with chili. I still preferred the old dry and spicy version but others in my table really enjoyed it.

Drinks- a wall full of Chinese liquor for you to choose from. Tea is free. 

Service- we came here on a Sunday lunch time. Was pretty quiet. The waitress was a little slow and uncertain of the menu. 

Overall I would probably still come here again during next trip to Christchurch. More for nostalgia.

My colleague and I dropped in the other night for a pizza and beer! It was the best pizza I have ever had - thin and crispy proper Italian style ( and freshly needed dough) cooked in a wood fire oven. It was so good I dropped in for brekky and enjoyed a fabulous cappuccino and an awesome wood fired brekky bagel. This is a gem located underneath the waves blue Deloittes building on the corner!

Drunk bouncer didn't let me and my friends in because he didn't like how one of us looked; it is a shameful image for the place to show.

"I get paid by the hour, not by the arse" - Drunk Bouncer

This is a bar, restaurant, night club with food so much better than expected.  Excellent ingredients, preparation, and portion sizes.  Had the salmon and capers fettuccine and the bangers and mash.  Both were excellent. Nice selection of beers.

A girl passed out, I'm a trained paramedic and I went up to the bouncer to offer my assistance to adjust her into a recovery position while he was on the phone and the bouncer says "It's time for you to leave" disregarding anything I have just said. I feel this is bullshit as it's a human life we're talking about. The Rockpool should check who their staff is actually. Utter bloody nonsense. Really disappointed with this place.
Lamb shank and fish and chips are sooooo yummy here! Our first meal in New Zealand! Awesome!

It's either Greek food is simply average Arabic food or I'm not a fan of Greek food.

We ordered all of our dishes from Souvlaki Platters section: we went with the falafel, chicken and lamb. All of these plates come with Greek salad, pita bread, four different sauces and your choice of side dish (rice, potatoes, or French fries)

The falafel was way below average. In the description they highlight it as crisp from the outside and moist from the inside, it was moist on both layers. Also felt very oily, should decrease the oil to get it to be crispy from the outside.

The chicken was good but then again I like this dish so it's hard not to satisfy me. The taste is very similar to "sheesh taowe" from a Lebanese restaurant. I would recommend ordering the chicken dish.

The lamb was just ok and again felt like "tikka" from a Lebanese restaurant so nothing special there.

Finally we got the baklava for dessert. The portion was big (we ordered the big size they also do have a mini if you want to taste) and it was good. Again I tasted mush better in Turkish restaurants.

Overall good restaurant if you want a middle eastern food in Christchurch.
Enjoyed a great dinner - had the calamari (good not spectacular), roast lamb (quite good) and roasted vegetables (fine).

This place has deteriorated so much compared to it original days. Food is bad and extra pricey, service is poor and beware they have the tendency to overcharge. So keep track of what you order. There are other good Yum Char places in Christchurch which costs less and treats customers a lot better. Will not go again and not recommended to anyone else.

Great food. Terrible service. 

Been here for eat in once and take away twice. Eat in was with a party of 20 and they sent one person to take our orders who seemed very fresh and slow. When dishes started coming out well before all orders had been taken I asked the manager if we could have our orders taken faster. She was pretty rude and said no because they're busy.

 The food is delicious but the  customer service is VERY poor. It's reasonably priced so in my opinion it's fine for take away but if you're trying to impress someone I wouldn't bring them here. I even watched the manager texting on her cell phone while customers waited to be seated. No friendly welcome. Just plain poor customer service. Shocking!
Awesome spot for a pita, dont wait for an hour in line at souvlaki, walk two blocks and come here
Chef was awesome and entertaining . The mixed grill meat plate was all grilled and very flavorful. Hummus , baklava and Turkish coffee delicious !

Saw this place online and gave it a shot.
I had the 'Mixed Chargrilled Platter' and a side of Pita. Was so good. You could tell that thought and care went into the preparation. Meat was perfectly cooked. Bread was perfect and warm. 

Being a one way street with not much in terms of advertising you could easily pass it by, but was a really good find.

Just ate there this evening. Four in our party.  Two entries brought out within a few minutes of each other. The other two entrees still had not arrived 20 minutes later. We asked one of the servers to check on them. She went in the kitchen, came out but did not return to our table.  Ten minutes later we asked another server to check. Clearly the order was lost. 5 minutes later one of the lost entrees appeared. 10 minutes later the final one arrived.  Absolutely terrible experience and the indifference on the parry of some of the staff was abhorrent. Would not recommend going there.

Benson Chinese Restaurant has been serving quality and delicious Chinese food for over 10 years. I was brought here by my cousins who have lived in Christchurch area for the last 9 years and have been coming to Benson's for that long. My aunt made a point to treat us to the spicy beef soft tofu stew as it is her favorite dish of the whole restaurant and that's a must try if you're down with spicy food. The fried tofu for the appetizer was really good as well. Definitely a must try if you are in Christchurch!
Great stop for a coffee and danish. The flat white looked fantastic and was very good. The danish was fresh and tasty too.
Loved this place. Staff was so welcoming and friendly. I had the French toast and my wife had the eggs Benedict. Both were really good. Excellent flat white as well.

Wow. What a great spot for breakfast. Best coffee in New Zealand. The latte and cappuccino were both beautiful and delicious. We also had the eggs Benedict which were also delicious. Try it out if you are in Christchurch and hungry for a delicious and reasonably priced breakfast. Just plain super good.

Wow! What a great breakfast with a very pleasant atmosphere. I got the Eggs Benedict with bacon. The eggs were cooked perfectly, the sauce was great and there was a generous helping of bacon - even by my Yankee standards. I was especially pleased with the large flat white. My wife got some great scrambled eggs with what she said was some awesome multigrain toast. The cost ($$1/2$) was about right for the quality and atmosphere. I gotta go back before we leave.
Great selection of pastries and blueberry pancakes were worth a return visit. Has booths - always a plus and outdoor sunny seating to catch the morning rays.
Good food. Had their curry chicken rice and wonton soup. Dining area is limited with the capacity of about 30pax.

Malaysian food in Queenstown? Yup. After a few weeks of eating burgers, lamb chops, and steak I wanted some non-white people food.  What a find. 

Shrimp noodle- Not bad but it looked amazing and only tasted ok. 
Chao kwei tewo- oh man. Perfect. Make sure to add their homemade hot sauce.  Very close to authentic. 
Hainan chicken-so so. Actually it was nothing like the real thing. 

So why the 4*?  Cause this place is one of the few gigs in town.  Plus the food is reasonably priced- $10 per dish. This was one of our best abs by far cheapest meals in NZ.   Go figure.

Food was really nice and very reasonably priced. Service was a little slow, chaotic at times, and some of the staff had little English. A part from that they were very friendly and helpful. The atmosphere was nice, and tastefully decorated while still retaining a traditional Thai look. Good selection of foods and a easy to understand Spice Scale (see pic). Definitely would go again.
Fantastic. It is undiscovered. It is worth coming into the centre city for the cuisine.

I was pleasantly surprised at how affordable this place is despite located at a touristy place at the top of the Christchurch gondola. Most of the lunch menus were $18.50. Despite this, it was delicious and would match restaurants in downtown. We ordered the seafood platter for 2. The serving was plenty for two people and it comes with some salad greens despite not being listed in the menu. A table beside us ordered fish and chips and that also came with some salad greens. They also commented on how affordable the food was. 

The restaurant also had self-serve glass of water on the far right of the counter, which was a very nice gesture for those who don't want to order coffee or tea to go with their food.

At the Red Rock Cafe, I found surprisingly good food at the top of the Christchurch Gondola.  There was good variety to the menu, and very good flavor to the dishes.  (I was surprised by the quality as I expected the more bland food often found at locations where tourists have basically no other options.)  It was pricey for lunch -- checking the boxes of both tourist spot and in New Zealand -- but really enjoyable.  The staff was friendly and efficient.  While you eat, there are pretty views through the windows that wrap around you on three sides.

To be fair, I ordered this delivered but even reheated, the pizza was average. Not a lot of flavor and the crust was a little thick. I got the half buffalo half beast.

However, I do recommend the unholy donut. Unholy indeed - full of chocolate and salted caramel, and covered with cinnamon sugar. Very good.
Yum. Pizzas look small but filling and v tasty! Quick service and good deal with pizza and drink $15!

What an unexpected treat! We wanted to eat in after a day of a lot of walking in Christchurch, so decided on pizza. Found Hell on Yelp -- it's a FIND. We had the Camembert and cranberry pizza and the Savior pizza (chicken, avocado, portobello mushrooms, almonds, slaw and more) plus two salads -- it was a taste treat. Hell is a take out place -- just a counter where you could eat, but mostly it's used by people waiting for their pizzas. The staff are -- like all of the Kiwis we've met --  super friendly.

This was fantastic. We'd been walking by all week and we just had to go to "Hell" before we left Christchurch. 

I got a "Pandemonium" chicken pizza with cranberry sauce and Camembert- it was amazing. I'd never had pizza like it. My husband got a meat pizza with bbq sauce that was also great. The crust was fantastic.
From Las Vegas and we get a lot is sushi options.  This place is very good, friendly and fresh.

Brilliant restaurant !! Meals are cooked in front of you!! Prices are brilliant, you definitely get a generous amount for what you pay for. Amazing experience, definitely bring the kids along as they will love it ! Great service, nice layout, beautiful and delicious meals. Would %100 recommend!!

These guys never fail to get it right. Highly recommend the Lava Roll it's superb. Bookings are a good idea as they get super busy from 7. They also have an all you can eat option Monday-Thursday which is great value for money. The place to go for consistent food & service

Best thai restaurant in christchurch. Very friendly staff and the food is amazing. We come from the other side of the city,definately worth it.the spareribs are a must for an entree. Green curry
Is my ultimate fav, i carnt seem to bring myself to try anything else.yom. My partner eats everything else on the menu for me anyway.

Best cafe experience I've ever had. The guy behind the counter was super friendly without being creepy and the waiter was hilarious entertainment while joking with all the tables he was serving. I ordered a peice of Spanish omelete for $9 which came out 50% bigger than I assumed it would (a slice and a half) as well as a side of greens. It was warmed to perfection and came out just after my coconut milk latte. The coffee was strong and tasty. Heaps of tables inside and outside, good for families or a solo traveler, like me. Everything was perfect!

Really subpar Chinese restaurant. Food comes out really quickly and the locals seemed to enjoy it. I ordered mapo tofu which you had to pay extra for rice--if it's a dish that you're supposed to eat with rice, just give the customer rice. I would understand paying separate for rice if I ordered like a noodle dish but it should just come included! So I rolled my eyes at that. But wait, it gets worse. Worst mapo tofu ever. Not completely inedible but when you use the frozen veggies for the carrots and peas but can't find a package that doesn't include corn so you just throw in the corn as well... China would be embarrassed. Not sure if it was from the froze. Veggies but the texture of the sauce should be more gelatinous rather than liquid and it was all just liquid with meh flavor. If I spend any more time in this city I would never come back here. Not worth my money.

I got off the tram stop (#17) nearby for the hop-on-hop-off tour about 4PM. It turns out there's no real restaurants open for food service during this time. I found a small cafe with sandwiches and a bar only serving take away items, but that's it. This and a South American restaurant were the only places open at the time! 

I ordered the mini spring rolls and deep fried crumbed prawns ($20.50 total). Both were pretty bad. The spring rolls hardly had anything in them, and they were so hard they hurt my teeth, which rarely happens. The prawns were VERY greasy without any flavor. I only ate a couple. At least they had jasmine tea to cut the grease! 

I've definitely eaten better in the USA at countless restaurants, hence the "experienced better" rating. The waitresses were more interested in chatting than serving. Since I've an American accent, they assumed I only wanted silverware (no chopsticks placed on the table) despite being Chinese. Since so few places are open for full food service from 3-5PM, there's no reason to be good, right?

Had a decent meal here after a long day of travel. Really liked how many veggies they had in the Kung pao chicken dish. Had to pay extra for rice. They didn't know what egg drop soup was but had something similar with tomatoes. Other than the tomatoes in it was a little bland. It fit the bill but I have had better Chinese.
Sampan is your place for cheap Chinese food with an extensive menu. Food was served quickly and in large portions. The Chow Mein rice was great.
Fast service and large portions served. Very close to the Novotel Hotel to get supper. Be hungry or think leftovers. Beer and wine available along with other non alcoholic beverages

I got the Mapo Tofu and it tasted different from any other kind I had had before. Honestly the sauce reminded me of Buffalo wings back in the States, which I am not a fan of, unfortunately. I wouldn't ask that particular dish again, but I would be more than willing to visit again sometime, if possible!

Great westernized Chinese restaurant.  Willing to add back authenticity when requested.  I had a hankering for some extra spicy Szechuan dry fried beef.   Although I was told that they lacked the the Szechuan pepper corn ( hua jiao ) an ingredient quintessential to the dish the rouse up to the challenge(ref. Picture titled: 91...). The flavors were comparable to the proper preparation though accented by the Guangdong based Cantonese ingredients.  
Staff was very helpful and accommodating.  Little cleanliness issue (strictly observed on the water bottle seal, not the food) could have ensured the fourth star.  But a great little restaurant none-the-less.

We came here for dinner on our first night in NZ and it was great. We sat outside on their patio and service was friendly. The food was pretty good, and they had a decent beer selection. This was our first glimpse into how pricey NZ was going to be...expensive pizza! But tasty :)
Good selection of beers, pizza is made in their pizza oven and is tasty. Outside area lovely in the summer, they are open late so good place to finish the evening

Save yourself from food poisoning. Do not come here. Their food is not fresh. The rice and tofu used in the tofu stew hot pot all tasted spoiled.  When we brought this up to the staff, they insisted everything was fresh. Even though I could not eat the majority of the food, they would not do anything to discount the order.

This restaurant was amazing. My family and I have been looking for a Korean restaurant to eat at for a while and i would say this restaurant is definitely a great choice. Staff is extremely helpful and kind. The food definitely exceeded my expectations, where I had the pork rice meal (#18) and my family shared the galbi-tang. Both were such delicacies 

10/10 would come again!

HORRIBLE!! I went with my wife and young son, staff immediately became very rude and homophobic towards us. Sat down and ordered the "leccapiedi per figa" and it came out disgusting and I'm positive that I got food poisoning, will not be returning to this place.

Has to be the coolest place for a Friday afternoon beer. 

Just when you thought you should leave... They bring snacks... Time for another 

Nice polite and smiling  bartenders
Pleasant ambiance and very good food and service.  The garlic nan is the best I've ever had.

As we were heading to Mumbai for a holiday we thought we would try some local cuisine . A colleague recommended the maharaja indian restaurant.

Upon entering the property I thought we had entered someone's house and weren't sure where to park. But there was plenty of parking behind the building. 

The Decor was pretty fancy and the staff were so friendly. I decided on the Mango chicken and wasn't let down. I had to take home my left overs as I could finish what was on my plate.

The place feels pretty fancy with the table cloths, stemware, and the dim lighting. But happily, this turned out to be one of the more reasonable meals I had in Christchurch. The 17.50 butter tikka masala was quite good and they made it with paneer instead of chicken by request, which I appreciated. And apparently I am not their only fan - the phones were ringing off the hook with takeout orders - seriously, almost non-stop. 

Nice servers and atmosphere as well in this little romantically lit house.
A great neighbourhood Japanese. The food is fresh and reasonably priced. The agedashi tofu is delicious as is the beef tataki.

a good noodle house, with an open kitchen, large menu and good prices.  They are known for throwing in complementary chicken bones that were used to make their broth.  It's an interesting touch that I've not seen from other places, and made it a worthwhile stop during our visit to Christchurch. 

My brother and I learned about this place from a staff member at the Hyatt Regency in Sydney, who let us know that this was one of her favorite places to go when back home in Christchurch (especially for the chicken bones).  So we decided to center our day around visiting it, once we got off the ship on a Thursday.  It's more than 3 km from the centre of Christchurch, so a decent trek, but was able to take a bus back after a filling meal.  It also brought us to the Riccarton neighborhood.  If there is a 'Chinatown' in Christchurch, the Riccarton neighborhood is probably it.  There were a ton of places that we passed, that we would also try out if we had time.

The restaurant opens at 11 and was already fairly busy when we stopped in around that time.  It is an open kitchen, staffed by two ladies.  As one can imagine, they were very busy but were still very friendly and patient to answer our questions.  We learned that they will throw in the chicken bones with any purchase.   The menu itself is not specific to Cambodia but is a mixture.    I was really craving noodle soup, so ended up getting three dishes along with an app to share between the two of us.

#7 Noodles Soup with Chicken (NZ$17) - the better of the two soups, it used the flavorful broth from all that chicken bone braising.  You have your choice of thick or thin rice noodles, and they give you plenty.   I enjoyed nibbling on the chicken bones, trying to find those missed meat morsels.

#9 Beef Noodles Soup (NZ$18.50) - I thought this was OK.  The broth was very clean and it did come with uniform strips of food grade quality beef, and a lot of rice noodles.

Shrimp Pad Thai (off menu) - (NZ$ 25) - This was an OK rendition, with a decent amount of well-cooked shrimp.

Deep fried spring rolls (NZ$9.50) - Both of us really liked this dish, using whole seasoned shrimp, wrapped in spring roll paper to resemble miniature cones.  They were freshly deep fried and were delicious, coming with a sweet Thai chili sauce.

They market themselves as a noodle house specializing in Chinese and Thai favorites, but also with a Cambodian flair.  With their large portions and reasonable prices, free wifi for customers, and friendly hospitality, Riccarton Noodle House is a good stop for locals and tourists, alike.
Top spot. Fantastic Wonton Noodle Soup. I always eat here when visiting Christchurch. Highly recommended

Second last dinner in Christchurch. We were debating between a few spots in Riccarton but ended up choosing Riccarton Noodle House, a Cambodian spot. It's more like a mix of Vietnamese, Cambodian and Malaysian. 

We dropped in on a Tuesday evening (around 7:00pm) and it was empty. The inside has a bit of Cambodia decoration (Angkor Wat painting on the wall) but other than that, it's bare. Service is non-existent. You go to the counter to order where you also can grab water and utensils (self serve). 

The menu is up above the open style kitchen; special spicy, noodle soup, satay, stir fry noodles, specials, side dishes and sweets.

- Curry laksa with chicken (#31) ($13.00 NZD) - I can never say no to laksa but in hindsight, this was a poor choice. Laksa isn't a Cambodian speciality; should have got one of their noodle soups instead. The laksa was half decent but nowhere close to being authentic. Barely any ingredients inside and they used udon noodles...
- Black pepper udon with seafood (#30) ($15.00 NZD) - we asked for claypot yee-mee and got this. No idea how the chef messed up our order. We decided to eat it but should have complained instead. Super stingy on the seafood (only a couple small pieces of squid and three prawns). The pepper was overpowering and vegetables consisted of the cheap, bland variety. Bad, just bad. 

One of the most disappointing meals of our trip. I was still hungry afterwards. 2.5 stars.

A fun night scene for 18 and ups to socialize and drink. It has a classy feel with a pretty outdoor setting. There is a dress code, so make sure not to wear sandals or casual clothes. I have watched friends get turned away at the door for even wearing nice tennis shoes!
Very cool and cozy spot, but didn't live up to its expectations or price. Staff were rather uninterested.

Tonight (30/12/16) around 930-10pm I was enjoying a few drinks with a group of mates when I ordered a drink from the bar (quad shot of jack daniels on the rocks), took it back to our table, had a sip and noticed the glass was dirty (lip stick all around the glass). I took the drink back to the bar and asked the blonde girl who served me if I could have another where she told me she would poor the drink into a clean glass, I said no I would like a new one altogether.

I have had meningitis before so even if the glass was cleaned I am very cautious which means I see the glass and the drink no longer sanitary.

So anyway, she poured me a drink but it was only a double shot. I told her the drink she originally served was a quad shot which is when she told me I had already had a drink and she couldn't remember giving me a dirty glass and she could just give away free alcohol. It completely embarrassed me in front of everyone at the bar listening making me feel like I was trying to score extra alcohol for nothing when putting the old drink and the new drink side by side there was clearly nearly double in the old drink. I said to her if that"s the case I would rather have my money back for the double that she had re poured as at this stage I was clearly not happy with the service and how she handled the situation, when she continued to tell me she couldn't give me a refund. I know it's only a glass of spirits but being embarrassed and having service like that just getting into town lost your bar 6 customers wanting to have celebratory 30th birthday drinks at your bar.

Baretta is an ok place for a drink. But the food is terrible, badly cooked and overpriced. The service is also not very good, quite Arrogant.  My Veal was chewy and not cooked correctly. Fillet steak and potatoes was exactly that. Nothing else no gravy no other veg or salad or even seasoning. Twice been here to dine. But I never will again.

If I could give this place a half star I would. The best food and wine in the world could not make up for the terrible service Baretta has to offer. I could have painted the Sistine Chapel in the time it took to be served.
The "dress code" is ridiculous, there is better consistency in curdled milk.
This bar is basically a rat with a gold tooth.
I would recommend Baretta to anyone who is looking for a reason to be pissed off.

Baretta is one of my favorite establishments in the city for two reasons: 1) the food is amazing and 2) their outdoor patio bar is a great place to mingle with young professionals in the city. Visit Baretta on a weekend night and be sure you're into the bar well before 10:00 as the line of 20 and 30-somethings extends down the block. If you're visiting for the restaurant and a little taste of Italy in Christchurch, be sure to make a booking a few days in advance. They DO have Entertainment Guide coupons!

FOOD: My husband and I started with the grilled ciabatta with parsley pesto and olive jam. The bread was extremely filling, so I definitely recommend sharing with several people. The olive jam was my favorite spread, but the parsley pesto is light and bright and an interesting take on pesto. We decided to split the side salad with parmesan cheese on top and a light balsalmic dressing. It was a crisp salad with a lot of complementary tastes. I ordered the Chicken Leg as my main and it was cooked beautifully: juicy and tender. It was served with pickled pumpkins (which were very interesting) potatoes with ricotta and garnished with radishes. I cleaned the plate! I just wish there had been about one serving less of the pickled pumpkins. My husband ordered the Squid Ink Gnocchi with mussels and calamari. If you enjoy the smell of fish and seafood overload, this is the dish for you. My husband enjoyed it, but the smell was overwhelming for me (a non-fish eater). We opted to pair the meal with a bottle of Chandon, but their wine list is quite extensive and the waiter will be more than happy to offer pairing suggestions. In fact, the waiters at the restaurant are on top of their game. Never was a glass left empty nor were we left alone for too long (but not in a creepy hovering way). He seemed to have his eye on our table at all times which made the evening a breeze.

Step outside before or after your meal to enjoy a cocktail from the patio bar. Often there is live music playing and heated tables to relax on.

What's the catch for the place? Be prepared to hand over your first born child with the meal as it ain't cheap. But quality food and impeccable service comes with a price.

When Barretta first opened I loved it. I was probably their biggest fan, I told anyone and everyone to go and emphatically told them how ridiculously good the red wine sangria was. It's still an amazing bar with a tasteful ambience and the sangria that is great (I make better but initially I probably did not). Barretta is a good bar and definitely the place to be on a Friday or Saturday night after 10;30pm just don't show up after 10:30 or you will be waiting in a line half way down the block for over an hour due to the arbitrary carrying capacity the council put on the bar. It's a great scene but I wouldn't go here to meet people because it's quite a clicky crowd (more so than Aikmans/bardello) and can also be an older group on certain nights.

Nice spot!  Fun lively and spacious patio in the back with a live musician, casual atmosphere, good beers and wines.  We ended up having bar bites, with a couple of good thin crust pizzas and risotto balls.  The restaurant does serve a full menu inside, which has cool Hollywood Regency decor.   Fun vibe!

Great bar appealing to quite a range of patrons. There's a large area out the back with building facades set up like you're in some kind of Western. The entertainment was good on the Friday night that we visited.

the decor would fool anyone as the tables and chairs look like something out of the 1960's but the food is very good. I'm not a fan of loads of tofu so I went for the sesame crispy mushrooms with bean sprouts and the ginger brown rice which was the favourite dish with my friends. The green tea was subtle and enjoyable, and we enjoyed our lunch. I've labelled the photos as unhelpful as I don't think they have done justice to the food but unfortunately I did not take any myself.

We ordered 3 takeaway lunches and a soup. Glad to see a 100% vegetarian Chinese restaurant. The food was good. If you like spicy food, suggest you ask them for chili paste. Don't be fooled by the unassuming appearance of this place!

All Vegetarian and plenty of vegan run by nice people.  Almost all dishes came on a bed of fresh crisp mixed vegetables. 
Started with the dumplings- just OK.  My least favorite dish we had.  They were not the chewy type I usually favor.
Moved on to stir fried ham ( soy, not pig) with green vegetables. Good!
Smoked soy with vegetables.  Also very good.  
#6 hotpot lemon and red roast noodles - sauce was more catsup and not lemony but the  chewy gluten fake meat on top was excellent.
Last dish was Beijing stewed something (#19).  Excellent!

This was our most walkable dinner option and it turned out well. We let the proprietor suggest based on how much cash we had (they don't take credit cards) and we had a noodle and a rice dish, both with tofu. It was ready in less than 10 minutes. We'll return.

Great choices for vegans. 100% vegetarian and about 80% of the menu are vegan. The dishes we tried were so delicious. The service was great and the food came fairly quick. Prices were resonable. 
It's not a fancy place and I wouldn't recommend it for a first date but it's definitely worth a visit.
I wish there was a place like this at home.

We got in town late after a long journey. We were all tired and famine, therefore walked in the first restaurant in sight. And here we were!
The restaurant looked very fancy, cozy and the manager at the front was friendly.
The waitress was confused about our orders, but the manager straightened it out.
As a person in our group summed up the dining experience perfectly: "expensive for what we got, but we fed our tummies."

Great decor and service as well as food. The food was pretty authentic. The only downside was that it was a bit pricey, but if you go on a deal day such as Mon or Tues between 5 and 7pm you can get two dishes for the price of one.
Great burgers, and great staff at the papanui branch, highly recommended. Craig Owen Duffield

This is a delicious burger establishment-- I came here late one night after going out in Christchurch, and I ordered a cheesey burger with truffle oil, fried Mac n cheese bites, bacon, and all of the fixings. It was heavy, but absolutely divine. For a quick place to order burgers and shakes, this place is great.

We ate here several times while we were in Christchurch.  Some of the best burgers that I've had.  Also tried the poutine, which I would skip in the future, but the burgers were amazing.  Try the CN Cheese.

Wednesday night at Ferry Road Smoke'n'Barrel, good vibe, great people, AMAZING food!!!!
Thank you!!!!!

A great chain bagel/pizza joint that boasts it's "New York Style bagel" while I'd argue they're more like Montreal-style (smaller and chewier and, in my opinion, tastier) they are baked perfectly and fill a much needed niche in New Zealand. Having moved here from New York, I was quite delighted to check this place out! 

The restaurant is clean and modern and has great eye-appeal. You can create your own bagel sandwiches (for $7.50) or select one of their options (~$9/10). I tried the Pilgram with chicken, bacon, mayo and tomato salsa on a rock salt bagel. I HIGHLY recommend the combo. While the sandwich lacks the amount of fillings a New York bagel would have, it is still satisfying. My husband had the Big Schnitz and he enjoyed it, too. Haven't tried the pizza, but if it's anything like the bagels, you're taste buds are in for a treat. Don't want a sandwich? You can also buy their bagels as bagel chips!

I have long been waiting for a Wholly Bagels to arrive in the South Island and was so excited to see it has recently opened in the new complex corner of Ilam and Creyke roads. This means I can stop pestering my wellington friends for us to quickly stop by Wholly's up there for my fix. There is plenty of off street parking but only two parks actually reserved for Wholly Bagels customers so snag yourself a street park if you see one. 
This is a new fitout so everything is clean and fresh. The bagels are amazing. My favs are the pilgrim and the salmon. The bagels come in a variety of flavours and are freshly made with no preservatives. The fillings of the gourmet bagels are humungous and delicious. I really want to try the pizza sometime as well - the Jumbo size truly is jumbo!! 
Service is pretty good. They took a while to take our order as they were busy cooking out the back. They also forgot our hot chocolates but remembered just as we were finishing up and bought them to us as takeaways instead with a lot of apologies and a free bag of bagel crisps (YUM!) so all was forgiven. The hot chocolate was really good actually, generous with the marshmallows and not flavourless like I find so many are. 
I recommend checking out Wholly Bagels for lunch, especially for Uni students as its very close to campus. They are also open till 8ish in the evening, and you can do an online order to speed things up in store.

Food was great! It is within our hotel's premise so we went in conveniently.  To our surprise, the food was well prepared.  We were all satisfied with what we ordered.  If you happen to be in Christchurch, give it a try!

This place has all the ingredients for a great restaurant - happy servers, great atmosphere, comfy chairs, and an enticing  menu. I ordered the salmon sliders ($18) not realizing that they were cold smoked salmon. Each of the 4 is different in the kind of salmon, as well as the add ons - herbs, onions, sauces. I would have preferred if the buns were toasted, and felt it was a little pricey - but the flavors and quality of ingredients lead me to believe that these guys know what they are doing - and are either on their way to greatness or are applying it to the other dishes. Next time, I would go for the salmon soup which they also recommended.

Their only major fault was giving me a giant espresso when I ordered a flat white. Not sure if it was just a one off mistake of theirs, or mine for ordering a coffee in a smoke house ....

om nomnomnom
No frills, yummy inexpensive Thai food.
Quick friendly staff. Fresh delicious and exactly what I was craving.
Great location next to several shopping areas and bus lines.
I will try to stop back by here on my way home from Antarctica.

came here this morning! such a cute lil café with friendly workers and free wifi. ordered a soy flat white... it was super good! nice and strong coffee. cool local art for sale inside. the food in the cabinet and the menu items looked good too. will be back the next time i'm in christchurch!

This is a popular 'hipster' cafe, food is organic and free range and tasty.  It's a small menu, and a little more expensive than a chain store, but worth it. Coffee is excellent and I have been known to drive across town for it.
They also have a payitforward option.
The staff are usually friendly and social and change regularly as they employ seasonal workers.
I've grown up with this place over the last ten years and seen his business grow and develop, in the next couple of years I expect I won't be able to get a seat due to popularity.
Try the potatoe hash, it's housemade :)

An alternative vibe in this cool little cafe. Still not too sure how I feel about it might need to come back a few more times. 

The food was ok. Lots of vegan and vegetarian.

Man this place is a cool little cafe and much bigger than it looks from the outside. I love the mismatched 70s furniture and the funky tunes. The staff are friendly and very accommodating considering we went off menu. All hand made treats and a range of vegan meals to tempt the fussiest of eaters.
It was okay, but the eggs Benedict weren't cooked properly. Salmon was lovely, presentation was great. Had a lovely time

Fine dining at it's intimate best. Perfectly balanced 8 course tasting menu was a real treat with every dish having it's highlights. Wonderful waitstaff were friendly and attentive without being intrusive. Delicious local fare at a reasonable price. Highly recommended and I for one can't wait to return soon!
Award winning craft beers like the Milk Stout good place for larger groups. And for sure a great place to eat a wood fired pizza

I've been here a few times for drinks and once for Father's Day breakfast. The venue itself is really nice. Has a rustic-chic sort of vibe, but it in a bloke-y kind of way, if that makes any sense at all.

The Brewery (Cassels & Sons) is part of The Tannery shopping complex. They've got a narrow indoor seating area next to the bar and wood-fired pizza oven, and also a spacious outdoor area with plastic sidings and roof in wet or windy weather. Every time I've been here, I've sat in the outdoor area, which is nice even though your view is basically of the parking lot.

This place can get pretty busy, so just be aware at peak times that you might have a bit of a wait before you can find a seat. Father's Day breakfast was a 45-minute wait (somewhat understandable) but even on regular weekends this place can get busy.

The food is uninspired. They really have nothing on the menu for vegans, except hummus and flatbread. For breakfast, all I could order was the toast with jam and cream sans the cream. The staff was rather unapologetic about this as well. Guess they don't get many vegans in here.

My parents also felt the food was a bit so-so. Also, they'd run out of the dish that my dad wanted, so he had to choose something else. (Father's Day problems again, I guess.)

Overall, I'd say -- make this a drinking spot, not an eating spot.

Nice little brewery by the tannery. Huge patio that has both covered and uncovered seating. They do an $8 pint special each week too.

Enjoyed the beers. Had the mushrooms as an appetizer- huge serving for only $6 and tasty.

This seems like a nice enough place to gather for a drink after work, although I probably wouldn't stop back in for dinner.  I'm not sure why so many breweries seem to insist on serving sloppy, oversized burgers, but it is what it is I guess.  If you're a fan of hoppy NZ beers, though, this place is worth at least one quick visit.

Also known as The Brewery, this is a nice rustic bar and restaurant for a chilled time. I've been here for drinks and pizzas which was great, real good atmosphere at night, the pizzas were varied enough to have something for everyone and being a brewery, it had a great variety of craft beer on tap. Also came for breakfast early when it was very quiet and it was alright, probably wouldn't go again for breakfast as there's better places for a similar price
The layout is weird for ordering cabinet food and the staff really ruined it for me. They all seem like kids that are too cool for school. The industry is HOSPITALITY. The staff need a lesson.
Great tasting craft beers and friendly service with a smile. Great food menu. We tried the Calamari and a pizza from their main menu. Worth a trip out to the Tannery!

This is Gustav's Kitchen and Wine Bar, right?

If so, then the food and wine list is good. They don't have an extensive food menu, but they do right by what they have. We ordered a deviled beef sandwich and dry aged rib eye steak; the meat on both dishes was cooked perfectly.

Although there is a really long wine list comprised of mostly NZ wine, I highly recommend sticking to the NZ labels.

They have their own craft beer on tap, which are not too shabby either. Friendly service. 

Prices for mains are roughly $20-$30.

A popular place to spend a weekend afternoon, The Brewery have delicious pizzas and a range of craft beers and ciders on offer.  I've only ever tried the pizza here, but there is also other main meals available.  The pizza flavours are quite different, think Pear, blue cheese, thyme & smoked bacon,  and an ever changing Pizza of the Week flavour.  I had to settle for an apple cider when I last visited; while admittedly very tasty, I was keen to try the grape and berry cider (sadly sold out).

They've got a whole heap of seating, indoors and outdoors, making it suitable for group gatherings.  Often there is a band playing in the afternoon.

Tip: Browse the nearby boutique shops in The Tannery complex while you wait for friends (or inbetween drinks).

Good service and quality hearty food. Beers are good too. You can take a good size party with you and sit outside with the option of dropping down partitions to separate you from others. They also have a large outdoor screen for when the big games are on.
Decent portion burgers, high quality fresh ingredients. Definitely a 5 star burger joint with a cool theme

Visiting from the US,a family member suggested we eat lunch here. After walking through the newly constructed city we were very hungry and ready to eat fulfilling food. For an all Vega menu everything we had was amazing. If we lived in Christchurch we would eat here every week!
Great for coffee and tea in between shopping at The Hub in Hornby.  Friendly staff, yummy food, great coffee.

Delicious pizza & mouth-watering desserts. Definitely recommended if in the area.

However, the restaurant can get a bit dark later as lighting is minimal.
Delicious food, great service.  Can join your loved ones at Summerset Retirement Village for morning tea, lunch, afternoon tea, or dinner.

Delicious spot near the train station for breakfast! Hubby and son got Anna's special, 2 pancakes eggs bacon and hash browns, and I had toast and eggs, also yummy cream cake! My chai latte really hit the spot. You select pastries and sandwiches from the counter display then order hot foods and drinks and pay at the cash register. Sandwiches in the counter display are wrapped so you could easily take them to go.

I love this place. I live nearby and it is a total asset to the neighbourhood - I use it both as a casual place to drop in when I don't feel like cooking, and also to take friends from out of town to show off the amazing tannery. 

The wine and cocktail list is refined but comprehensive, and the tapas are awesome - delicious, sophisticated, ranging from light (pickled vegetables with fresh herbs, or pil pil prawns with garlic confit) and fresh to sticky, fried yumminess (Yorkshire puds, braised beef cheek croquettes). The decor is also beautiful and original and if you're lucky there will be a piano player in the house, giving it a luxey, retro lounge bar vibe.
Ordered from Hikari through UberEats while in MIQ. Those are good sushis, well-presented and well-packaged. Delivery was on time.  A trustable choice for a weekday night.
Badest Teriyaki Salmon Bowl ever. Loveless created. Overprized for that quality. Waitress friendly, but thats not the point.

This place started well earlier in the year, and we've been maybe 10 times.

Now the owners sit in the business watching customers while tables need to be clear, maybe wating is below them, the food is average, the price is average but what is really really obvious is that the portion size is well down, and I mean well down.  The California rolls are now 1/2 the size they previously were, and the sushi is tiny...sadly I suspect this place is loosing customers quickly, We wont be back, we tried to support it, but there's good sushi everwhere in CHCH central.

It's a bit of a hole in the wall.  Needs a clean!  Yes, tables too.  
So this is how burgers were 20 years ago. The bread is amazing.  This is a proper burger and chips.  So good!!
Wow what awsome burgers, highly recommended, and the staff are so friendly which made the whole experience..... Craig Owen Duffield

I was quite disappointed with this burger joint, after hearing so many good things about it.

I had the lamb burger. I found it to be over cooked and dry. The bun's they use did not help the dryness I experienced, as, it too, had a dry texture.

The decor was unique - I like the trashy horror movie theme, and award an extra star for it. 

After hearing this was one of the best burger joints in Christchurch, I found myself somewhat disappointed.

Came in outta the pouring rain to find a gem of a place. Friendly staff in cool new shoes and dope pyjama-like pants helped me navigate the habit-forming menu and apologised for making me wait all of two minutes for my food. I had the Pulp Fiction Burger and chips with gravy. Couple that with a cold Steinlager, and there isn't much more you could ask for from a burger joint. Would be a regular if I lived here.

I've never liked chicken burger but their chicken pig is sensational. Juiciest deliciousness with avocado, bacon, chicken breast and greens with a delicious bun. And those chips. Yum. Another level. And staff is great, always friendly and funny.

We were recommended to try this place for great burgers and chips. The place is quite basic and themed in 50's horror. But the burgers were great and chips were amongst the best eaten, which is the reason for going there. It was nice to wash down with a local brew and listen to the band playing in the car park outback.

I'll be back again when in town !

I love this place, I've been a few times just because the burgers are so great, I get cravings everytime I think about it.  But it would be nice to be ask if I want to eat their instead of feeling like im being kicked out after I get my food, other than that as long as their open ill be back in many times :)
Decent burgers, great chips - although slightly salty. Decent beers, mainstream and christchurch based craft. Basic but kitsch decor and quick service.
Burgers and beers, two wonderful things and this place has a great range of both, plus the chips come with gravy! The decor is like an homage to 50s horror movies. Rip in.

Wow... I miss this place so much. Nothing beats a good old chicken satay noodle soup on a cold winter days. Reminds me of the days in Dunedin.  

The place- lots of seats, self service, clean but not like a 5 star restaurant.

Food- go for the chicken satay noodle soup. Very filling, warms up your stomach! Ask for extra bowel of chicken bone also.

Service- friendly but it's not really where you go for service

Price- starting to go up. I remember the days of spending $8 for a bowl, it's now $12

Overall very nostalgic, will have to make another trip down south soon.
Excellent coffee.  The smashed avocado toast was super. It comes with a yummy salad and feta and toast. Highly recommended.

Small, stylish, simple. Most importantly delicious food and excellent coffee. We had a very tasty leek and potato soup, served generously and piping hot. The espresso is dark, strong and rich without being bitter. 

Great spot for brekkie, lunch or just a cup.

Dropped in for a coffee- remember this place from 15years ago when I worked over the road in a building now gone, like a big part of Christchurch. 
Coffee was ok, bit burnt but acceptable - food cabinet was fu of yummy looking stuff and the menu had some winners.

I've been to Sevanti's a few times, and I always like it enough to go back, but it's certainly not somewhere I'd rave about. The food is nice enough, there are lots of gluten free options and it's got a decent atmosphere but it's just so expensive for what you get. I found the service very slow, it took at least an hour for our food to come out, the waitress didn't understand half of what we were asking for, and I found it ridiculous that they were unable to provide food off the lunch menu (as we had a number of food allergies at the table, the lunch menu had the better options). 

The food itself was okay. Three people at the table ordered the steak - they said it was nice enough but the meat probably wasn't very high quality - they were also slightly overcooked, one person ordered the rack of lamb which again was okay but nothing to rave about, another ordered the fish on risotto which she said was a bad combination and I ordered the crispy chicken which wasn't too bad but the chicken was a little overcooked. For the price you pay, probably not worth it, yet it probably won't stop me going back again.

Beautiful environment, great food and service. I ordered the lunch salad with lamb. Delicious!
Back for the chicken schnitzel sandwich!

My friend and I, thanks to grab one went for an "eat like an earl" set menu experience 
There isn't much that I didn't like about the place, the service was great. The food was fresh and delicious. 
We weren't really explained what food was coming when we were seated, which was ok because I enjoy the  element of surprise. Portions were solid, would definitely come back to try full menu.

Just in Christchurch for a night and looked for something beyond burgers and fries. The chicken tangine was moist and tender with delicious couscous. The parcel we ordered was also very good- would come back for sure. Be sure to order the assorted dips tapas!
Friendly place with nice atmosphere.  Bartenders are great especially Jen and Brandy.  Karaoke night is a lot of fun. Good place to watch sports with the locals.

Unbelievable, Wouldn't serve me and my friends from out of state. The Barback is unable to see what an actual ID is while using a blacklight.  Embarrassing, ended up getting drinks from a place down the street that was packed. Now it makes sense why this place was empty. Some of the most disrespectful service I have ever experienced. Do not recommend you coming to this Bar especially if you are out of state. Ignorance & Horrible customer service and inept staffing clearly plague this dive bar of a place. If you want to enjoy your night or your possible visit to Long Island, I recommend you avoid this place at all costs.
Have a wonderful time every time I go here. Enjoy the bands and karaoke night and comedy nights. The bartenders are great and the beers are reasonably priced!
Went to a fundraiser here. Got great bar food and drinks. The bar tenders were nice and attentive. Great casual spot for hanging with friends and catching up.

Hosted a birthday gathering a few months back. Normally don't review, but had to mention the STUNNING service! Vinny the owner and the bartender Jen were super accommodating and made me and my friends feel right at home. They have board games, pool, darts, a juke box, and fairly priced drinks. The place itself and the bathroom is clean and decent. We were the youngest crowd there (mid 20's) but had an absolute blast! Highly recommend if you're looking for a nice and casual evening out, we plan on hosting our next event there again!
I was just there tonight for karaoke. I was given a bill as if I were drinking in Manhattan. It's a freaking dive bar and charging unbelievable prices. NEVER AGAIN!! Junior you are terrible.

I love this joint! By far my favorite LI bar . People here are down to earth, sincere and friendly. The drinks are reasonably priced and they have stand up comedy every now and then . The bartender Danielle is a sweetheart and damn good at what she does . If you want to have a low key, fun, yet local experience you should definitely visit this place.  A true Long Island staple lol !

Went here for my birthday night and was not disappointed for my first bar visit. The second I walked in I was greeted by the friendly staff and locals, Sal even made us some delicious fries even though he shut down the kitchen already. Amazing service! this was a very warm and welcoming environment and the next time I'm in town I'll be back! Thanks for making my 21st great, guys!

Lovely neighborhood tavern, where you can order some food, have a well-mixed drink, watch the sports, meet nice local people and even sing karaoke on occasion. 
They have a great setup, with excellent singers, every once in a Friday night while. Make sure to call the bar to confirm if they are doing the karaoke thing on the Friday you are coming.

My friend was celebrating his 2nd 30th birthday here with his buds, and prior to my attending, I checked out the reviews. There's this one girl that has it all wrong. This place is awesome. I'm 30yrs old at current, and she claimed that she and her friend were in their 20's. Yes, the crowd is more mature, but it is mixed. 

I was there with people my age, people older than us, and people younger than us, and not everyone who was there was there for the birthday boy. I dressed up too, but I didn't feel out of place. You wear what you want, within reason/appropriateness, and the better dressed you are the less it can hurt!

The bartenders were kind and professional. There's one pool table at the center where people can pay to play. Two C-shaped booth areas one to the left of the entrance upon walking in, and one at the rear left behind the mini-stage where we got to be entertained by a local singer. She sang mellow and sad cover songs, which sounded nice, but were not the right tune for the night. The background music they played when the singer took breaks was chill and upbeat, and not excessively loud! Yay, don't have to scream over each other to order a drink or have a conversation. 

The highchairs at the bar area aren't stationed in and can be moved about, which is great for small to medium sized groups.

The restrooms are at the rear of the space. Decent and plenty of space. 

I did not try any of the bites, only had a beer ($5.00) and a glass of water. 

It's part of a mini shopping center, and it's a hidden gem, if you ask me. Next time some friends opt to hang out there or celebrate, I'll be back! 

Happy Eats/Drinks/Lounging!

I love this bar all the bartenders are always friendly and remember you and what you drink  . Jenn , Gus , Corina Sal and Sal the owner always a good time and a place to shoot pool , dance , karaoke and make new friends. The only problem there is never wanting to go home
Great place to have a drink, awesome margaritas and Long Island iced Teas! Friendly Staff.
Drinks are priced great, service is top notch and the owners are as friendly as can be. They really care about their customers.

Was excited about this place because it had good stats but I should have known better because so few reviews. The Facebook page showed martini specials and it looked like a locals hangout. Sounded perfect. My bad!

My friend and I walked into this place after work for a drink on a Friday. I was honestly in jeans and a t-shirt and was the best dressed in this place. People were in sweats - which would have been FINE if, when we walked in, we weren't looked up and down because we didn't look like slobs and didn't fit in. It was so uncomfortable. We're in our twenties and were looking for a place to catch up and talk- but we left before even having a drink. We were BY FAR the youngest by 30 years. At least. It was not clean, not friendly.
Always such a pleasure to come to this great hidden gem. My girl and I always have such a great time there. Bartenders to the owner thank you for always treating my girl and like family
Very nice staff, food is notches above anywhere in the area. Pizza is delicious and crispy, Knish is out of this world. Good job so far guys!

Tried Dragon Express on a whim and was genuinely impressed.
Food came out hot, fresh, and full of flavour--especially the black bean beef and fried rice. Good portions, fair prices, and quick service even on a busy night.

Great local option when you need something tasty and no-fuss. Will definitely order again.

Easily the worst meal I have had in a restaurant. Of the 5 dim sum dishes we pressed, only 2 were even edible. The spring rolls were still frozen in the middle and the pork dumplings were doughy and the filling was cold. The beef with vegetables had a distinctly off odor.  The service was equally appalling.  However, the steamed shrimp dumplings were delicious and the Singapore noodles were just fine.
Delicious breakfast menu, cabinet food for lunch, superhealthy and amazingly delicious and beautiful. Just go!

The pizza was fine but damm their beer was awesome.

Lots of beers on tap.

Nice weather sit outside in the garden it is awesome.

Pies are on the smallish size but good flavor.

Happy hour is the way to go.
Good pizza but one of those restaurants that even when completely empty will try to seat two people at a table for two. We sat ourselves at a table for four and the server looked completely shocked.

I wasn't tremendously hungry but I wanted a place to sit after a long walk and Spagalimis arrived at the right time. I managed to convince the hostess to find me a seat with a power outlet which ended up leaving me alone in the bar area. And I was alone for a long while. Close to 20 minutes before I was packing up my stuff when my waitress stopped by to try to take my order. By that point, I was up and on my way to somewhere else.

It looks good. Give it a try. Bring patience.

[Review 399 of 2024 - 52 in New Zealand - 21432 overall]

That was rough.

Ambiance and service are great, presentation was excellent-- pizza came on a wooden baking paddle and everything.

But the pizza (I think I had the Spag's special recommended per the wait staff?) was pretty gross. Crust was thick and bready, which in itself was not a problem-- but it came out so steaming with moisture that it quickly left its own puddle of water under the pizza, and the result was distinctly un-appetizing.

I made a reservation to eat at 32 Salisbury St. Spagalimis for 15 people a week before. When we turned up we were rudely bump out at the bar which was extremely noisy. I hated it. I know they are so busy but the way they handled it was so unprofessional. I  was so disappointed and they only told me basically to suck it up. It was a farewell dinner with my classmates and tutors and it would have been nice to be seated nicely and comfortably where we can hear each other talk. I don't know what went wrong with our booking here. So disappointing.

This is a cute little family business that maximizes use of their modest space with high quality European foods--everything from canned and packaged products to meat goods for wonderful dinner parties to cheeses, tarts, and meat pies for park picnics. The owners are incredibly friendly with infectious smiles. This business is well worth a visit, or two, or three.

Wow!  The duck pate is to die for.  And guess what - it only has duck liver, butter, brandy, orange peel, and spices!  IE no modified food starch, stabilizers, or other cr*p.  Yowza - the real thing!

If you like good, wholesome deli foods (cured meats, pates, raw cheese, etc) come by here.  And did I mention the pastries?

Town Tonic was once a nice restaurant. We used to come here almost every week and always enjoyed the service and food. However, a few months ago a new owner decided to show up. Every day was a different food eg. Carrots this was very lame and boring especially that we couldn't order our ordinary food. This started to get worse when we saw the manager of the restaurant spying at other restaurants eg. Mexico. This place is definitely not worth your time or money.

Most disappointing dining experience to date. Promised so much but delivered very little. The restaurant decor was nice. The service was terrible. The waitress was unapproachable & had a bit of a attitude (worst thing is I am sure she was the duty manager). My friend asked what was gluten-free as she can get severely sick from ingesting gluten- this comment was not well received & she was told to read the menu. The menu did not say whether the fish was dredged in flour! The potato skins promised truffle but sadly there was none. The main meals were good. The dessert was very lack lustre. The PBJ was average- only redeeming part was the raspberry sorbet. My friend got the ice-cream sandwich which was inedible. You needed a pick-axe to even attempt it. The part we could try was the ice-cream but only a small bit we managed to chip off. It was icy!! What was the chef thinking even plating this up! The sponge was rock solid. My friend paid for it & all the chef said that if we'd said something about it, they could've fixed it. We did but the waitress didn't care. And let's be real- there was no saving that dessert. So if you want an below average meal with terrible service and pay plenty of $$$ for the experience, please be Town Tonic's next guest. All I can say is diner beware!!

A few of us stumbled on this place a couple of months ago and we all really enjoyed the service and food. So a month later I tried to book to find the pate I was wanting had to be made the day before. So last Monday I thought I'd get in early & was pleased the chief answered,who clearly was busy & not bothered with my questions but I still requested and booked in the pate for 4 of us & stated we were coming in for a 2nd attempt for pate on the Thursday. Anyway 15 mins b4 the booking my gut feeling said ring and check and confirm. To my horror they only had enough for one. So 4 people 2 times have missed out on my business. I won't be back even though it is convenient for Me and my parents.

Visited Town Tonic on a Saturday morning around 10 am, and unlike most Chch brunch places, the place was barely alive with only four other patrons. I was a little nervous, but we chose to stay and were seated at a tall top table by the window. I suppose the crew that visited Town Tonic into the wee hours of the morning were still sleeping off their hangovers.

 Our waiter was a little quirky, but friendly and efficient. We ordered an americano and a trim flat white. They both arrived quickly.  The menu is very concise which makes choosing your entree easy. There are your breakfast classics: muesli or french toast, but the rest of the menu features eclectic specialty items that are impeccably prepared: Mexican Salad, Duck Liver, French Sardines, vegetarian options or the Gourmet Croque Madame.

The croque madame was served on thick slices of bread with prosciutto "really good cheese" (their words, not mine), mustard all drowned in truffle oil with a fried egg on top. If you're not a true fan of truffle oil, this sandwhich will be a bit overwhelming by the second half, but the first half will be amazing. I ate every bite.

The large hot breakfast looked like something straight from a mexican restaurant: Mushrooms, potatoes with jalapeños, tomatoes, a fried egg. My husband licked the plate clean and said this is one of his all time favorite meals in Christchurch (he didn't even save me a bite). 

We were very pleased with our breakfast option and recommend this joint to anyone in the area to check out for breakfast, lunch, dinner or drinks!

Joe's Garage the service was good as the staff member who seated us was very nice, and our food came out promptly but, the food was average and under seasoned. But the reason that I'm giving them 2 stars is because half way through our meal the music was turned up rather loudly making it pretty difficult to talk to my Father as he has hearing aids. This isn't my main complaint tho as we decided to leave (because of how loud the music was) we mentioned it to the girl as we where paying, every time we where telling her the issue she would cut over us and tell us she was turning the music down. EVERY TIME! (Their is nothing worse than trying to talk about an issue and constantly being interrupted as if your opinion doesn't matter) She was even laughing as she was doing it. I won't be going back.

I had the roast beef and loved it. The lady on the counter was lovely and asked me if she had put enough gravy on, salt and pepper also. Cooked well and I barely had to wait for it to be prepared. Good value, I'm stuffed full for $13.
The waiting area could have been a bit cleaner with some rubbish on the floor, but it's takeaway and not eat-in anyway.
Alway polite, fast ,fresh and tasty. Whenever I'm at the Colombo i have to have the best sushi in chch.

I ordered the build your own. Salmon, spinach and gluten free toast (x2 peices) which was $11. I didn't think to look for sauce so not sure where to find that (not that I would have wanted it). There was no salt and pepper on the dish or on the table, but there was cutlery and napkins. I had a decaf almond milk latte which was fine also. I loved the range of foods that appealed to me as I'm quite difficult with eating out. The only thing I would complain about was the toast was slightly dry/hard and it was buttered which I would have preferred not to have. Seating inside or outside was both lovely with a great city atmosphere.
Papas pizza is a great family business delivering beautiful pizzas with a huge range of toppings, cooked on hot stones, you get great value for money and is remarkable for a takeaway Resteraunt

I just had the worst pizza ever at Papas Pizza.
I ordered a pepperoni pizza which was very simple - pepperoni , mushroom and tomato and cheese.
Guess what. - when I get it home , there's no pepperoni ! How can they advertise a pepperoni pizza and then not put pepperoni on it?
The base was disgusting - it was very thin , but doughy. How can a pizza base so thin be doughy? The base wasn't even warm.
So I got a tasteless pizza on a floppy doughy cold base.
Disgusting!
Good meal at good prices. Service with a smile and they happily accommodated my toddler and 7 month old.

This Indian restaurant was a lovely dining experience. You could tell it was a family business and they took pride in their product. The service was great, very attentive and checked in with us during our dining. We had the chickpea vegetarian recommended dish, saag prawns, garlic naan and spicy pickles. One let down was I found the dishes not spicy enough even tho we asked for medium and I would have like more intensity in the flavour. I gave a 4 because of the whole experience and not just the meal.

I had fairly high expectations of this place after a recommendation from a friend. Unfortunately I left the place disappointed. Ordered Chicken bhuna and lamb rogan josh. Both came served with basmati rice. Taste for both were average, nothing to really write home about. Portions were on the small side, suitable for light mid eaters. The mango lassi tasted of syrup rather than mangoes. Could definitely do better. Overall there are better ones around for the price.
Everything was so delicious. I've never had better Indian food. The lamb roganjash was so tender and perfectly season. The chicken tikka masala was super juicy and had the perfect hint of smokiness.
Great coffee roasted here and delicious pies and pastries. Owners are so friendly and provide welcoming service. Everyone should go here for a great breakfast.
Outstanding! Fantastic service, fantastic food. Do yourself a favour and have the bbq venison salad, best meal I've had in Christchurch in a long long time....and great value for money.

Had Brunch here with 5 friends. Beautiful location, rustic/warm ambiance.  Everyone at the table enjoyed their food selection.  Personally, the Hollandaise sauce was delicious. Absolutely would come back to try another selection and sit by the water.

Excellent little cafe nestled right on the Avon River across the street from the hospital. This cafe became a little escape for me as my mom required unexpected surgery while we were visiting from the States. It was always very busy but I always somehow managed to grab a table on the patio. Most of the outdoor seating is covered but there were a few that weren't. I happily took one in the sun as I was growing tired of the hospital ward staleness. 

You order at the counter, get a number and have a seat. They have a large selection of pastries and pre made sandwiches as well as a large sit down menu. Soups, salads, sandwiches, fish. All kinds of good stuff. I didn't eat breakfast there but they have pancakes, eggs, etc. Food and drinks are brought out to you. Service was always friendly and very prompt. I was regularly surprised at how quickly my food came out despite how busy it was. 

Lamb burger was delicious. Freshest feta I've ever had and the beet compote type thing on it was delish. I could have eaten that alone as a side dish. My one gripe was that it also had mayo and tomato on it which wasn't stated on the menu. I hate when places don't list all the ingredients they plan to put on my sandwich. I HATE mayo so that was a bummer. Luckily it was mostly on the lettuce so I was able to get it mostly off :)

Another day I had the fish and chips. It was very clear that fish was probably swimming this morning. Yum yum yum fresh!
