My favorite by far was the chicken, pesto and Brie sandwich. Chicken was grilled perfectly and that pesto, oh that pesto! It puts other pestos to shame. Easily the best and most fresh pesto I've ever had. Swoon indeed. 

The coffees are great. Iced Americano and flat white both lovely.  

Wonderful place with wonderful staff and excellent food.
Awesome to sit in the Boatshed cafe and watch kayakers on the Avon. Delicious food and great service

This place is the best! Burgers were juicy, the beer battered fries were crispy and the strawberry lime shake was to die for! Blake's customer service was superb - he was so friendly and helpful. 10/10 recommend

Service is always really slow, even when it's a quiet night. Staff are more focused on what they look like, chef jackets, rather than the food. Oil from chips doesn't get drained long enough and chips are over salted.  Akaroa cod batter always sticks to the paper and is very soggy. Have given them three chances and each time they have failed! It use to be good value for money and fish and chips were really good. Since there have been new staff/owners there it has got worse.
Worst Pad Thai I've had. Sure it's a food court so expectations aren't high but even still...

We stopped by for dessert and were pleased with our choices. Salted-caramel chocolate cake and Passionfruit Orange Meringue Pie. The staff are super friendly and the cafe is clean and tidy. Decor is a bit dated, as is the music. There's only so much Christmas music we can handle

This café is absolutely wonderful and obviously a locals favorite. Amazing breakfasts, the Chicken BLT on Turkish bread is a winner and today had the lamb shank dinner, fabulous (and will be back to have again).  It's a few blocks from where I am staying on holiday and I have been to numerous places all over town, and I keep coming back here. The staff is friendly, helpful and always smiling. The food is consistently excellent and well priced.  I highly recommend.

THE WORST fish and chips we've had ever! 
- Fish: the fish was soggy and tasted terribly fishy (I know they say it's fresh if it's fishy but seriously not this fishy). The pieces 'seemed' large... but I think the batter bulked them up... 
- Batter on fish: the batter was all bubbly and thick... sooo thick... it soaked up so much oil that it it fell apart. On some parts of the fish, the batter was raw...
- Chips: chips were overcooked but thick cut, so they weren't terribly dry... but were very discoloured because they were overcooked.
- Battered sausage: Horrible... this huge sausage with thick batter... the sausage was the size of a large Bratwurst.
- Battered meat pattie: Gross.... I don't even know what this was... it was like 10% mince meat with 70% sausage meat with the leftover of flour paste... This wasn't pleasant at all...

Unfortunately, we threw 70% of this out because it was almost inedible. Price was okay at $33 in total, but no way at all was it quality for money.

This was my first attempt at trying a Bangladesh dish. And I must say it was bursting with flavor. I had the lamb and my God was it amazing.  My friend and I were moaning with each bite. If you visit Christchurch please visit. The cook is not a chef but promises fresh homemade dishes and that's what we got. We went back the next day for lunch.

I've been traveling in NZ for nearly a year, across both the North and South Island, and this restaurant is the most delicious place I have eaten anywhere in the country. I've gone to it several times at this point because the hospitality is so excellent and the food is incredible.

The owner is very passionate about their food, and it's obvious that he's in the business because he loves bringing joy into people's lives by providing a wonderful dining experience. 

He's happy to tell you about the food you're eating, such as how he would normally be eaten, or on what occasions, or how it differs from similar Indian dishes. For me that is a very wonderful addition to the meal, but if you are just looking for a place to consume your requisite nutrients and get on with your day then you should consider saving this restaurant for an occasion when you can give the experience the attention it deserves. 

Every time I have gone I have gotten one of the specials, which have variable names like "Chicken Special No.2," but they have consistently been the most delightful meals--ones that are not only tasty, but also complicated enough that you're glad you're not trying to make your own version in your own kitchen. The one I had on my previous visit was the best chicken dish which I have had in years. 

I highly recommend this place.

Went here because it promises authentic home cooked Bangladeshi food. However, having travelled in Bangladesh and knowing many Bangladeshis I was disappointed. The food took a long time to come - they kept saying it was cooked fresh but having to wait over 40 minutes for some simple starters isn't great. Most restaurants I go to cook their food fresh and it doesn't take that long. The quality of the food was also pretty poor - the fish cake starter was dry and lacked flavor, and my daughter had the chicken and rice which looked very unappetizing, tasted pretty mediocre, and was only lukewarm. When we complained about the long wait for the food the owner was rude and aggressive - both to us, and the the woman who was serving us -- he tried to blame her for the delay for some of our items by saying that she should have told us they were unavailable (even though they clearly were available because he delivered them to us five minutes later??!???). They have some work to do to improve the quality of their food and their service if they want to tempt me back. I would not recommend them and I would not eat here again. Very poor. I am sure the owner will respond and claim that we were unreasonable - ordinarily I would say go along and see for yourself, but I wouldn't wish this experience on anyone. The food is not worth it and the service sucks!!

My husband and I had lunch here. I was craving ramen and so I had the chicken ramen. It was delicious. My husband had the udon (I can't remember what meat he had with it). He said his was yummy!

There was inside seating. Pretty busy at the time. Seems like a lot of people bought there sushi boxes to take away, it must be their best seller.

Service was good and staff were friendly! Give them a try if you happen to be visiting Christchurch City Center in New Zealand.
Nice place for something casual and food was great. Portions were good. Would recommend.

A good Japanese restaurant with quick service and tasty food. They have good Japanese curry and dumplings, and food seems like it is served quickly. The restaurant is in a convenient location in Christchurch, and it is a very casual dining place.

This is not Japanese food. I ordered the N1 udon, and there was so much mayonnaise and teriyaki sauce the udon, vegetables and chicken was fully immersed in its. The salmon sashimi bento was horrible.  The slices were thick and had chewy parts that wasn't meant to be part of the sashimi.  The udon in the tempura udon is so soggy and soft, plus the soup was layered with oil from the chicken.  The salad was still cold from the hours that it's been frozen in the fridge.  I wouldn't recommend this to anyone. I thought food in New Zealand was supposed to be authentic.

We opted for sushi since we're originally from Hawaii and was craving raw fish! We ordered the rice bowl with salmon and sweet egg and a ramen bowl with chicken. It actually tasted pretty good. We also shared a salmon roll, this particular one had cream cheese in it, which I ended up not caring for. 

On another occasion we decided to try the sushi burger with chicken. It ended up being difficult to hold since the chicken was sliding out from between the two rice patties. There was a reason why they served it with a fork. 

I think the bowls were a little overpriced, but overall it was a decent option for Japanese food.
The verity at this restaurant his amazing, fresh and great qulity sushi it has a good vibe through the whole place. I strongly recommend this sushi.

I enjoyed the few times I went in here for either lunch or dinner.  I quickly got a favourite in the steak curry and boneless Japanese fried chicken.  The food was great and the staff are very friendly . Would defiantly go back again .

this is a Japanese restaurant but they don't serve ramen!!! So I ordered the Karaage (crispy chicken) Don. It was good but you need to drink water after this. This Don doesn't worth 12.9 dollars I think. But it still taste good!

Hachi hachi,is the best sushi in town,actually all the food I have tried there is amazing,the sushi was very fresh and tasty. love the Gyoza, Kakuni-don, and noodles! It was like the one I had in Japan. Staffs was o.k I go there quite often.The decorations of the place is also cool

This is a great and fast Japanese sit-down/take-out restaurant on Victoria Street. I stopped in around 7 with two others and there were plenty of seats available. We were really craving sushi, but unfortunately their sushi department is rather lacking and they aren't made fresh to order. I tried the Teppan Teriyaki Chicken Bento Value Set and the chicken was extremely tender. The rice was cooked okay and the miso soup was good, but the salad lacked any dressing. My husband and I also ordered edamame as well as our other friend and they only brough one order to us. After we explained it to them, it took about 10 minutes to get the other edamame and they had to verify with us 3 times that we actually did order two. My husband had the salmon ngiri which looked really fresh, and the Tori Tama (hot udon noodles with a fried egg and crispy chicken) which was really flavorful. I would come back for that! The restaurant serves beer (and even has a beer tower if you want to get crazy) and sake as well. This is definitely good for a casual, quick meal.

Whilst in Christchurch met up with my coworker's family here. Always nervous to try an un-yelped venue on the road, but we dove in!

Pretty interesting things on offer here, different from your typical sushi joint. A particularly interesting offer was the rice burgers. In place of a bun the burgers had a sicky rice cake. Sounded weird but totally worked. 

Bit of a letdown how few veg options were on offer here. They were also a bit inflexible on adding/subbing tofu to things, which I wasn't too pleased about. We veggie types need protein too!!!

I went for the tempura burger which was strangely delightful. Crunchy tempura in place of meat, with peri peri sauce. I have to admit I went back for a second I was so taken with it! Also got the agadashi tofu which was really nice. 

My dinner mates got some of the noodle bowls which looked beautiful with lots of different toppings. 

An interesting place, not sure I am dying to go back, except maybe for a rice burger from time to time!!

This is a pretty great bar located in The Palms. We came here for a group dinner and they had set aside the Oval Room for us that has TVs, a fireplace and seating for about 30 people. We had great service both from the wait staff and at the bar when we needed to order drinks. 

I ordered the Chicken stonegrill which had a sort of teriyaki marinade on it with a garden salad and mashed potatoes. The chicken was also served with three different dipping sauces including a sweet and sour, ranch and chipotle mayo. I preferred the chipotle mayo. The chicken cooks very quickly and is easy to overdo, so be sure to monitor it closely. My husband ordered the Canterbury Fillet stonegrill which he cooked to about medium rare before pulling them off the grill. This also cooks very quickly! His sides were the seasonal veges and kumara mash. We both finished our entire plates. 

This location does trivia on thursdays, also in the oval room, and absolutely requires a booking at least a few days in advance (if not more). This is different from most trivia venues because it is in an intimate setting with only so many spaces for players. There is also a second story seating level at this bar and patio seating outdoors (with heat lamps). Overall, great spot, great experience!

Wouldn't serve me a beer even though I'm 27, 6"7' and had my California drivers license. They did however serve my cousin without checking his ID who's is 1 year older than me. Guess facial hair is the key to getting a beer around here. Food was bland and waitresses were intrusive. Not recommending to anyone.

Had a great meal with my family here. Staff was very attentive. Food was above average. Son had the best chicken sandwich he's had in NZ. The fish and chips were excellent. Caesar salad with a poached egg had nice quality lettuce and delicious dressing. Eggs Benedict was great. If you are American you might want to ask for your bacon to be crispy instead of streaky. I wouldn't travel to eat here, but as a place that was on the way it was good.
We loved it! Great atmosphere, live music, great beer and wine. Kids menu was perfect, food was all great!  Highly recommend if you like a sports bar atmosphere with great food and drinks.
Went in at 5pm for a pint OF COKE(!) and was IDd by a rude barman with no people skills. Expensive, no atmosphere, don't bother going.
The Halloween themed party was very fitting last night considering the place was basically dead. They do make a pretty alright Pizza and for that I'll give it 2 stars.
Its a nice pub with a good vibe. Its good for a quick bite to eat if you are in the area but the food is not all that good in my opinion pretty bland flavors. mediocre at best

Reviewing on visiting during a pre lunch week day.
Popped in for a couple of beers and to meet up with a mate .
First time along pleasant spacious bar like surroundings.
Staff cheery and service ideal .
Guinness on tap a favourite.
Look forward to popping in again soon.
Cheers

I find the only good time to go drinking in this bar is when it's quiet, otherwise the bar staff can't seem to serve quick enough. 

Food is only average (very greasy), however their Cesar Salad is lovely and if you fancy a savage Stone Grill then this is the place to go.
Good local place that has bento boxes. Good value. Great location. I wish these joints had bottomless sodas, but that must be an American thing.

I had ramen and donburi
The ramen was too salty and Donburi was not bad.
The most of service was self
This place is an all around no for me. The only half decent thing on the menu is their steak and  cheese curry but it's really heavy. Don't even bother with the new Ramen either.

It was a great choice on a cold and rainy day. We got:

Salmon sashimi- 5 pieces for 10NZD. It didn't look super fatty or fresh but it tasted fine, an average piece of salmon.

Pork Katsu Curry- very thick portion of pork. The crust was crispy, generous portion of rice, and lots of curry sauce. 

Karagi donburi- the flavor went through the batter and into the chicken, crispy, and juicy pieces. A good choice if you're feenin' for fried chicken.


Also happy hour choices on their appetizers and drinks from 5-7 I believe.
Good tasting ramen! And good customer service! Love the tonkatsu ramen and shoyu ramen and kumara chips !

i love the mcchicken burger in the morning. it helps me to wake up and enjoy my day like its cocaine 10/10 would bang except you have to wear a tux when u go wwhich is a bit rude i dont like that much

thnx bby

A Regrettable Experience at McDonald's

A visit to the McDonald's on Memorial Ave has left much to be desired. The moment I stepped inside, it was clear that the level of service wasn't up to standard.

The first problem arose at the ordering counter, where it was like they didn't give a damn or cared to take care of customers. It seemed to be as if my being there was a nuisance for them. Although the service lacked oomph, I pushed ahead with my order because I hoped that there'd be a surprise waiting for me on the platter.

Unfortunately, this was not to be. The company's character would be the inedible food. The fries were lukewarm and soggywhich certainly was a far cry from the hot, crisp standard I've come to expect of other golden arches. The burger was no better, smashed together and rather lifeless.

Another problem plaguing this McDonald's was cleanliness. Tables were abandoned to patrons past, covered with crumbs and spills. The overall hygiene of the dining area was suspect, and I have my doubts about how clean the kitchen or food preparation areas were.

Also, the restroom was hardly attractive. It was dirty, there were bad odors and visible dirt; it needed immediate attention. Those conditions are something a fast-food restaurant, never mind one as big and globalized as McDonald's ought to be able to prevent.

Finally, my visit to this McDonald's was one I would regret. Service overall was indifferent; food quality poor and cleanliness ignored. I hope that the management takes steps to resolve these problems and help restore McDonald's reputation, which it has been building over decades. And right now, I cannot pinpoint this particular location and tell others to try it if they want a positive experience with fast food.

- Josh Nuzak

As someone visiting from Los Angles, CA... this McDonald's makes our McDonald's look like s*#t! Seriously...I never eat McDonald's back home because it looks disgusting and doesn't taste fresh. NZ has it good with McDonald's lol This place has self service machines to send in your order and to customize it! Also super clean, can't say much about staff since I order by machine BUT service is quick.

Giving this place anything try after the first disappointment. Got the Gyoza dumplings, they were obviously frozen and fell apart when picked up with chopsticks. Full of water inside... I don't know why.

Also ordered the pork miso ramen, one of my favourite dishes. The miso broth was bald, the ramen noodles were over cooked, the bamboo shoots tasted horrible. Somehow the managed to burn the pork, why do you burn pork???????

Two stars for the pretty waitress.
